 11630                                  ;============================================================================
 11631                                  ; CRIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 11632                                  ;============================================================================
 11633                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11634                                  
 11635                                  ; Critical Section Routines
 11636                                  
 11637                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:513Ah
 11638                                  
 11639                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11640                                  ; DOSCODE:5126h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11641                                  
 11642                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11643                                  ; Each handler must leave everything untouched; including flags!
 11644                                  ;
 11645                                  ; Sleaze for time savings: first instruction is a return. This is patched
 11646                                  ; by the sharer to be a PUSH AX to complete the correct routines.
 11647                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11648                                  
 11649                                  ; (DOSMAC.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 11650                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11651                                  ; Some old versions of the 80286 have a bug in the chip. The popf instruction
 11652                                  ; will enable interrupts. Therefore in a section of code with interrupts
 11653                                  ; disabled and you need a popf instruction use the 'popff' macro instead.
 11654                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11655                                  
 11656                                  ;%macro POPFF 0
 11657                                  ;	jmp	$+3
 11658                                  ;	iret
 11659                                  ;	push	cs
 11660                                  ;	call	$-2
 11661                                  ;%endmacro
 11662                                  
 11663                                  ; ---------------------------
 11664                                  
 11665                                  ; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11666                                  %if 0
 11667                                  
 11668                                  ;Procedure  ECritDisk,NEAR
 11669                                  	;public  ECritMEM
 11670                                  	;public  ECritSFT
 11671                                  ECritMEM:
 11672                                  ECritSFT:
 11673                                  ;
 11674                                  ECritDisk:
 11675                                  
 11676                                  ;SR; Check if critical section is to be entered
 11677                                  
 11678                                  	pushf
 11679                                  	cmp	byte [ss:redir_patch],0
 11680                                  	jz	short ECritDisk_2
 11681                                  
 11682                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11683                                  ;	;popff  ; * (macro)
 11684                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_1 ; *
 11685                                  ;
 11686                                  ;ECritDisk_iret: ; *
 11687                                  ;	iret ; *
 11688                                  
 11689                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11690                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11691                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_1
 11692                                  	; 06/11/2022
 11693                                  ;ECritDisk_iret:
 11694                                  ;	iret	
 11695                                  
 11696                                  	; 06/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11697                                  ECritDisk_1:
 11698                                  	push	cs ; *
 11699                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret ; *		
 11700                                  	
 11701                                  ECritDisk_0:
 11702                                  	PUSH    AX
 11703                                  	;MOV	AX,8000h+critDisk
 11704                                  	;INT	int_IBM
 11705                                  	mov	ax,8001h
 11706                                  	int	2Ah	; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11707                                  			; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11708                                  	POP     AX
 11709                                  	retn
 11710                                  
 11711                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11712                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11713                                  ECritDisk_iret:  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11714                                  LCritDisk_iret: 
 11715                                  	iret
 11716                                  
 11717                                  ECritDisk_2:
 11718                                  	;;popff ; *
 11719                                  	;;retn
 11720                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_3 ; *
 11721                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2: ; *
 11722                                  ;	iret
 11723                                  	
 11724                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11725                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11726                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_3
 11727                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2:
 11728                                  	;iret
 11729                                  
 11730                                  ECritDisk_3:
 11731                                  	push    cs ; *
 11732                                  	; 13/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11733                                  	;call	ECritDisk_iret2 ; *
 11734                                  	;retn
 11735                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11736                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret
 11737                                  	retn
 11738                                  
 11739                                  ;EndProc ECritDisk

 11911                                  	retn
 11912                                  
 11913                                  ;LCritDevice_iret:  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 11914                                  ;	iret
 11915                                  
 11916                                  LCritDevice_2:
 11917                                  	;;popff ; *
 11918                                  	;;retn
 11919                                  ;	jmp	short LCritDevice_3 ; *
 11920                                  ;LCritDevice_iret2: ; *
 11921                                  ;	iret
 11922                                  
 11923                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11924                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11925                                  	;jmp	short LCritDevice_3
 11926                                  ;LCritDevice_iret2:
 11927                                  	;iret
 11928                                  
 11929                                  LCritDevice_3:
 11930                                  	push    cs ; *
 11931                                  	; 13/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11932                                  	;call	LCritDevice_iret2 ; *
 11933                                  	;retn
 11934                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11935                                  	call	LCritDevice_iret
 11936                                  	retn
 11937                                  
 11938                                  ;EndProc LCritDevice
 11939                                  
 11940                                  %endif
 11941

 12117                                  ;============================================================================
 12118                                  ; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)

 12120                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 by Erdogan Tan, 04/05/2019
 12121                                  
 12122                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12123                                  
 12124                                  ;**	Standard device IO for MSDOS (first 12 function calls)
 12125                                  ;
 12126                                  ;	TITLE	IBMCPMIO - device IO for MSDOS
 12127                                  ;	NAME	IBMCPMIO
 12128                                  
 12129                                  ;	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 12130                                  ;
 12131                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 12132                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Output
 12133                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Input
 12134                                  ;	$RawConIO
 12135                                  ;	$RawConInput
 12136                                  ;	RAWOUT
 12137                                  ;	RAWOUT2
 12138                                  ;
 12139                                  
 12140                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 12141                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 12142                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 12143                                  
 12144                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12145                                  
 12146                                  ;	TITLE	CPMIO2 - device IO for MSDOS
 12147                                  ;	NAME	CPMIO2
 12148                                  
 12149                                  ;
 12150                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 12151                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 12152                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 12153                                  ;
 12154                                  
 12155                                  ;**	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 12156                                  ;
 12157                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input
 12158                                  ;	$Std_Con_Output
 12159                                  ;	OUTT
 12160                                  ;	TAB
 12161                                  ;	BUFOUT
 12162                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Input
 12163                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Output
 12164                                  ;	$Std_Printer_Output
 12165                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Status
 12166                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Flush
 12167                                  ;
 12168                                  ;	Revision History:
 12169                                  ;
 12170                                  ;	  AN000	 version 4.00 - Jan. 1988
 12171                                  
 12172                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 12173                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 12174                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 12175                                  
 12176                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 12177                                  ;	ASSUME	SS:DOSDATA,CS:DOSCODE
 12178                                  
 12179                                  
 12180                                  ;hkn; 	All the variables use SS override or DS. Therefore there is
 12181                                  ;hkn;	no need to specifically set up any seg regs unless SS assumption is
 12182                                  ;hkn;	not valid. 
 12183                                  
 12184                                  ; DOSCODE:51BAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12185                                  ; 08/11/2022
 12186                                  ; DOSCODE:51A6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 12187                                  
 12188                                  ;
 12189                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12190                                  ;
 12191                                  ; Procedure : $Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 12192                                  ;
 12193                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12194                                  ;
 12195                                  
 12196                                  _$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO:   ;System call 8
 12197                                  
 12198                                  ; Inputs:
 12199                                  ;	None
 12200                                  ; Function:
 12201                                  ;	Input character from console, no echo
 12202                                  ; Returns:
 12203                                  ;	AL = character
 12204                                  
 12205 00001942 1E                      	push	ds
 12206 00001943 56                      	push	si
 12207                                  INTEST:
 12208 00001944 E87345                  	call	STATCHK
 12209 00001947 753A                    	jnz	short GET ; 08/09/2018
 12210                                  ;*************************************************************************
 12211                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12212 00001949 36803E[A00A]00          	cmp	byte [SS:PRINTER_FLAG],0  ; is printer idle?
 12213 0000194F 7505                    	jnz	short no_sys_wait
 12214 00001951 B405                    	mov	ah,5			; get input status with system wait
 12215 00001953 E87937                  	call	IOFUNC
 12216                                  no_sys_wait:
 12217                                  ;**************************************************************************
 12218 00001956 B484                    	MOV	AH,84h		; (Microsoft Networks - KEYBOARD BUSY LOOP)
 12219 00001958 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM	 ; int 2Ah
 12220                                  
 12221                                  ;;; 7/15/86  update the date in the idle loop
 12222                                  ;;; Dec 19, 1986 D.C.L. changed following CMP to Byte Ptr from Word Ptr
 12223                                  ;;;;		 to shorten loop in consideration of the PC Convertible
 12224                                  
 12225                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12226 0000195A 36803E[BD0D]FF          	CMP	byte [SS:DATE_FLAG],-1	; date is updated may be every
 12227 00001960 751A                    	JNZ	short NoUpdate		; 65535 x ? ms if no one calls
 12228                                  
 12229 00001962 50                      	PUSH	AX
 12230 00001963 53                      	PUSH	BX			; following is tricky,
 12231 00001964 51                      	PUSH	CX			; it may be called by critical handler
 12232 00001965 52                      	PUSH	DX			; at that time, DEVCALL is used by
 12233                                  					; other's READ or WRITE
 12234 00001966 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save DS = SFT's segment
 12235                                  
 12236                                  ;hkn; READTIME must use ds = DOSDATA
 12237                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			; READTIME must use DS=CS
 12238                                  
 12239 00001967 16                      	PUSH	SS ; 04/05/2019
 12240 00001968 1F                      	POP	DS
 12241                                  
 12242                                  	;MOV	AX,0			; therefore, we save DEVCALL
 12243                                  	; 26/06/2024
 12244 00001969 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 12245 0000196B E89A02                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; save DEVCALL packet
 12246                                  	;invoke	READTIME		; readtime
 12247 0000196E E819F2                  	call	READTIME
 12248 00001971 B80100                  	MOV	AX,1
 12249 00001974 E89102                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; restore DEVCALL packet
 12250                                  
 12251                                  ;	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, Offset 1F8Ch)
 12252                                  ;	; (MSDOS 6.0 code does not contain IBM DOS FETCHI_TAG check)
 12253                                  ;	push	bx
 12254                                  ;	mov	bx,DATE_FLAG
 12255                                  ;	add	bx,2  ; mov bx,FETCHI_FLAG
 12256                                  ;	cmp	word [cs:bx],5872h
 12257                                  ;	jz	short FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok
 12258                                  ;	call	DOSINIT
 12259                                  ;FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok:
 12260                                  ;	pop	bx
 12261                                  
 12262 00001977 1F                      	POP	DS			; restore DS
 12263 00001978 5A                      	POP	DX
 12264 00001979 59                      	POP	CX
 12265 0000197A 5B                      	POP	BX
 12266 0000197B 58                      	POP	AX
 12267                                  NoUpdate:
 12268                                  
 12269                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12270 0000197C 36FF06[BD0D]            	INC	word [SS:DATE_FLAG]
 12271                                  
 12272                                  ;;; 7/15/86 ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 12273 00001981 EBC1                    	JMP	short INTEST
 12274                                  GET:
 12275 00001983 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 12276 00001985 E84737                  	call	IOFUNC
 12277 00001988 5E                      	POP	SI
 12278 00001989 1F                      	POP	DS
 12279                                  ;;; 7/15/86
 12280                                  
 12281                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12282                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12283 0000198A 36C606[BC0D]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],0
 12284                                  	;
 12285 00001990 3C00                    	CMP	AL,0	    ; extended code ( AL )
 12286 00001992 7505                    	JNZ	short noscan
 12287                                  
 12288                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12289                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],1 ; set this flag for ALT_Q key
 12290                                  	; 20/06/2023
 12291 00001994 36FE06[BC0D]            	inc	byte [SS:SCAN_FLAG]
 12292                                  noscan:
 12293 00001999 C3                      	retn
 12294                                  ;
 12295                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12296                                  ;
 12297                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT - Console String Output
 12298                                  ;
 12299                                  ;
 12300                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) Point to output string '$' terminated
 12301                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12302                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12303                                  ;
 12304                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12305                                  ;
 12306                                  
 12307                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT:	;System call 9
 12308 0000199A 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12309                                  STRING_OUT1:	
 12310 0000199C AC                      	lodsb
 12311 0000199D 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 12312 0000199F 74F8                    	je	short noscan
 12313                                  NEXT_STR1:
 12314 000019A1 E88D02                  	call	OUTT
 12315 000019A4 EBF6                    	jmp	short STRING_OUT1
 12316                                  
 12317                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12318                                  ;
 12319                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT - Input Line from Console
 12320                                  ;
 12321                                  ;	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT Fills a buffer from console input until CR
 12322                                  ;
 12323                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = input buffer
 12324                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12325                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12326                                  ;
 12327                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12328                                  
 12329                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12330                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:58D4h
 12331                                  
 12332                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT:		;System call 10
 12333                                  
 12334                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12335                                  	;mov	ax,ss
 12336                                  	;mov	es,ax
 12337 000019A6 16                      	push	ss
 12338 000019A7 07                      	pop	es
 12339                                  
 12340 000019A8 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12341 000019AA 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 12342 000019AC AD                      	lodsw
 12343                                  
 12344                                  ;	(AL) = the buffer length
 12345                                  ;	(AH) = the template length
 12346                                  
 12347 000019AD 08C0                            or	al,al
 12348 000019AF 74E8                            jz	short noscan	;Buffer is 0 length!!?
 12349 000019B1 88E3                    	mov	bl,ah		;Init template counter
 12350 000019B3 88EF                            mov	bh,ch		;Init template counter
 12351                                  
 12352                                  ;	(BL) = the number of bytes in the template
 12353                                  
 12354 000019B5 38D8                            cmp	al,bl
 12355 000019B7 7605                            jbe	short NOEDIT	;If length of buffer inconsistent with contents
 12356 000019B9 80380D                          cmp	byte [bx+si],c_CR ; 0Dh
 12357 000019BC 7402                            jz	short EDITON	;If CR correctly placed EDIT is OK
 12358                                  
 12359                                  ; The number of chars in the template is >= the number of chars in buffer or
 12360                                  ; there is no CR at the end of the template. This is an inconsistant state
 12361                                  ; of affairs. Pretend that the template was empty:
 12362                                  ;
 12363                                  
 12364                                  NOEDIT:	
 12365 000019BE 88EB                    	mov	bl,ch		;Reset buffer
 12366                                  EDITON: 
 12367 000019C0 88C2                    	mov	dl,al
 12368 000019C2 4A                      	dec	dx		;DL is # of bytes we can put in the buffer
 12369                                  
 12370                                  ;	Top level. We begin to read a line in.
 12371                                  
 12372                                  NEWLIN: 
 12373 000019C3 36A0[F901]              	mov	al,[SS:CARPOS]
 12374 000019C7 36A2[FA01]              	mov	[SS:STARTPOS],al ;Remember position in raw buffer
 12375                                  
 12376 000019CB 56                      	push	si
 12377 000019CC BF[FB01]                	mov	di,INBUF ;Build the new line here
 12378 000019CF 36882E[7905]            	mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],ch ;Insert mode off
 12379 000019D4 88EF                    	mov	bh,ch		;No chars from template yet
 12380 000019D6 88EE                    	mov	dh,ch		;No chars to new line yet
 12381 000019D8 E867FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO ;Get first char
 12382 000019DB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,c_LF		; 0Ah	;Linefeed 
 12383 000019DD 7503                    	jnz	short GOTCH
 12384                                  
 12385                                  ;	This is the main loop of reading in a character and processing it.
 12386                                  ;
 12387                                  ;	(BH) = the index of the next byte in the template
 12388                                  ;	(BL) = the length of the template
 12389                                  ;	(DH) = the number of bytes in the buffer
 12390                                  ;	(DL) = the length of the buffer
 12391                                  
 12392                                  GETCH:
 12393 000019DF E860FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 12394                                  GOTCH:
 12395                                  ;
 12396                                  ; Brain-damaged Tim Patterson ignored ^F in case his BIOS did not flush the
 12397                                  ; input queue.
 12398                                  ;
 12399 000019E2 3C06                            cmp	al,"F"-"@"  ; CMP AL, 6  ; Ignore ^F
 12400 000019E4 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH
 12401                                  
 12402                                  ;	If the leading char is the function-key lead byte
 12403                                  
 12404                                  	;cmp	al,[SS:ESCCHAR]
 12405                                  
 12406                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12407                                  
 12408                                  ;hkn; 	ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE)
 12409                                  
 12410 000019E6 2E3A06[940A]            	CMP	AL,[cs:ESCCHAR]
 12411 000019EB 7439                            jz	short ESCAPE	;change reserved keyword DBM 5-7-87
 12412                                  
 12413                                  ;	Rubout and ^H are both destructive backspaces.
 12414                                  
 12415 000019ED 3C7F                            cmp	al,c_DEL ; 7FH
 12416                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12417                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12418 000019EF 7466                    	je	short BACKSP
 12419 000019F1 3C08                    	cmp	al,c_BS  ; 8
 12420                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12421                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12422 000019F3 7462                    	je	short BACKSP
 12423                                  
 12424                                  	; 04/05/2019 -	MSDOS 6.0, also MSDOS 6.21 has bug (bullshit) here.
 12425                                  	;		Two NOPs -instead of a JMP short, as two bytes-
 12426                                  	;	   	after CMP and a CMP again!
 12427                                  	;		
 12428                                  	;		-It would be better if they use a 'JMP short' to 
 12429                                  	;	      	DOSCODE:5279h from DOSCODE:5271h and leave NOPs
 12430                                  	;		between them. Then, they would be able use a patch
 12431                                  	;		between 5271h and 5279h when if it will be required.
 12432                                  	;		I think Tim Patterson would not do this CMP mistake!-
 12433                                  	;	
 12434                                  	; (MSDOS.SYS, from DOSCODE:5271h to DOSCODE:5279h)
 12435                                  
 12436                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12437                                  	;
 12438                                  	; (Note: nops below might be used for patching code for Windows 3.1)
 12439                                  
 12440                                  ;DOSCODE:526D	cmp     al, 8
 12441                                  ;DOSCODE:526F	jz      short BACKSPJ
 12442                                  ;DOSCODE:5271	cmp     al, 17h
 12443                                  ;DOSCODE:5273	nop
 12444                                  ;DOSCODE:5274	nop
 12445                                  ;DOSCODE:5275	cmp     al, 15h
 12446                                  ;DOSCODE:5277	nop
 12447                                  ;DOSCODE:5278	nop
 12448                                  ;DOSCODE:5279	cmp     al, 0Dh
 12449                                  ;DOSCODE:527B	jz      short ENDLIN
 12450                                  ;DOSCODE:527D	cmp     al, 0Ah
 12451                                  ;DOSCODE:527F	jz      short PHYCRLF
 12452                                  	
 12453                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12454                                  	; DOSCODE:525Dh
 12455                                  
 12456                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12457                                  %if 0
 12458                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12459                                  ;	^W deletes backward once and then backs up until a letter is before the
 12460                                  ;	cursor
 12461                                  
 12462                                  	CMP     AL,"W"-"@" ; 17h
 12463                                  
 12464                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12465                                  ;	cause ^W to backup a word.
 12466                                  
 12467                                  ;***	JZ	short WordDel
 12468                                  	NOP
 12469                                  	NOP
 12470                                  
 12471                                  	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h
 12472

 12474                                  ;	cause ^U to clear a line.

 12477                                  	NOP
 12478                                  	NOP
 12479                                  
 12480                                  %endif
 12481                                  
 12482                                  ;	CR terminates the line.
 12483                                  
 12484 000019F5 3C0D                            cmp	al,c_CR ; 0Dh
 12485 000019F7 7430                            jz	short ENDLIN
 12486                                  
 12487                                  ;	LF goes to a new line and keeps on reading.
 12488

 12490 000019FB 7442                    	jz	short PHYCRLF
 12491                                  
 12492                                  ;	^X (or ESC) deletes the line and starts over
 12493                                  
 12494                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 12495                                  	;cmp	al,[ss:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12496                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12497                                  
 12498                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 12499                                  
 12500                                  ;hkn; 	CANCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 12501

 12503 00001A02 7440                    	jz	short KILNEW
 12504                                  	
 12505                                  	;cmp	al,CANCEL ; 1Bh	; Retro DOS v3.0
 12506                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12507                                  
 12508                                  ; Otherwise, we save the input character.
 12509                                  
 12510                                  SAVCH:

 12512 00001A06 7317                    	jnb	short BUFFUL		; buffer is full.
 12513 00001A08 AA                              stosb
 12514 00001A09 FEC6                    	inc	dh                      ; increment count in buffer.
 12515 00001A0B E8B702                  	call	BUFOUT			; Print control chars nicely
 12516                                  
 12517 00001A0E 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0
 12518 00001A14 75C9                    	jnz	short GETCH		; insertmode => don't advance template
 12519 00001A16 38DF                            cmp	bh,bl
 12520 00001A18 73C5                            jnb	short GETCH		; no more characters in template
 12521 00001A1A 46                              inc	si                      ; Skip to next char in template
 12522 00001A1B FEC7                            inc	bh                      ; remember position in template
 12523 00001A1D EBC0                            jmp	short GETCH
 12524                                  
 12525                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12526                                  ;BACKSPJ: 
 12527                                  	;jmp	short BACKSP
 12528                                  
 12529                                  BUFFUL:

 12531 00001A21 E80D02                  	call	OUTT
 12532 00001A24 EBB9                    	jmp	short GETCH
 12533                                  
 12534                                  ESCAPE: 
 12535                                  	;transfer OEMFunctionKey
 12536 00001A26 E996F0                  	JMP	OEMFunctionKey		; let the OEM's handle the key dispatch
 12537                                  
 12538                                  ENDLIN:
 12539 00001A29 AA                              stosb				; Put the CR in the buffer
 12540 00001A2A E80402                  	call	OUTT                    ; Echo it
 12541 00001A2D 5F                              pop	di                      ; Get start of user buffer
 12542 00001A2E 8875FF                          mov	[di-1], dh		; Tell user how many bytes
 12543 00001A31 FEC6                            inc	dh			; DH is length including CR
 12544                                  
 12545                                  COPYNEW:
 12546                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 2.0, STRIN.ASM)
 12547                                  	;mov	bp, es
 12548                                  	;mov	bx, ds
 12549                                  	;mov	es, bx
 12550                                  	;mov	ds, bp
 12551                                  	;mov	si, INBUF
 12552                                  	;mov	cl, dh
 12553                                  	;rep	movsb
 12554                                  	;retn
 12555                                  
 12556                                  	; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0)
 12557                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 3.3, Offset 2061h) 
 12558                                  	;SAVE	<DS,ES>
 12559 00001A33 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 12560 00001A34 06                      	PUSH	ES
 12561                                  	;RESTORE <DS,ES>		; XCHG ES,DS
 12562 00001A35 1F                      	POP	DS
 12563 00001A36 07                      	POP	ES
 12564                                  
 12565                                  ;;hkn; INBUF is in DOSDATA

 12567 00001A3A 88F1                            MOV     CL,DH                   ; set up count
 12568 00001A3C F3A4                            REP     MOVSB                   ; Copy final line to user buffer
 12569                                  OLDBAK_RETN:
 12570 00001A3E C3                              RETN
 12571                                  
 12572                                  ;	Output a CRLF to the user screen and do NOT store it into the buffer
 12573                                  
 12574                                  PHYCRLF:

 12576 00001A42 EB9B                            JMP	short GETCH
 12577                                  
 12578                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3, IBMDOS.COM, 1987)
 12579

 12581

 12592                                  %if 0

 12609                                  ;	Call    BackSpace               ; backspace the one spot
 12610                                  ;	OR      DH,DH

 12624

 12651                                  ; DOSCODE:52F3h (MSDOS 621, MSDOS.SYS)
 12652                                  
 12653                                  ; The user wants to throw away what he's typed in and wants to start over.
 12654                                  ; We print the backslash and then go to the next line and tab to the correct
 12655                                  ; spot to begin the buffered input.
 12656                                  
 12657                                  KILNEW:
 12658 00001A44 B05C                            mov	al,'\'
 12659 00001A46 E8E801                          call	OUTT            ;Print the CANCEL indicator
 12660 00001A49 5E                              pop	si		;Remember start of edit buffer
 12661                                  PUTNEW:
 12662 00001A4A E81001                  	call	CRLF            ;Go to next line on screen
 12663 00001A4D 36A0[FA01]              	mov	al,[SS:STARTPOS]
 12664 00001A51 E85102                  	call	TAB             ;Tab over
 12665 00001A54 E96CFF                          JMP     NEWLIN		;Start over again
 12666                                  
 12667                                  ;	Destructively back up one character position
 12668                                  
 12669                                  BACKSP:
 12670                                  	; 09/09/2018
 12671 00001A57 E80800                  	Call    BackSpace
 12672 00001A5A EB83                    	JMP     short GETCH	; 15/01/2024
 12673                                  
 12674                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12675                                  ;User really wants an ESC character in his line
 12676                                  TWOESC:	
 12677 00001A5C 2EA0[940A]              	mov	al,[cs:ESCCHAR] ; 10/06/2019
 12678 00001A60 EBA2                    	jmp	short SAVCH
 12679                                  
 12680                                  BackSpace:
 12681 00001A62 08F6                    	or	dh,dh
 12682 00001A64 7419                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;No chars in line, do nothing to line
 12683 00001A66 E85800                  	call	BACKUP          ;Do the backup
 12684 00001A69 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di]	;Get the deleted char
 12685 00001A6C 3C20                            cmp	al,20h	; ' '
 12686 00001A6E 730F                    	jnb	short OLDBAK	;Was a normal char
 12687 00001A70 3C09                            cmp	al,c_HT ; 9
 12688 00001A72 741B                    	jz	short BAKTAB	;Was a tab, fix up users display
 12689                                  ;; 9/27/86 fix for ctrl-U backspace
 12690 00001A74 3C15                    	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h ; ctrl-U is a section symbol not ^U
 12691 00001A76 7407                    	JZ	short OLDBAK
 12692 00001A78 3C14                           	CMP     AL,"T"-"@" ; 14h ; ctrl-T is a paragraphs symbol not ^T
 12693 00001A7A 7403                    	JZ	short OLDBAK
 12694                                  ;; 9/27/86 fix for ctrl-U backspace
 12695 00001A7C E84500                          call	BACKMES         ;Was a control char, zap the '^'
 12696                                  OLDBAK:
 12697 00001A7F 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0
 12698 00001A85 75B7                    	jnz	short OLDBAK_RETN ;In insert mode, done
 12699 00001A87 08FF                    	or	bh,bh
 12700 00001A89 74B3                            jz	short OLDBAK_RETN 
 12701                                  				;Not advanced in template, stay where we are
 12702 00001A8B FECF                    	dec	bh		;Go back in template
 12703 00001A8D 4E                              dec	si
 12704 00001A8E C3                      	retn
 12705                                  BAKTAB:
 12706 00001A8F 57                              push	di
 12707 00001A90 4F                              dec	di		;Back up one char
 12708 00001A91 FD                              std			;Go backward
 12709 00001A92 88F1                            mov	cl,dh		;Number of chars currently in line
 12710 00001A94 B020                            mov	al,20h	; ' '
 12711 00001A96 53                              push	bx
 12712 00001A97 B307                            mov	bl,7		;Max
 12713 00001A99 E30E                            jcxz	FIGTAB		;At start, do nothing
 12714                                  FNDPOS:
 12715 00001A9B AE                              scasb			;Look back
 12716 00001A9C 7609                    	jbe	short CHKCNT
 12717 00001A9E 26807D0109              	cmp	byte [es:di+1],9
 12718 00001AA3 7409                    	jz	short HAVTAB	;Found a tab
 12719 00001AA5 FECB                    	dec	bl		;Back one char if non tab control char
 12720                                  CHKCNT:
 12721 00001AA7 E2F2                            loop	FNDPOS
 12722                                  FIGTAB:		
 12723 00001AA9 362A1E[FA01]            	sub	bl,[SS:STARTPOS]
 12724                                  HAVTAB:
 12725 00001AAE 28F3                    	sub	bl,dh
 12726 00001AB0 00D9                    	add	cl,bl
 12727 00001AB2 80E107                  	and	cl,7		;CX has correct number to erase
 12728 00001AB5 FC                      	cld			;Back to normal
 12729 00001AB6 5B                      	pop	bx
 12730 00001AB7 5F                      	pop	di
 12731 00001AB8 74C5                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;Nothing to erase
 12732                                  TABBAK:
 12733 00001ABA E80700                  	call	BACKMES
 12734 00001ABD E2FB                    	loop	TABBAK		;Erase correct number of chars
 12735 00001ABF EBBE                    	jmp	short OLDBAK
 12736                                  
 12737                                  BACKUP:
 12738 00001AC1 FECE                            dec	dh		;Back up in line
 12739 00001AC3 4F                              dec	di
 12740                                  BACKMES:
 12741 00001AC4 B008                            mov	al,c_BS ; 8	;Backspace
 12742 00001AC6 E86801                          call	OUTT
 12743 00001AC9 B020                            mov	al,20h ; ' '	;Erase
 12744 00001ACB E86301                          call	OUTT
 12745 00001ACE B008                            mov	al,c_BS ; 8	;Backspace
 12746 00001AD0 E95E01                  	jmp	OUTT		;Done
 12747                                  
 12748                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12749                                  ;User really wants an ESC character in his line
 12750                                  ;TWOESC:	
 12751                                  ;	mov	al,[cs:ESCCHAR] ; 10/06/2019
 12752                                  ;	jmp	SAVCH
 12753                                  
 12754                                  ;Copy the rest of the template
 12755                                  COPYLIN:
 12756 00001AD3 88D9                            mov	cl,bl		;Total size of template
 12757 00001AD5 28F9                    	sub	cl,bh		;Minus position in template, is number to move
 12758 00001AD7 EB07                            jmp	short COPYEACH
 12759                                  
 12760                                  COPYSTR:
 12761 00001AD9 E83200                  	call	FINDOLD         ;Find the char
 12762 00001ADC EB02                    	jmp	short COPYEACH  ;Copy up to it
 12763                                  
 12764                                  ;Copy one char from template to line
 12765                                  COPYONE:
 12766 00001ADE B101                            mov	cl,1
 12767                                  ;Copy CX chars from template to line
 12768                                  COPYEACH:
 12769 00001AE0 36C606[7905]00                  mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],0	;All copies turn off insert mode
 12770 00001AE6 38D6                    	cmp	dh,dl
 12771 00001AE8 740F                            jz	short GETCH2		;At end of line, can't do anything
 12772 00001AEA 38DF                            cmp	bh,bl
 12773 00001AEC 740B                            jz	short GETCH2		;At end of template, can't do anything
 12774 00001AEE AC                              lodsb
 12775 00001AEF AA                              stosb
 12776 00001AF0 E8D201                  	call	BUFOUT
 12777 00001AF3 FEC7                            inc	bh			;Ahead in template
 12778 00001AF5 FEC6                            inc	dh			;Ahead in line
 12779 00001AF7 E2E7                            loop	COPYEACH
 12780                                  GETCH2:
 12781 00001AF9 E9E3FE                          jmp	GETCH
 12782                                  
 12783                                  ;Skip one char in template
 12784                                  SKIPONE:
 12785 00001AFC 38DF                    	cmp	bh,bl
 12786 00001AFE 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH2		;At end of template
 12787 00001B00 FEC7                    	inc	bh			;Ahead in template
 12788 00001B02 46                      	inc	si
 12789                                          ;jmp	GETCH
 12790                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12791 00001B03 EBF4                    	jmp	short GETCH2
 12792                                  
 12793                                  SKIPSTR:
 12794 00001B05 E80600                  	call	FINDOLD                 ;Find out how far to go
 12795 00001B08 01CE                            add	si,cx			;Go there
 12796 00001B0A 00CF                            add	bh,cl
 12797                                          ;jmp	GETCH
 12798                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12799 00001B0C EBEB                    	jmp	short GETCH2
 12800                                  
 12801                                  ;Get the next user char, and look ahead in template for a match
 12802                                  ;CX indicates how many chars to skip to get there on output
 12803                                  ;NOTE: WARNING: If the operation cannot be done, the return
 12804                                  ;       address is popped off and a jump to GETCH is taken.
 12805                                  ;       Make sure nothing extra on stack when this routine
 12806                                  ;       is called!!! (no PUSHes before calling it).
 12807                                  
 12808                                  FINDOLD:
 12809 00001B0E E831FE                          call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 12810                                  
 12811                                  	; STRIN.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 19/07/2018) 
 12812                                  
 12813                                  	;CMP     AL,[SS:ESCCHAR]	
 12814                                  	;JNZ     SHORT FINDSETUP
 12815                                  
 12816                                  	; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0)
 12817                                  
 12818                                  ;hkn; ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 12819                                  
 12820 00001B11 2E3A06[940A]            	CMP	AL,[CS:ESCCHAR]		; did he type a function key?
 12821 00001B16 7505                    	JNZ	SHORT FINDSETUP		; no, set up for scan
 12822                                  
 12823 00001B18 E827FE                  	CALL	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO	; eat next char
 12824 00001B1B EB1D                            JMP	SHORT NOTFND		; go try again
 12825                                  FINDSETUP:
 12826 00001B1D 88D9                    	mov	cl,bl
 12827 00001B1F 28F9                            sub	cl,bh		;CX is number of chars to end of template
 12828 00001B21 7417                    	jz	short NOTFND	;At end of template
 12829 00001B23 49                              dec	cx		;Cannot point past end, limit search
 12830 00001B24 7414                            jz	short NOTFND	;If only one char in template, forget it
 12831 00001B26 06                      	push	es
 12832 00001B27 1E                      	push	ds
 12833 00001B28 07                      	pop	es
 12834 00001B29 57                      	push	di
 12835 00001B2A 89F7                    	mov	di,si		;Template to ES:DI
 12836 00001B2C 47                      	inc	di
 12837 00001B2D F2AE                    	repne	scasb		;Look
 12838 00001B2F 5F                      	pop	di
 12839 00001B30 07                      	pop	es
 12840 00001B31 7507                    	jnz	short NOTFND	;Didn't find the char
 12841 00001B33 F6D1                            not	cl		;Turn how far to go into how far we went
 12842 00001B35 00D9                            add	cl,bl		;Add size of template
 12843 00001B37 28F9                            sub	cl,bh		;Subtract current pos, result distance to skip
 12844                                  FINDOLD_RETN:
 12845 00001B39 C3                      	retn
 12846                                  
 12847                                  NOTFND:
 12848 00001B3A 5D                      	pop	bp              ;Chuck return address
 12849                                  	;jmp	GETCH
 12850                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12851                                  GETCH2_j:
 12852 00001B3B EBBC                    	jmp	short GETCH2
 12853                                  
 12854                                  REEDIT:
 12855 00001B3D B040                    	mov	al,'@'		;Output re-edit character
 12856 00001B3F E8EF00                  	call	OUTT

 12881                                  CRLF:

 12890                                  ;**	$RAW_CON_IO - Do Raw Console I/O
 12891                                  ;
 12892                                  ;	Input or output raw character from console, no echo
 12893                                  ;
 12894                                  ;	ENTRY	DL = -1 if input
 12895                                  ;		   =  output character if output
 12896                                  ;	EXIT	(AL) = input character if input
 12897                                  ;	USES	all
 12898                                  ;
 12899                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12900                                  ; 20/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 12901                                  
 12902                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12903                                  ; DOSCODE:541Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12904                                  
 12905                                  ; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12906                                  ; DOSCODE:5408h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 12907                                  
 12908                                  _$RAW_CON_IO:			; System call 6
 12909                                  
 12910 00001B67 88D0                            MOV	AL,DL
 12911 00001B69 3CFF                            CMP	AL,-1
 12912 00001B6B 7541                    	JNZ	SHORT RAWOUT ; 16/12/2022
 12913                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12914                                  	;jz	short rci1
 12915                                  	;jmp	short RAWOUT
 12916                                  	; 16/12/202
 12917                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12918                                  	;nop
 12919                                  rci1:
 12920                                  			; Get pointer to register save area
 12921 00001B6D 36C43E[8405]            	LES	DI,[SS:USER_SP] ; 12/03/2018
 12922 00001B72 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX
 12923                                      	;CALL	GET_IO_FCB	; MSDOS 2.11 (Retro DOS v2.0)
 12924 00001B74 E85323                  	CALL	GET_IO_SFT	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 12925                                          ;JC	SHORT RET17
 12926 00001B77 72C0                            jc	short FINDOLD_RETN
 12927 00001B79 B401                    	MOV	AH,1
 12928 00001B7B E85135                  	CALL	IOFUNC
 12929 00001B7E 750B                    	JNZ	SHORT RESFLG
 12930 00001B80 E80943                  	CALL	SPOOLINT
 12931                                  	;OR	BYTE [ES:DI+16H],40H
 12932 00001B83 26804D1640              	OR	BYTE [ES:DI+user_env.user_F],40H ; Set user's zero flag
 12933 00001B88 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 12934                                  RET17:
 12935 00001B8A C3                      	RETN
 12936                                  
 12937                                  RESFLG:
 12938                                  	;AND	BYTE [ES:DI+16H],0FFH-40H  ; 0BFh
 12939 00001B8B 26806516BF              	AND	BYTE [ES:DI+user_env.user_F],0FFH-40H
 12940                                  				; Reset user's zero flag
 12941                                  ;RILP:
 12942                                  rci0:
 12943 00001B90 E8F942                       	CALL	SPOOLINT
 12944                                  ;

 12946                                  ;
 12947                                  ;**	$Raw_CON_INPUT - Raw Console Input
 12948                                  ;
 12949                                  ;	Input raw character from console, no echo
 12950                                  ;
 12951                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 12952                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = character
 12953                                  ;	USES	all
 12954                                  ;

 13659                                  ;
 13660                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983"
 13661                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 13662                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 13663                                  ;					  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 13664                                  ;					  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 13665                                  ;					  already closed FCB and return EOF.

 13671                                  ;Break <$Get_FCB_Position - set random record fields to current pos>
 13672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13673                                  ;
 13674                                  ;   $Get_FCB_Position - look at an FCB, retrieve the current position from the
 13675                                  ;	extent and next record field and set the random record field to point
 13676                                  ;	to that record
 13677                                  ;
 13678                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 13679                                  ;   Outputs:	The random record field of the FCB is set to the current record
 13680                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13681                                  ;
 13682                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13683                                  ;
 13684                                  
 13685                                  _$GET_FCB_POSITION:
 13686 00001D4C E8FB04                  	call	GetExtended		; point to FCB
 13687 00001D4F E8CC04                  	call	GetExtent		; DX:AX is current record
 13688                                  	;mov	[si+21h],ax
 13689 00001D52 894421                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR],AX 	; drop in low order piece
 13690                                  	;mov	[si+23h],dl
 13691 00001D55 885423                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2],DL	; drop in high order piece
 13692                                  	;cmp	word [si+0Eh],64
 13693 00001D58 837C0E40                	CMP	word [SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],64
 13694 00001D5C 7303                    	JAE	short GetFCBBye
 13695                                  	;mov	[si+24h],dh
 13696 00001D5E 887424                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2+1],DH	; Set 4th byte only if record size < 64
 13697                                  GoodPath:	; 16/12/2022
 13698                                  GetFCBBye:
 13699 00001D61 E926E9                  	jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 13700                                  
 13701                                  ;Break <$FCB_Delete - remove several files that match the input FCB>
 13702                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13703                                  ;
 13704                                  ;**	$FCB_Delete - Delete from FCB Template
 13705                                  ;
 13706                                  ;	given an FCB, remove all directory entries in the current
 13707                                  ;	directory that have names that match the FCB's ?  marks.
 13708                                  ;
 13709                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = address of FCB
 13710                                  ;	EXIT	entries matching the FCB are deleted
 13711                                  ;		(al) = ff iff no entries were deleted
 13712                                  ;	USES	all
 13713                                  ;
 13714                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13715                                  ;
 13716                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13717                                  
 13718                                  _$FCB_DELETE:		; System call 19
 13719                                  					; OpenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13720 00001D64 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF 		; appropriate place 
 13721                                  
 13722 00001D67 E89D5E                  	call	TransFCB		; convert FCB to path
 13723 00001D6A 7207                    	JC	short BadPath 		; signal no deletions
 13724                                  
 13725 00001D6C 16                      	push	SS
 13726 00001D6D 1F                      	pop	DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 13727                                  
 13728 00001D6E E8EF0D                  	call	DOS_DELETE		; wham
 13729                                  	;JC	short BadPath
 13730                                  	; 16/12/2022
 13731 00001D71 73EE                    	jnc 	short GoodPath
 13732                                  ;GoodPath:
 13733                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_OK		; do a good return
 13734                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13735                                  ;	jmp	short GetFCBBye
 13736                                  
 13737                                  BadPath:
 13738                                  	; Error code is in AX
 13739                                  
 13740 00001D73 E917E9                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; let someone else signal the error
 13741                                  
 13742                                  ;Break <$Get_FCB_File_Length - return the length of a file>
 13743                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13744                                  ;
 13745                                  ;   $Get_FCB_File_Length - set the random record field to the length of the
 13746                                  ;	file in records (rounded up if partial).
 13747                                  ;
 13748                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX - point to a possible extended FCB
 13749                                  ;   Outputs:	Random record field updated to reflect the number of records
 13750                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13751                                  ;
 13752                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13753                                  ;
 13754                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retrodos v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 13756                                  _$GET_FCB_FILE_LENGTH:
 13757                                  
 13758 00001D76 E8D104                  	call	GetExtended		; get real FCB pointer
 13759                                  					; DX points to Input FCB
 13760                                  
 13761                                  					; OpenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13762 00001D79 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 13763                                  
 13764 00001D7C 1E                      	push	ds			; save pointer to true FCB
 13765 00001D7D 56                      	push	si
 13766 00001D7E E8865E                  	call	TransFCB		; Trans name DS:DX, sets SATTRIB
 13767 00001D81 5E                      	pop	si
 13768 00001D82 1F                      	pop	ds
 13769 00001D83 72EE                    	JC	short BadPath
 13770 00001D85 1E                      	push	ds			; save pointer
 13771 00001D86 56                      	push	si
 13772 00001D87 16                      	push	ss		
 13773 00001D88 1F                      	pop	ds
 13774 00001D89 E83312                  	call	GET_FILE_INFO		; grab the info
 13775 00001D8C 5E                      	pop	si			; get pointer back
 13776 00001D8D 1F                      	pop	ds
 13777 00001D8E 72E3                    	JC	short BadPath 		; invalid something
 13778                                  	; 15/01/2024
 13779                                  	;MOV	DX,BX (*)		; get high order size
 13780                                  	;MOV	AX,DI (**)		; get low order size
 13781 00001D90 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx ; hw of file size
 13782                                  	;
 13783                                  	;mov	bx,[si+0Eh]
 13784 00001D92 8B5C0E                  	MOV	BX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ]	; get his record size
 13785 00001D95 09DB                    	OR	BX,BX			; empty record => 0 size for file
 13786 00001D97 7502                    	JNZ	short GetSize 		; not empty
 13787                                  	;MOV	BX,128
 13788 00001D99 B380                    	mov	bl,128	; 15/01/2024
 13789                                  GetSize:
 13790                                  	; 15/01/2024
 13791                                  	;MOV	DI,AX			; save low order word
 13792                                  	;MOV	AX,DX			; move high order for divide
 13793                                  	;xchg	ax,dx ; (*)
 13794                                  	; ax = hw of file size
 13795                                  
 13796 00001D9B 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX			; clear out high
 13797 00001D9D F7F3                    	DIV	BX			; wham
 13798 00001D9F 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save dividend
 13799 00001DA0 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI ; (**)		; get low order piece
 13800 00001DA2 F7F3                    	DIV	BX			; wham
 13801 00001DA4 89D1                    	MOV	CX,DX			; save remainder
 13802 00001DA6 5A                      	POP	DX			; get high order dividend
 13803 00001DA7 E306                    	JCXZ	LengthStore		; no roundup
 13804 00001DA9 83C001                  	ADD	AX,1
 13805 00001DAC 83D200                  	ADC	DX,0			; 32-bit increment
 13806                                  LengthStore:
 13807                                  	;mov	[si+21h],ax
 13808 00001DAF 894421                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR],AX	; store low order
 13809                                  	;mov	[si+23h],dl
 13810 00001DB2 885423                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2],DL	; store high order
 13811 00001DB5 08F6                    	OR	DH,DH
 13812 00001DB7 74A8                    	JZ	short GoodPath		; not storing insignificant zero
 13813                                  	;mov	[si+24h],dh
 13814 00001DB9 887424                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+3],DH	; save that high piece
 13815                                  	; 16/12/2022
 13816                                  GoodRet:
 13817                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 13818 00001DBC EBA3                    	jmp	short GoodPath
 13819                                  
 13820                                  ;Break <$FCB_Close - close a file>
 13821                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13822                                  ;
 13823                                  ;   $FCB_Close - given an FCB, look up the SFN and close it. Do not free it
 13824                                  ;	as the FCB may be used for further I/O
 13825                                  ;
 13826                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to FCB
 13827                                  ;   Outputs:	AL = FF if file was not found on disk
 13828                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13829                                  ;
 13830                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13831                                  ;
 13832                                  	; 16/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13833                                  
 13834                                  _$FCB_CLOSE:		; System call 16
 13835                                  
 13836 00001DBE 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; default search attributes
 13837 00001DC0 E88704                  	call	GetExtended		; DS:SI point to real FCB
 13838 00001DC3 7403                    	JZ	short NoAttr		; not extended
 13839 00001DC5 8A44FF                  	MOV	AL,[SI-1]		; get attributes
 13840                                  NoAttr:
 13841                                  					; SS override
 13842 00001DC8 36A2[6B05]              	MOV	[SS:ATTRIB],AL		; stash away found attributes
 13843 00001DCC E8CE03                  	call	SFTFromFCB
 13844 00001DCF 72EB                    	JC	short GoodRet 		; MZ 16 Jan Assume death
 13845                                  
 13846                                  	; If the sharer is present, then the SFT is not regenable. Thus, 
 13847                                  	; there is no need to set the SFT's attribute.
 13848                                  
 13849                                  	;;; 9/8/86 F.C. save SFT attribute and restore it back when close is 
 13850                                  	;;; done
 13851                                  
 13852                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+4]
 13853 00001DD1 268A4504                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr]
 13854 00001DD5 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 13855 00001DD7 50                      	PUSH	AX
 13856                                  
 13857                                  	;;; 9/8/86 F.C. save SFT attribute and restore it back when close is 
 13858                                  	;;; done

 13861 00001DDB 7508                    	JNZ	short NoStash
 13862 00001DDD 36A0[6B05]              	MOV	AL,[SS:ATTRIB]
 13863                                  	;mov	[es:di+4],al
 13864 00001DE1 26884504                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],AL ; attempted attribute for close
 13865                                  NoStash:
 13866                                  
 13867                                  ; 16/01/2024
 13868                                  %if 0
 13869                                  	;mov	ax,[si+14h]
 13870                                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.FDATE] ; move in the time and date
 13871                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax
 13872                                  	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_date],AX
 13873                                  	;mov	ax,[si+16h]
 13874                                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.FTIME]
 13875                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Dh],ax
 13876                                  	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_time],AX
 13877                                  	;mov	ax,[si+10h]
 13878                                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ]
 13879                                  	;mov	[es:di+11h],ax
 13880                                  	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_size],AX
 13881                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12h]
 13882                                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ+2]
 13883                                  	;mov	[es:di+13h],ax
 13884                                  	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_size+2],AX
 13885                                  	;or	word [es:di+5],4000h
 13886                                  	; 17/12/2022
 13887                                  	or	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_close_nodate>>8) ; 40h
 13888                                  	;OR	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_close_nodate
 13889                                  %else
 13890                                  	; 16/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13891 00001DE5 1E                      	push	ds
 13892                                  	;lds	ax,[si+14h]
 13893 00001DE6 C54414                  	lds	ax,[si+SYS_FCB.FDATE]	; move in the time and date
 13894                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax
 13895 00001DE9 2689450F                	mov	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_date],ax

 13898 00001DF1 1F                      	pop	ds
 13899                                  	;lds	ax,[si+10h]
 13900 00001DF2 C54410                  	lds	ax,[si+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ]
 13901                                  	;mov	[es:di+11h],ax
 13902 00001DF5 26894511                	mov	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_size],ax
 13903                                  	;mov	[es:di+13h],ds
 13904 00001DF9 268C5D13                	mov	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_size+2],ds
 13905                                  	; 16/01/2024
 13906                                  	;;or	word [es:di+5],4000h
 13907                                  	;or	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_close_nodate
 13908 00001DFD 26804D0640              	or	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_close_nodate>>8) ; 40h
 13909                                  %endif
 13910                                  
 13911 00001E02 16                      	push	ss
 13912 00001E03 1F                      	pop	ds

 13918                                  	;mov	[es:di+4],cl

 13923                                  	;test	word [es:di],0FFFFh

 13925                                  				; zero ref count gets blasted
 13926 00001E11 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 13927 00001E15 7507                    	jnz     short CloseOK

 13940                                  fren90:

 13947                                  ;
 13948                                  ;**	$FCB_Rename - Rename a File
 13949                                  ;
 13950                                  ;	$FCB_Rename - rename a file in place within a directory. Renames
 13951                                  ;	multiple files copying from the meta characters.
 13952                                  ;
 13953                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DX point to an FCB. The normal name field is the source
 13954                                  ;		    name of the files to be renamed. Starting at offset 11h
 13955                                  ;		    in the FCB is the destination name.
 13956                                  ;	EXIT	AL = 0 -> no error occurred and all files were renamed
 13957                                  ;		AL = FF -> some files may have been renamed but:
 13958                                  ;			rename to existing file or source file not found
 13959                                  ;	USES	ALL
 13960                                  ;
