 14016                                  ;fren90:	
 14017                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 14018                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 14019                                  ;	jmp	short fcb_close_err
 14020                                  
 14021                                  ;Break <Misbehavior fixers>
 14022                                  ;
 14023                                  ;   FCBs suffer from several problems. First, they are maintained in the
 14024                                  ;   user's space so he may move them at will. Second, they have a small
 14025                                  ;   reserved area that may be used for system information. Third, there was
 14026                                  ;   never any "rules for behavior" for FCBs; there was no protocol for their
 14027                                  ;   usage.
 14028                                  ;
 14029                                  ;   This results in the following misbehavior:
 14030                                  ;
 14031                                  ;	infinite opens of the same file:
 14032                                  ;
 14033                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 14034                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB);		    FCBOpen (FCB);
 14035                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 14036                                  ;	    }				    }
 14037                                  ;
 14038                                  ;	infinite opens of different files:
 14039                                  ;
 14040                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 14041                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]); 	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]);
 14042                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 14043                                  ;	    }				    }
 14044                                  ;
 14045                                  ;	multiple closes of the same file:
 14046                                  ;
 14047                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 14048                                  ;	while (TRUE)
 14049                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 14050                                  ;
 14051                                  ;	I/O after closing file:
 14052                                  ;
 14053                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 14054                                  ;	while (TRUE) {
 14055                                  ;	    FCBWrite (FCB);
 14056                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 14057                                  ;	    }
 14058                                  ;
 14059                                  ;   The following is am implementation of a methodology for emulating the
 14060                                  ;   above with the exception of I/O after close. We are NOT attempting to
 14061                                  ;   resolve that particular misbehavior. We will enforce correct behaviour in
 14062                                  ;   FCBs when they refer to a network file or when there is file sharing on
 14063                                  ;   the local machine.
 14064                                  ;
 14065                                  ;   The reserved fields of the FCB (10 bytes worth) is divided up into various
 14066                                  ;   structures depending on the file itself and the state of operations of the
 14067                                  ;   OS. The information contained in this reserved field is enough to
 14068                                  ;   regenerate the SFT for the local non-shared file. It is assumed that this
 14069                                  ;   regeneration procedure may be expensive. The SFT for the FCB is
 14070                                  ;   maintained in a LRU cache as the ONLY performance inprovement.
 14071                                  ;
 14072                                  ;   No regeneration of SFTs is attempted for network FCBs.
 14073                                  ;
 14074                                  ;   To regenerate the SFT for a local FCB, it is necessary to determine if the
 14075                                  ;   file sharer is working. If the file sharer is present then the SFT is not
 14076                                  ;   regenerated.
 14077                                  ;
 14078                                  ;   Finally, if there is no local sharing, the full name of the file is no
 14079                                  ;   longer available. We can make up for this by using the following
 14080                                  ;   information:
 14081                                  ;
 14082                                  ;	The Drive number (from the DPB).
 14083                                  ;	The physical sector of the directory that contains the entry.
 14084                                  ;	The relative position of the entry in the sector.
 14085                                  ;	The first cluster field.
 14086                                  ;	The last used SFT.
 14087                                  ;      OR In the case of a device FCB
 14088                                  ;	The low 6 bits of sf_flags (indicating device type)
 14089                                  ;	The pointer to the device header
 14090                                  ;
 14091                                  ;   We read in the particular directory sector and examine the indicated
 14092                                  ;   directory entry. If it matches, then we are kosher; otherwise, we fail.
 14093                                  ;
 14094                                  ;   Some key items need to be remembered:
 14095                                  ;
 14096                                  ;	Even though we are caching SFTs, they may contain useful sharing
 14097                                  ;	information. We enforce good behavior on the FCBs.
 14098                                  ;
 14099                                  ;	Network support must not treat FCBs as impacting the ref counts on
 14100                                  ;	open VCs. The VCs may be closed only at process termination.
 14101                                  ;
 14102                                  ;	If this is not an installed version of the DOS, file sharing will
 14103                                  ;	always be present.
 14104                                  ;
 14105                                  ;	We MUST always initialize lstclus to = firclus when regenerating a
 14106                                  ;	file. Otherwise we start allocating clusters up the wazoo.
 14107                                  ;
 14108                                  ;	Always initialize, during regeneration, the mode field to both isFCB
 14109                                  ;	and open_for_both. This is so the FCB code in the sharer can find the
 14110                                  ;	proper OI record.
 14111                                  ;
 14112                                  ;   The test bits are:
 14113                                  ;
 14114                                  ;	00 -> local file
 14115                                  ;	40 -> sharing local
 14116                                  ;	80 -> network
 14117                                  ;	C0 -> local device
 14118                                  
 14119                                  ;Break	<SaveFCBInfo - store pertinent information from an SFT into the FCB>
 14120                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14121                                  ;
 14122                                  ;   SaveFCBInfo - given an FCB and its associated SFT, copy the relevant
 14123                                  ;	pieces of information into the FCB to allow for subsequent
 14124                                  ;	regeneration. Poke LRU also.
 14125                                  ;
 14126                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT points to a complete SFT.
 14127                                  ;		DS:SI point to the FCB (not an extended one)
 14128                                  ;   Outputs:	The relevant reserved fields in the FCB are filled in.
 14129                                  ;		DS:SI preserved
 14130                                  ;		ES:DI point to sft
 14131                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 14132                                  ;
 14133                                  ;
 14134                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14135                                  ;
 14136

 14348                                  ;Break	<ResetLRU - reset overflowed lru counts>
 14349                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14350                                  ;
 14351                                  ;   ResetLRU - during lru updates, we may wrap at 64K. We must walk the
 14352                                  ;   entire set of SFTs and subtract 8000h from their lru counts and truncate
 14353                                  ;   at 0.
 14354                                  ;
 14355                                  ;   Inputs:	BX is offset into SFT field where lru firld is kept
 14356                                  ;		ES:DI point to SFT currently being updated
 14357                                  ;   Outputs:	All FCB SFTs have their lru fields truncated
 14358                                  ;		AX has 8000h
 14359                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14360                                  ;
 14361                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14362                                  ;
 14363                                  
 14364                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14365                                  ResetLRU:
 14366                                  	; ResetLRU is only called from fcbio.asm. So SS can be assumed to be 
 14367                                  	; DOSDATA
 14368                                  
 14369 00001F12 B80080                  	MOV	AX,8000h
 14370 00001F15 06                      	push	es
 14371 00001F16 57                      	push	di
 14372                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]		; get pointer to head
 14373 00001F17 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB] ; MSDOS 6.0
 14374                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14375 00001F1C 268B4D04                	MOV	CX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 14376                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14377 00001F20 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable] 	; point at table
 14378                                  ovScan:
 14379 00001F23 262901                  	SUB	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; decrement lru count
 14380 00001F26 7703                    	JA	short ovLoop
 14381 00001F28 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; truncate at 0
 14382                                  ovLoop:
 14383                                  	;;add	di,53	; MSDOS 3.3
 14384                                  	;add	di,59	; MSDOS 6.0	
 14385 00001F2B 83C73B                  	ADD	DI,SF_ENTRY.size	; advance to next
 14386 00001F2E E2F3                    	LOOP	ovScan
 14387 00001F30 5F                      	pop	di
 14388 00001F31 07                      	pop	es
 14389 00001F32 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX
 14390 00001F35 C3                      	retn

 14433                                  ;Break	<LRUFCB - perform LRU on FCB sfts>
 14434                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14435                                  ;
 14436                                  ;   LRUFCB - find LRU fcb in cache. Set ThisSFT and return it. We preserve
 14437                                  ;	the first keepcount sfts if they are network sfts or if sharing is
 14438                                  ;	loaded.  If carry is set then NO BLASTING is NECESSARY.
 14439                                  ;

 14441                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point to SFT

 14456                                  ; to find the lease recently used one that is younger than the open age.  We
 14457                                  ; operate be scanning the list n times finding the least age that is greater
 14458                                  ; or equal to the previous minimum age.

 14546                                  ; set then threshold value to this new minimum + 1. Otherwise, the scan is
 14547                                  ; complete.  Go find LRU.

 14599                                  ;

 14606                                  ; out. The conditions here are:

 14660                                  
 14661                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14662                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 14663                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14664                                  ;
 14665                                  ; LruFCB -- allocate the LRU SFT from the SFT Table. The LRU scheme
 14666                                  ; maintains separate counts for net/Share and local SFTs. We allocate a 
 14667                                  ; net/Share SFT only if we do not find a local SFT. This helps keep
 14668                                  ; net/Share SFTs which cannot be regenerated for as long as possible. We
 14669                                  ; optimize regeneration operations by keeping track of the current local
 14670                                  ; SFT. This avoids scanning of the SFTs as long as we have at least one 
 14671                                  ; local SFT in the SFT Block.
 14672                                  ;
 14673                                  ; Inputs: al = 0 => Regenerate SFT operation
 14674                                  ;	    = 1 => Allocate new SFT for Open/Create
 14675                                  ;
 14676                                  ; Outputs: Carry clear
 14677                                  ;	 	es:di = Address of allocated SFT
 14678                                  ;	  	ThisSFT = Address of allocated SFT
 14679                                  ;
 14680                                  ;	  carry set if closes of net/Share files failed 
 14681                                  ;		al = error_FCB_unavailable
 14682                                  ;
 14683                                  ; Registers affected: None
 14684                                  ;
 14685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14686                                  
 14687                                  ;LruFCB	PROC	NEAR
 14688                                  LRUFCB:
 14689                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14690                                  	; DOSCODE:5805h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 14691                                  
 14692                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14693                                  	; DOSCODE:57F1h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 14694                                  
 14695                                  	; 20/01/2024 Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMMDOS.COM)
 14696                                  	; DOSCODE:5E7Ch (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 14697                                  
 14698 00001F36 06                      	push	es	; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 14699                                  	
 14700 00001F37 E81EE5                  	call	save_world
 14701                                  	
 14702                                  	;getdseg <ds>		;ds = DOSDATA
 14703 00001F3A 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 14704                                  
 14705 00001F3F 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Check if regenerate allocation
 14706 00001F41 7516                    	jnz	short lru1	;Try to find SFT to use
 14707                                  
 14708                                  	; This is a regen call. If LocalSFT contains the address of a valid 
 14709                                  	; local SFT, just return that SFT to reuse
 14710                                  
 14711                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14712                                  	;mov	di,[LocalSFT]
 14713                                  	;or	di,[LocalSFT+2]	;is address == 0?
 14714                                  	;jz	short lru1	;invalid local SFT, find one
 14715                                  
 14716                                  	; We have found a valid local SFT. Recycle this SFT
 14717                                  
 14718 00001F43 C43E[760F]              	les	di,[LocalSFT]
 14719                                  
 14720                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14721 00001F47 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 14722 00001F49 09F9                    	or	cx,di		; is address == 0?
 14723 00001F4B 740C                    	jz	short lru1	; invalid local SFT, find one
 14724                                  
 14725                                  gotlocalSFT:
 14726 00001F4D 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di
 14727 00001F51 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es
 14728 00001F55 F8                      	clc
 14729 00001F56 E9A900                  	jmp	LRUDone		;clear up SFT and return
 14730                                  
 14731                                  lru1:
 14732 00001F59 C43E[4000]              	les	di,[SFTFCB]	;es:di = SF Table for FCBs
 14733                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14734 00001F5D 268B4D04                	mov	cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]	;cx = number of SFTs
 14735                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14736 00001F61 8D7D06                  	lea	di,[di+SFT.SFTable]	;es:di = first SFT
 14737                                  
 14738                                  	; We scan through all the SFTs scanning for a free one. It also 
 14739                                  	; remembers the LRU SFT for net/Share SFTs and local SFTs separately. 
 14740                                  	; bx = min. LRU for local SFTs
 14741                                  	; si = pos. of local SFT with min. LRU
 14742                                  	; dx = min. LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14743                                  	; bp = pos. of net/Share SFT with min. LRU
 14744                                  
 14745 00001F64 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,-1		; init. to 0xffff ( max. LRU value )
 14746 00001F67 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 14747 00001F69 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 14748 00001F6B 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 14749                                  
 14750                                  findSFT:
 14751                                  	;See if this SFT is a free one. If so, return it
 14752 00001F6D 26830D00                	or	word [es:di],0
 14753                                  	;or	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ;reference count = 0 ?
 14754 00001F71 744C                    	jz	short gotSFT	;yes, SFT is free
 14755                                  	;;cmp	word [es:di],-1
 14756                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy ;Is it busy?
 14757 00001F73 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1 
 14758 00001F77 7446                    	jz	short gotSFT	;no, can use it
 14759                                  
 14760                                  	; Check if this SFT is local and store its address in LocalSFT. Can be 
 14761                                  	; used for a later regen.
 14762                                  
 14763                                  	; 16/12/2022
 14764                                  	; 08/11/2022
 14765                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 14766 00001F79 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 14767                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 14768                                  	;;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 14769                                  	;test	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; network SFT?
 14770 00001F7E 7531                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14771                                  
 14772                                  ;IF installed
 14773 00001F80 E8BF64                  	call	CheckShare	;Share present?
 14774                                  ;ENDIF
 14775 00001F83 752C                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14776                                  
 14777                                  	;Local SFT, register its address
 14778                                  
 14779                                  	; !!HACK!!!
 14780                                  	; There is a slightly dirty hack out here in a desperate bid to save  
 14781                                  	; code space. There is similar code duplicated at label 'gotSFT'. We 
 14782                                  	; enter from there if al = 0, update the LocalSFT variable, and since 
 14783                                  	; al = 0, we jump out of the loop to the exit point. I have commented

 14786                                  hackpoint:
 14787 00001F85 893E[760F]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14788 00001F89 8C06[780F]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 14789                                  
 14790 00001F8D 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Is operation = REGEN?
 14791 00001F8F 74BC                    	jz	short gotlocalSFT ;yes, return this SFT for reuse
 14792                                  
 14793                                  	;Get LRU for local files
 14794                                  	
 14795                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],bx
 14796 00001F91 26395D15                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],bx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14797 00001F95 7306                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip 
 14798                                  
 14799                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+15h]
 14800 00001F97 268B5D15                	mov	bx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14801 00001F9B 89FE                    	mov	si,di		;store SFT position
 14802                                  lru4:
 14803                                  	;add	di,59
 14804 00001F9D 83C73B                  	add	di,SF_ENTRY.size ;go to next SFT
 14805 00001FA0 E2CB                    	loop	findSFT
 14806                                  	
 14807                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14808 00001FA2 49                      	dec	cx ; -1
 14809                                  
 14810                                  	; Check whether we got a net/Share or local SFT. If local SFT
 14811                                  	; available, we will reuse it instead of net/Share LRU
 14812                                  
 14813 00001FA3 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 14814                                  	;cmp	si,-1		;local SFT available?
 14815 00001FA5 39CE                    	cmp	si,cx ; 20/01/2024
 14816 00001FA7 7516                    	jnz	short gotSFT	;yes, return it
 14817                                  
 14818                                  	;No local SFT, see if we got a net/Share SFT
 14819                                  
 14820 00001FA9 89EF                    	mov	di,bp
 14821                                  
 14822 00001FAB 39CD                    	cmp	bp,cx ; -1 ; 20/01/2024
 14823                                  	;cmp	bp,-1		;net/Share SFT available?
 14824 00001FAD 752D                    	jnz	short gotnetSFT	;yes, return it
 14825                                  noSFT:
 14826                                  	; NB: This error should never occur. We always must have an LRU SFT.
 14827                                  	; This error can occur only if the SFT has been corrupted or the LRU
 14828                                  	; count is not maintained properly.
 14829                                  
 14830 00001FAF EB4E                    	jmp	short errorbadSFT ;error, no FCB available.
 14831                                  
 14832                                  	; Handle the LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14833                                  lru5:
 14834                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],dx
 14835 00001FB1 26395515                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],dx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14836 00001FB5 73E6                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip
 14837                                  
 14838                                  	;mov	dx,[es:di+15h]
 14839 00001FB7 268B5515                	mov	dx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14840                                  
 14841 00001FBB 89FD                    	mov	bp,di		;store SFT position
 14842 00001FBD EBDE                    	jmp	short lru4	;continue with next SFT
 14843                                  
 14844                                  gotSFT:
 14845 00001FBF 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14846 00001FC1 74C2                    	jz	short hackpoint	;save es:di in LocalSFT
 14847                                  
 14848                                  	; HACK!!!
 14849                                  	; The code here differs from the code at 'hackpoint' only in the 
 14850                                  	; order of the check for al. If al = 0, we can jump to 'hackpoint'
 14851                                  	; and then from there jump out to 'gotlocalSFT'. The original code
 14852                                  	; has been commented out below and replaced by the code just above.
 14853                                  
 14854                                  ;If regen, then this SFT can be registered as a local one ( even if free ).
 14855                                  ;
 14856                                  ;	or	al,al		  ;Regen?
 14857                                  ;	jnz	short notlocaluse ;yes, register it and return
 14858                                  ;

 14860                                  ;
 14861                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14862                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es
 14863                                  ;	jmp	gotlocalSFT	;return to caller
 14864                                  ;
 14865                                  ;notlocaluse:
 14866                                  
 14867                                  	; The caller is probably going to use this SFT for a net/Share file.
 14868                                  	; We will come here only on a Open/Create when the caller($FCB_OPEN)
 14869                                  	; does not really know whether it is a local file or not. We
 14870                                  	; invalidate LocalSFT if the SFT we are going to use was previously
 14871                                  	; registered as a local SFT that can be recycled.
 14872                                  
 14873 00001FC3 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 14874 00001FC5 393E[760F]              	cmp	[LocalSFT],di		;Offset same?
 14875 00001FC9 750E                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14876 00001FCB 3906[780F]              	cmp	[LocalSFT+2],ax		;Segments same?
 14877                                  	;je	short zerolocalSFT	;no, no need to invalidate
 14878                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14879 00001FCF 7508                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14880                                  zerolocalSFT:	
 14881 00001FD1 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14882 00001FD3 A3[760F]                	mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14883 00001FD6 A3[780F]                	mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14884                                  	
 14885                                  notinvalid:
 14886 00001FD9 E971FF                  	jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14887                                  
 14888                                  	; The SFT we are going to use was registered in the LocalSFT variable.
 14889                                  	; Invalidate this variable i.e LocalSFT = NULL
 14890                                  
 14891                                  ;zerolocalSFT:
 14892                                  	;xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14893                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14894                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14895                                  	;
 14896                                  	;jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14897                                  
 14898                                  gotnetSFT:
 14899                                  	; We have an SFT that is currently net/Share. If it is going to be
 14900                                  	; used for a regen, we know it has to be a local SFT. Update the
 14901                                  	; LocalSFT variable
 14902                                  
 14903 00001FDC 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14904 00001FDE 7508                    	jnz	short closenet

 15023                                  	; it. Check to see if sharing is present or if the redir is present.

 15307                                  ;**	BlastSFT - FIll SFT with Garbage
 15308                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15309                                  ;	BlastSFT is used when an SFT is no longer needed; it's called with
 15310                                  ;	various garbage values to put into the SFT.  I don't know why,
 15311                                  ;	presumably to help with debugging (jgl).  We clear the few fields
 15312                                  ;	necessary to show that the SFT is free after filling it.
 15313                                  ;
 15314                                  ;	ENTRY	(es:di) = address of SFT
 15315                                  ;		(al) = fill character
 15316                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = -1
 15317                                  ;		'C' clear
 15318                                  ;	USES	AX, CX, Flags
 15319                                  
 15320                                  BlastSFT:
 15321                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15322                                  	;;;
 15323 00002118 E8D729                  	call	SFT_FREE
 15324                                  	;;;
 15325 0000211B 57                      	push	di
 15326                                  	;mov	cx,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 15327                                  	;mov	cx,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 15328 0000211C B93B00                  	mov	cx,SF_ENTRY.size
 15329 0000211F F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 15330 00002121 5F                      	pop	di
 15331 00002122 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax	; 0		; clear 'C'-----------------;
 15332 00002124 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 15333                                  	;mov	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],ax ; set ref count    ;
 15334                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 15335 00002127 26894515                	mov	[es:di+sf_LRU],ax	; set lru		    ;
 15336 0000212B 48                      	dec	ax	; -1					    ;
 15337                                  	;mov	[es:di+17h],ax ; 0FFFFh ; -1
 15338 0000212C 26894517                	mov	[es:di+sf_OpenAge],ax	; set open age to -1	    ;
 15339                                  BlastSFT_retn:
 15340 00002130 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear     ;
 15341                                  
 15342                                  ;Break	<CheckFCB - see if the SFT pointed to by the FCB is still OK>
 15343                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15344                                  ;
 15345                                  ;   CheckFCB - examine an FCB and its contents to see if it needs to be
 15346                                  ;   regenerated.
 15347                                  ;
 15348                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB (not extended)
 15349                                  ;		AL is SFT index
 15350                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set - FCB needs to be regened
 15351                                  ;		Carry clear - FCB is OK. ES:DI point to SFT
 15352                                  ;   Registers modified: AX and BX
 15353                                  ;
 15354                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15355                                  
 15356                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15357                                  	; DOSCODE:59F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 15358                                  
 15359                                  	; 21/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15360                                  	; DOSCODE:607Eh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15361                                  CheckFCB:
 15362                                  		
 15363                                  	; called from $fcb_open and sftfromfcb. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 15364                                  
 15365                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 15366                                  
 15367                                  	; LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]
 15368                                  
 15369                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 15370                                  	
 15371                                  	; SR;
 15372                                  	; We check if the given FCB is for a local file. If so, we return a 
 15373                                  	; bad SFT status forcing the caller to regenerate the SFT.
 15374                                  
 15375                                  	;test	byte [si+19h],0C0h
 15376 00002131 F64419C0                	test	byte [si+fcb_l_drive],FCBNETWORK|FCBSHARE|FCBDEVICE
 15377 00002135 7464                    	jz	short BadSFT		;Local file, return bad SFT
 15378 00002137 36C43E[4000]            	LES     DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; SS override

 15568                                  ;Break	<SFTFromFCB - take a FCB and obtain a SFT from it>
 15569                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15570                                  ;
 15571                                  ;   SFTFromFCB - the workhorse of this compatability crap. Check to see if
 15572                                  ;	the SFT for the FCB is Good. If so, make ThisSFT point to it. If not
 15573                                  ;	good, get one from the cache and regenerate it. Overlay the LRU field
 15574                                  ;	with PID
 15575                                  ;
 15576                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15577                                  ;   Outputs:	ThisSFT point to appropriate SFT
 15578                                  ;		Carry clear -> OK ES:DI -> SFT
 15579                                  ;		Carry set -> error in ax
 15580                                  ;   Registers modified: ES,DI, AX
 15581                                  ;
 15582                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15583                                  
 15584                                  SFTFromFCB:
 15585                                  	; called from fcbio and $fcb_close. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 15586                                  
 15587                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15588                                  
 15589 0000219D 50                      	push	ax
 15590 0000219E 53                      	push	bx
 15591                                  	;mov	al,[si+18h]
 15592 0000219F 8A4418                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn] 	; set SFN for check
 15593 000021A2 E88CFF                  	call	CheckFCB
 15594 000021A5 5B                      	pop	bx
 15595 000021A6 58                      	pop	ax
 15596                                  	;MOV	[CS:THISSFT],DI		; SS override
 15597                                  	;MOV	[CS:THISSFT+2],ES
 15598 000021A7 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; SS override
 15599 000021AC 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES
 15600 000021B1 7311                    	JNC	short Set_SFT		; no problems, just set thissft
 15601                                  	
 15602                                  	; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0)
 15603                                  	; 31/05/2019
 15604 000021B3 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21) & (MSDOS 5.0)
 15605 000021B4 E8A1E2                  	call	save_world
 15606 000021B7 E860FE                  	call	FCBRegen
 15607 000021BA E884E2                  	call	restore_world		; use macro restore world
 15608 000021BD 07                      	pop	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21) ; 31/05/2019 ; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0)	
 15609                                  
 15610                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:EXTERR]		; SS override
 15611 000021BE 36A1[2403]              	MOV	AX,[SS:EXTERR]		; SS override
 15612 000021C2 72C4                    	jc	short CheckNet_retn
 15613

 15683                                  ;**	FCBIO2.ASM - Ancient 1.0 1.1 FCB system calls
 15684                                  ;
 15685                                  ;	GetRR
 15686                                  ;	GetExtent
 15687                                  ;	SetExtent
 15688                                  ;	GetExtended
 15689                                  ;	GetRecSize
 15690                                  ;	FCBIO
 15691                                  ;	$FCB_OPEN
 15692                                  ;	$FCB_CREATE
 15693                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_WRITE_BLOCK
 15694                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_READ_BLOCK
 15695                                  ;	$FCB_SEQ_READ
 15696                                  ;	$FCB_SEQ_WRITE
 15697                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_READ
 15698                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_WRITE
 15699                                  ;
 15700                                  ;	Revision history:
 15701                                  ;
 15702                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 15703                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 15704                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 15705                                  ;				  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 15706                                  ;				  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 15707                                  ;				  already closed FCB and return EOF.
 15708                                  ;		 MZ 16 Jan   1984 More braindamage.  Need to separate info
 15709                                  ;				  out of sft into FCB for reconnection
 15710                                  ;
 15711                                  ;	    A000   version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 15712                                  
 15713                                  ; Defintions for FCBOp flags
 15714                                  
 15715                                  RANDOM	equ 2				; random operation
 15716                                  FCBREAD equ 4				; doing a read
 15717                                  BLOCK	equ 8				; doing a block I/O
 15718                                  
 15719                                  ;Break <GetRR - return the random record field in DX:AX>
 15720                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15721                                  ;
 15722                                  ;   GetRR - correctly load DX:AX with the random record field (3 or 4 bytes)
 15723                                  ;	from the FCB pointed to by DS:SI
 15724                                  ;
 15725                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to an FCB
 15726                                  ;		BX has record size
 15727                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15728                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15729                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15730                                  
 15731                                  GetRR:
 15732                                  	;mov	ax,[si+21h]
 15733 00002210 8B4421                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR]	; get low order part
 15734                                  	;mov	dx,[si+23h]
 15735 00002213 8B5423                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2]	; get high order part
 15736 00002216 83FB40                  	CMP	BX,64			; ignore MSB of RR if recsiz > 64
 15737 00002219 7202                    	JB	short GetRRBye
 15738                                  GetExtent_bye:	; 21/01/2024
 15739 0000221B 30F6                    	XOR	DH,DH
 15740                                  GetRRBye:
 15741 0000221D C3                      	retn
 15742                                  
 15743                                  ;Break <GetExtent - retrieve next location for sequential IO>
 15744                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15745                                  ;
 15746                                  ;   GetExtent - Construct the next record to perform I/O from the EXTENT and
 15747                                  ;	NR fields in the FCB.
 15748                                  ;
 15749                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - point to FCB
 15750                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15751                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15752                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15753                                  
 15754                                  GetExtent:
 15755                                  	;mov	al,[si+20h]
 15756 0000221E 8A4420                  	MOV	AL,[SI+SYS_FCB.NR]	; get low order piece
 15757                                  	;mov	dx,[si+0Ch]
 15758 00002221 8B540C                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT]	; get high order piece
 15759 00002224 D0E0                    	SHL	AL,1
 15760 00002226 D1EA                    	SHR	DX,1
 15761 00002228 D0D8                    	RCR	AL,1	; move low order bit of DL to high order of AH
 15762 0000222A 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15763 0000222C 88F2                    	MOV	DL,DH
 15764                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15765                                  	;XOR	DH,DH
 15766                                  	;retn
 15767 0000222E EBEB                    	jmp	short GetExtent_bye
 15768                                  
 15769                                  ;Break <SetExtent - update the extent/NR field>
 15770                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15771                                  ;
 15772                                  ;   SetExtent - change the position of an FCB by filling in the extent/NR
 15773                                  ;	fields
 15774                                  ;
 15775                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15776                                  ;		DX:AX is a record location in file
 15777                                  ;   Outputs:	Extent/NR fields are filled in
 15778                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 15779                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15780                                  
 15781                                  SetExtent:
 15782 00002230 50                      	push	ax
 15783 00002231 52                      	push	dx
 15784 00002232 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 15785 00002234 247F                    	AND	AL,7FH			; next rec field
 15786                                  	;mov	[si+20h],al
 15787 00002236 884420                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.NR],AL
 15788 00002239 80E180                  	AND	CL,80H			; save upper bit
 15789 0000223C D1E1                    	SHL	CX,1
 15790 0000223E D1D2                    	RCL	DX,1			; move high bit of CX to low bit of DX
 15791 00002240 88E8                    	MOV	AL,CH
 15792 00002242 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15793                                  	;mov	[si+0Ch], ax
 15794 00002244 89440C                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT],AX	; all done
 15795 00002247 5A                      	pop	dx
 15796 00002248 58                      	pop	ax
 15797 00002249 C3                      	retn
 15798                                  
 15799                                  ;Break <GetExtended - find FCB in potential extended fcb>
 15800                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15801                                  ;
 15802                                  ;   GetExtended - Make DS:SI point to FCB from DS:DX
 15803                                  ;
 15804                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 15805                                  ;   Outputs:	DS:SI point to the FCB part
 15806                                  ;		zeroflag set if not extended fcb
 15807                                  ;   Registers modified: SI
 15808                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15809                                  
 15810                                  GetExtended:
 15811 0000224A 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; point to Something
 15812 0000224C 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],-1		; look for extention
 15813 0000224F 7503                    	JNZ	short GetBye		; not there
 15814 00002251 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; point to FCB
 15815                                  GetBye:
 15816 00002254 39D6                    	CMP	SI,DX			; set condition codes
 15817                                  getextd_retn:
 15818 00002256 C3                      	retn
 15819                                  
 15820                                  ;Break <GetRecSize - return in BX the FCB record size>
 15821                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15822                                  ;
 15823                                  ;   GetRecSize - return in BX the record size from the FCB at DS:SI
 15824                                  ;
 15825                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to a non-extended FCB
 15826                                  ;   Outputs:	BX contains the record size
 15827                                  ;   Registers modified: None
 15828                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15829                                  
 15830                                  	; 22/01/2024
 15831                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15832                                  GetRecSize:
 15833                                  	;mov	bx,[si+0Eh]
 15834 00002257 8B5C0E                  	MOV	BX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ]	; get his record size
 15835 0000225A 09DB                    	OR	BX,BX			; is it nul?
 15836                                  	;jz	short getextd_retn
 15837                                  	; 22/01/2024 (BugFix)
 15838 0000225C 75F8                    	jnz	short getextd_retn
 15839                                  	;MOV	BX,128			; use default size
 15840 0000225E B380                    	mov	bl,128	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15841                                  	;mov	[si+0Eh],bx
 15842 00002260 895C0E                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],BX	; stuff it back
 15843 00002263 C3                      	retn
 15844                                  
 15845                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 15846                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:61B3h
 15847                                  
 15848                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 15849                                  
 15850                                  ;BREAK <$FCB_Random_write_Block - write a block of records to a file >
 15851                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15852                                  ;
 15853                                  ;   $FCB_Random_Write_Block - retrieve a location from the FCB, seek to it
 15854                                  ;	and write a number of blocks from it.
 15855                                  ;
 15856                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an FCB
 15857                                  ;   Outputs:	AL = 0 write was successful and the FCB position is updated
 15858                                  ;		AL <> 0 Not enough room on disk for the output
 15859                                  ;
 15860                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15861                                  
 15862                                  _$FCB_RANDOM_WRITE_BLOCK:
 15863                                  	;mov	AL,0Ah

 15950                                  ;BREAK <FCBIO - do internal FCB I/O>
 15951                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15952                                  ;
 15953                                  ;   FCBIO - look at FCBOP and merge all FCB operations into a single routine.
 15954                                  ;
 15955                                  ;   Inputs:	FCBOP flags which operations need to be performed
 15956                                  ;		DS:DX point to FCB
 15957                                  ;		CX may have count of number of records to xfer
 15958                                  ;   Outputs:	AL has error code
 15959                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 15960                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15961                                  
 15962                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15963                                  	; DOSCODE:5B17h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15964                                  
 15965                                  	; 23/01/2024
 15966                                  	; DOSCODE:5B2Bh (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 15967

 16302                                  ;   $FCB_Open - CPM compatability file open. The user has formatted an FCB
 16303                                  ;	for us and asked to have the rest filled in.
 16304                                  ;
 16305                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an unopenned FCB
 16306                                  ;   Outputs:	AL indicates status 0 is ok FF is error
 16307                                  ;		FCB has the following fields filled in:
 16308                                  ;		    Time/Date Extent/NR Size
 16309                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16310                                  
 16311                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16312                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6362h

 16314                                  _$FCB_OPEN:			; System call 15
 16315                                  	
 16316                                  	;mov	ax,2 
 16317 00002411 B80200                  	MOV	AX,SHARING_COMPAT+open_for_both
 16318                                  
 16319                                  ;hkn; DOS_Open is in DOSCODE
 16320 00002414 B9[F731]                	MOV	CX,DOS_OPEN
 16321                                  
 16322                                  ; The following is common code for Creation and openning of FCBs. AX is
 16323                                  ; either attributes (for create) or open mode (for open)... DS:DX points to
 16324                                  ; the FCB
 16325                                  
 16326                                  DoAccess:
 16327 00002417 1E                      	push	ds
 16328 00002418 52                      	push	dx
 16329 00002419 51                      	push	cx
 16330 0000241A 50                      	push	ax			; save FCB pointer away
 16331                                  
 16332                                  ;hkn; 	OpenBuf is in DOSDATA
 16333 0000241B BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF
 16334 0000241E E8E657                  	call	TransFCB		; crunch the fcb
 16335 00002421 58                      	pop	ax
 16336 00002422 59                      	pop	cx
 16337 00002423 5A                      	pop	dx
 16338 00002424 1F                      	pop	ds			; get fcb
 16339 00002425 7303                    	JNC	short FindFCB		; everything seems ok
 16340                                  FCBOpenErr:
 16341                                  	; AL has error code
 16342 00002427 E963E2                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16343                                  FindFCB:
 16344 0000242A E81DFE                  	call	GetExtended		; DS:SI will point to FCB
 16345

 16355 00002430 E803FB                  	call	LRUFCB			; get a sft entry (no error)
 16356 00002433 58                      	pop	ax
 16357 00002434 722A                    	jc	short HardMessage
 16358                                  	
 16359                                  	;mov	word [es:di+2],8000h
 16360 00002436 26C745020080            	mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB
 16361 0000243C 1E                      	push	ds
 16362 0000243D 56                      	push	si	
 16363 0000243E 53                      	push	bx			; save fcb pointer
 16364 0000243F 89CE                    	MOV	SI,CX
 16365                                  
 16366                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 16367 00002441 16                      	push	ss
 16368 00002442 1F                      	pop	ds			    ; let DOS_Open see variables
 16369 00002443 FFD6                    	CALL	SI ; DOS_OPEN or DOS_CREATE ; go open the file
 16370 00002445 5B                      	pop	bx
 16371 00002446 5E                      	pop	si

 16373                                  
 16374                                  ;hkn; SS override

 16376 0000244D 7318                    	JNC	short FCBOK		; operation succeeded
 16377                                  failopen:

 16379 00002450 B052                    	MOV	AL,"R"	; 52h		; clear out field (free sft)
 16380 00002452 E8C3FC                  	call	BlastSFT
 16381 00002455 58                      	POP	AX
 16382                                  	;cmp	ax,4
 16383 00002456 83F804                  	CMP	AX,error_too_many_open_files
 16384 00002459 7405                    	JZ	short HardMessage
 16385                                  	;cmp	ax,24h
 16386 0000245B 83F824                  	CMP	AX,error_sharing_buffer_exceeded
 16387 0000245E 7505                    	jnz	short DeadFCB
 16388                                  HardMessage:

 16391 00002464 58                      	POP	AX

 16393                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 16394                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16395 00002465 EBC0                    	jmp	short FCBOpenErr
 16396                                  FCBOK:
 16397                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16398 00002467 E8D8F3                  	call	IsSFTNet		;AN007;F.C. >32mb  Non Fat file?
 16399 0000246A 7531                    	JNZ	short FCBOK2		;AN007;F.C. >32mb  yes
 16400 0000246C E8D35F                  	call	CheckShare		;AN000;F.C. >32mb  share around?
 16401                                  	;JNZ	short FCBOK2		;AN000;F.C. >32mb  yes
 16402                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16403                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16404 0000246F 750A                    	jnz	short FCBOK1
 16405

 16408                                  ; LocalSFT variable to reflect this.
 16409

 16428                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],8
