 16435 0000248B 26C47D07                	les	di,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr] ; local file's DPB
 16436                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+0Fh],0
 16437 0000248F 26837D0F00              	cmp	word [es:di+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0 ; (16 bit FAT size)	
 16438 00002494 5F                      	pop	di
 16439 00002495 07                      	pop	es
 16440 00002496 7505                    	jnz	short FCBOK2	; not FAT32 (ok)
 16441                                  	;mov	ax,0Fh		; error_invalid_drive (for FAT32)
 16442 00002498 B80F00                  	mov	ax,error_invalid_drive
 16443 0000249B EBB2                    	jmp	short failopen
 16444                                  	;;; 
 16445                                  
 16446                                  FCBOK2:
 16447                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 16448 0000249D 26FF05                  	inc	word [es:di]
 16449                                  	;INC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count] ; increment reference count
 16450                                  
 16451                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16452                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16453                                  	;;;
 16454 000024A0 E87C25                  	call	set_sftfcb_entry
 16455                                  	;;;
 16456                                  
 16457 000024A3 E8C2F9                  	call	SaveFCBInfo
 16458                                  
 16459                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16460                                  	;call	SetOpenAge
 16461                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 16462                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],80h
 16463                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device
 16464 000024A6 26F6450580              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device  ; 28/07/2019
 16465 000024AB 7508                    	JNZ	short FCBNoDrive	; do not munge drive on devices
 16466                                  
 16467 000024AD 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]			; get drive byte
 16468 000024AF E8E656                  	call	GETTHISDRV		; convert
 16469                                  	;INC	AL
 16470                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16471 000024B2 40                      	inc	ax
 16472 000024B3 8804                    	MOV	[SI],AL			; stash in good drive letter
 16473                                  
 16474                                  FCBNoDrive:
 16475                                  	;mov	word [si+0Eh],128
 16476 000024B5 C7440E8000              	MOV	word [SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],80h ; stuff in default record size
 16477                                  
 16478                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16479                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16480                                  	;;;
 16481                                  	;;mov	ax,[es:di+0Dh]
 16482                                  	;MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_time] ; set time
 16483                                  	;;mov	[si+16h],ax
 16484                                  	;MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.FTIME],AX
 16485                                  	;;mov	ax,[es:di+0Fh]
 16486                                  	;MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_date] ; set date
 16487                                  	;;mov	[si+14h],ax
 16488                                  	;MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.FDATE],AX
 16489                                  	;;mov	ax,[es:di+11h]
 16490                                  	;MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_size] ; set sizes
 16491                                  	;;mov	[si+10h],ax
 16492                                  	;MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ],AX
 16493                                  	;;mov	ax,[es:di+13h]
 16494                                  	;MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_size+2]
 16495                                  	;;mov	[si+12h],ax
 16496                                  	;MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ+2],AX
 16497                                  	;
 16498 000024BA 06                      	push	es
 16499                                  	;les	ax,[es:di+0Dh]
 16500 000024BB 26C4450D                	les	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_time]
 16501                                  	;mov	[si+16h],ax
 16502 000024BF 894416                  	mov	[si+SYS_FCB.FTIME],ax	; set time
 16503                                  	;mov	[si+14h],es
 16504 000024C2 8C4414                  	mov	[si+SYS_FCB.FDATE],es	; set date
 16505 000024C5 07                      	pop	es
 16506 000024C6 06                      	push	es
 16507                                  	;les	ax,[es:di+11h]
 16508 000024C7 26C44511                	les	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_size] ; set size
 16509                                  	;mov	[si+10h],ax
 16510 000024CB 894410                  	mov	[si+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ],ax
 16511                                  	;mov	[si+12h],ax
 16512 000024CE 8C4412                  	mov	[si+SYS_FCB.FILSIZ+2],es
 16513 000024D1 07                      	pop	es
 16514                                  	;;;
 16515                                  	
 16516 000024D2 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; convenient zero
 16517                                  	;mov	[si+0Ch],ax
 16518 000024D4 89440C                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT],AX	; point to beginning of file
 16519                                  
 16520                                  ; We must scan the set of FCB SFTs for one that appears to match the current
 16521                                  ; one.	We cheat and use CheckFCB to match the FCBs.
 16522                                  
 16523                                  ;hkn; 	SS override
 16524 000024D7 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; get the pointer to head of the list
 16525                                  	;mov	ah,[es:di+4]
 16526 000024DC 268A6504                	MOV	AH,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; get number of SFTs to scan
 16527                                  OpenScan:
 16528                                  	;cmp	al,[si+18h]
 16529 000024E0 3A4418                  	CMP	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn]		; don't compare ourselves
 16530 000024E3 7407                    	JZ	short SkipCheck
 16531 000024E5 50                      	push	ax			; preserve count
 16532 000024E6 E848FC                  	call	CheckFCB		; do they match
 16533 000024E9 58                      	pop	ax			; get count back
 16534 000024EA 7309                    	JNC	short OpenFound		; found a match!
 16535                                  SkipCheck:
 16536 000024EC FEC0                    	INC	AL			; advance to next FCB
 16537 000024EE 38E0                    	CMP	AL,AH			; table full?
 16538 000024F0 75EE                    	JNZ	short OpenScan		; no, go for more
 16539                                  OpenDone:
 16540 000024F2 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; return success
 16541 000024F4 C3                      	retn
 16542                                  
 16543                                  ; The SFT at ES:DI is the one that is already in use for this FCB. We set the
 16544                                  ; FCB to use this one. We increment its ref count. We do NOT close it at all.
 16545                                  ; Consider:
 16546                                  ;
 16547                                  ;   open (foo)	delete (foo) open (bar)
 16548                                  ;
 16549                                  ; This causes us to recycle (potentially) bar through the same local SFT as
 16550                                  ; foo even though foo is no longer needed; this is due to the server closing
 16551                                  ; foo for us when we delete it. Unfortunately, we cannot see this closure.
 16552                                  ; If we were to CLOSE bar, the server would then close the only reference to
 16553                                  ; bar and subsequent I/O would be lost to the redirector.
 16554                                  ;
 16555                                  ; This gets solved by NOT closing the sft, but zeroing the ref count
 16556                                  ; (effectively freeing the SFT) and informing the sharer (if relevant) that
 16557                                  ; the SFT is no longer in use. Note that the SHARER MUST keep its ref counts
 16558                                  ; around. This will allow us to access the same file through multiple network
 16559                                  ; connections and NOT prematurely terminate when the ref count on one
 16560                                  ; connection goes to zero.
 16561                                  
 16562                                  OpenFound:
 16563                                  	;mov	[si+18h],al
 16564 000024F5 884418                  	MOV	[SI+fcb_sfn],AL 	; assign with this
 16565 000024F8 26FF05                  	inc	word [es:di]
 16566                                  	;INC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16567                                  					; remember this new invocation
 16568                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16569                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16570                                  	;;;
 16571 000024FB E82125                  	call	set_sftfcb_entry
 16572                                  	;;;
 16573                                  
 16574                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16575 000024FE 16                      	push	ss
 16576 000024FF 1F                      	pop	ds
 16577                                  	
 16578                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:FCBLRU]		; update LRU counts
 16579 00002500 A1[1000]                	mov	ax,[FCBLRU] ; 24/01/2024
 16580                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 16581 00002503 26894515                	MOV	[ES:DI+sf_LRU],AX
 16582                                  ;
 16583                                  ; We have an FCB sft that is now of no use. We release sharing info and then
 16584                                  ; blast it to prevent other reuse.
 16585                                  ;
 16586                                  	;push	ss
 16587                                  	;pop	ds
 16588                                  	
 16589 00002507 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 16590 0000250B 26FF0D                  	dec	word [es:di]
 16591                                  	;DEC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16592                                  					; free the newly allocated SFT
 16593 0000250E E8825F                  	call	ShareEnd
 16594 00002511 B043                    	MOV	AL,'C'	 ; 43h
 16595 00002513 E802FC                  	call	BlastSFT
 16596 00002516 EBDA                    	JMP	short OpenDone
 16597                                  
 16598                                  ;BREAK	<$FCB_Create - create a new directory entry>
 16599                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16600                                  ;
 16601                                  ;   $FCB_Create - CPM compatability file create. The user has formatted an
 16602                                  ;	FCB for us and asked to have the rest filled in.
 16603                                  ;
 16604                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an unopenned FCB
 16605                                  ;   Outputs:	AL indicates status 0 is ok FF is error
 16606                                  ;		FCB has the following fields filled in:
 16607                                  ;		    Time/Date Extent/NR Size
 16608                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16609                                  
 16610                                  _$FCB_CREATE:		; System call 22
 16611                                  
 16612                                  ;hkn; DOS_Create is in DOSCODE
 16613 00002518 B9[C630]                	MOV	CX,DOS_CREATE		; routine to call
 16614 0000251B 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; attributes to create
 16615 0000251D E82AFD                  	call	GetExtended		; get extended FCB
 16616 00002520 7403                    	JZ	short DoAccessJ		; not an extended FCB
 16617 00002522 8A44FF                  	MOV	AL,[SI-1]		; get attributes
 16618                                  DoAccessJ:
 16619 00002525 E9EFFE                  	JMP	DoAccess		; do dirty work
 16620                                  
 16621                                  ;============================================================================
 16622                                  ; SEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 16623                                  ;============================================================================
 16624                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16625                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16626                                  
 16627                                  ; DOSCODE:5DDFh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 16628                                  
 16629                                  ; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 16630                                  ; DOSCODE:5DCBh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 16631                                  
 16632                                  ;**	Search.asm
 16633                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16634                                  ;	Directory search system calls.
 16635                                  ;	These will be passed direct text of the pathname from the user. 
 16636                                  ;	They will need to be passed through the macro expander prior to
 16637                                  ;	being sent through the low-level stuff. 
 16638                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16639                                  ;
 16640                                  ;	$Dir_Search_First	  written
 16641                                  ;	$Dir_Search_Next	  written
 16642                                  ;	$Find_First	  written
 16643                                  ;	$Find_Next		  written
 16644                                  ;	PackName		  written
 16645                                  ;
 16646                                  ;	Modification history:
 16647                                  ;
 16648                                  ;	  Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16649                                  
 16650                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16651                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16652                                  ;
 16653                                  ; Inputs:
 16654                                  ;	DS:DX Points to unopenned FCB
 16655                                  ; Function:
 16656                                  ;	Directory is searched for first matching entry and the directory
 16657                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16658                                  ; Returns:
 16659                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16660                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16661                                  
 16662                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 2B88h
 16663                                  	
 16664                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16665                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DCBh
 16666                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DDFh
 16667                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:647Bh
 16668                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:61E5h
 16669                                  
 16670                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_FIRST:
 16671 00002528 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16672 0000252D 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16673 00002532 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16674 00002534 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFH
 16675 00002537 7503                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB4
 16676 00002539 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; Point to drive select byte
 16677                                  NORMFCB4:
 16678 0000253C FF34                    	push	word [SI]		; Save original drive byte for later
 16679                                  
 16680 0000253E 16                      	push	ss
 16681 0000253F 07                      	pop	es			; get es to address DOSGroup
 16682                                  
 16683 00002540 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16684 00002543 E8C156                  	call	TransFCB		; convert the FCB, set SATTRIB EXTFCB
 16685 00002546 7304                    	JNC	short SearchIt		; no error, go and look
 16686 00002548 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16687                                  
 16688                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16689                                  
 16690                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16691                                  dcf_errj:
 16692 00002549 E941E1                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; error
 16693                                  
 16694                                  SearchIt:
 16695 0000254C 16                      	push	ss
 16696 0000254D 1F                      	pop	ds			; get ready for search
 16697                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16698                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16699                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16700 0000254E C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16701 00002552 57                      	push	di
 16702 00002553 06                      	push	es
 16703 00002554 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16704 0000255A 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16705                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16706                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16707                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16708 0000255E E8B90F                  	call	GET_FAST_SEARCH		; search
 16709 00002561 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16710 00002565 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16711 00002569 735A                    	JNC	short SearchSet		; no error, transfer info
 16712 0000256B 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16713                                  
 16714                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16715                                  
 16716                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16717                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16718 0000256C EBDB                    	jmp	short dcf_errj
 16719                                  
 16720                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16721                                  ;
 16722                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_NEXT
 16723                                  ;
 16724                                  ; Inputs:
 16725                                  ;	DS:DX points to unopenned FCB returned by $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16726                                  ; Function:
 16727                                  ;	Directory is searched for the next matching entry and the directory
 16728                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16729                                  ; Returns:
 16730                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16731                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16732                                  
 16733                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16734                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E5Fh
 16735                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E73h
 16736                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6517h
 16737                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6273h
 16738                                  
 16739                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_NEXT:
 16740 0000256E 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16741 00002573 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16742                                  	; 24/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 16743                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0
 16744                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0
 16745 00002578 B000                    	mov	al,0
 16746 0000257A 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16747 0000257E 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16748                                  
 16749 00002582 16                      	push	ss
 16750 00002583 07                      	pop	es
 16751                                  
 16752 00002584 BF[BE04]                	MOV	DI,SEARCHBUF
 16753                                  
 16754 00002587 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16755 00002589 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFh
 16756 0000258C 750D                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB6
 16757 0000258E 83C606                  	ADD	SI,6
 16758 00002591 AC                      	LODSB
 16759                                  
 16760 00002592 36A2[6D05]              	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],AL
 16761 00002596 36FE0E[6C05]            	DEC	byte [SS:EXTFCB]
 16762                                  NORMFCB6:

 16993                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16994                                  ;**	PackName - Convert file names from FCB to ASCIZ format.
 16995                                  ;
 16996                                  ;	PackName transfers a file name from DS:SI to ES:DI and converts it to
 16997                                  ;	the ASCIZ format.
 16998                                  ;
 16999                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:SI) = 11 character FCB or dir entry name
 17000                                  ;		(ES:DI) = destination area (13 bytes)
 17001                                  ;	EXIT	(ds:SI) and (es:DI) advanced
 17002                                  ;	USES	al, CX, SI, DI, Flags  (BUGBUG - not verified - jgl)
 17003                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17004                                  
 17005                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17006                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6627h
 17007                                  
 17008                                  PackName:
 17009                                  ;	Move over 8 characters to cover the name component, then trim it's
 17010                                  ;	trailing blanks.
 17011                                  
 17012                                  	;MOV	CX,8			; Pack the name
 17013                                  	;REP	MOVSB			; Move all of it
 17014                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17015 000026A8 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 17016 000026AB F3A5                    	rep	movsw
 17017                                  main_kill_tail:
 17018 000026AD 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 17019 000026B2 7507                    	JNZ	short find_check_dot
 17020 000026B4 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 17021 000026B5 41                      	INC	CX
 17022 000026B6 83F908                  	CMP	CX,8
 17023 000026B9 72F2                    	JB	short main_kill_tail
 17024                                  find_check_dot:
 17025                                  	;CMP	WORD [SI],(" " << 8) | " "
 17026 000026BB 813C2020                	cmp     word [si],2020h 
 17027 000026BF 7506                    	JNZ	short got_ext 		; Some chars in extension
 17028 000026C1 807C0220                	CMP	BYTE [SI+2]," "
 17029 000026C5 740F                    	JZ	short find_done		; No extension
 17030                                  got_ext:
 17031 000026C7 B02E                    	MOV	AL,"."	; 2Eh
 17032 000026C9 AA                      	STOSB
 17033                                  	;MOV	CX,3
 17034                                  	;; 18/12/2022
 17035                                  	;;mov	cl,3
 17036                                  	;;REP	MOVSB
 17037                                  	;movsb
 17038                                  	;movsb
 17039                                  	;movsb
 17040                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17041 000026CA A5                      	movsw
 17042 000026CB A4                      	movsb
 17043                                  ext_kill_tail:
 17044 000026CC 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 17045 000026D1 7503                    	JNZ	short find_done
 17046 000026D3 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 17047 000026D4 EBF6                    	JMP	short ext_kill_tail
 17048                                  find_done:
 17049 000026D6 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 17050 000026D8 AA                      	STOSB				; NUL terminate
 17051 000026D9 C3                      	retn

 17077                                  ; DOSCODE:5FB0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17078                                  
 17079                                  ;**	Directory related system calls. These will be passed direct text of the
 17080                                  ;	pathname from the user. They will need to be passed through the macro
 17081                                  ;	expander prior to being sent through the low-level stuff. I/O specs are
 17082                                  ;	defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 17083                                  ;
 17084                                  ;	$CURRENT_DIR  Written
 17085                                  ;	$RMDIR	  Written
 17086                                  ;	$CHDIR	  Written
 17087                                  ;	$MKDIR	  Written
 17088                                  ;
 17089                                  ;
 17090                                  ;	Modification history:
 17091                                  ;
 17092                                  ;	    Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17093                                  ;		 MZ 10 May 1983     CurrentDir implemented
 17094                                  ;		 MZ 11 May 1983     RmDir, ChDir, MkDir implemented
 17095                                  ;		 EE 19 Oct 1983     RmDir no longer allows you to delete a
 17096                                  ;				    current directory.
 17097                                  ;		 MZ 19 Jan 1983     Brain damaged applications rely on success
 17098                                  
 17099                                  ;	I_Need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to Current CDS
 17100                                  ;	I_Need	WFP_Start,WORD		; pointer to beginning of directory text
 17101                                  ;	I_Need	Curr_Dir_End,WORD	; offset to end of directory part
 17102                                  ;	I_Need	OpenBuf,128		; temp spot for translated name
 17103                                  ;	I_need	fSplice,BYTE		; TRUE => do splice
 17104                                  ;	I_Need	NoSetDir,BYTE		; TRUE => no exact match on splice
 17105                                  ;	I_Need	cMeta,BYTE
 17106                                  ;	I_Need	DrvErr,BYTE					;AN000;
 17107                                  
 17108                                  ;BREAK <$CURRENT_DIR - dump the current directory into user space>
 17109                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17110                                  ;
 17111                                  ;   Procedure Name : $CURRENT_DIR
 17112                                  ;
 17113                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17114                                  ;		LDS	SI,area
 17115                                  ;		MOV	DL,drive
 17116                                  ;		INT	21h
 17117                                  ;	    ; DS:SI is a pointer to 64 byte area that contains drive
 17118                                  ;	    ; current directory.
 17119                                  ;   Error returns:
 17120                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_drive
 17121                                  ;
 17122                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17123                                  
 17124                                  	; 06/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17125                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 2D4Eh
 17126                                  
 17127                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17128                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5F9Ch  ; Retro DOS v4.1 (& v4.0)
 17129                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5FB0h ; Retro DOS v4.2
 17130                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6393h
 17131                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6664h ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17132                                  
 17133                                  _$CURRENT_DIR:
 17134 000026DA E805F2                  	call	ECritDisk
 17135 000026DD 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL			; get drive number (0=def, 1=A)
 17136 000026DF E89A54                  	call	GetVisDrv		; grab it

 17138                                  CurdirErr:

 17162 000026FB C606[4C03]00            	mov	byte [NoSetDir],0 ; *
 17163                                  	
 17164                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17165                                  	;lds     si,[THISCDS]
 17166                                  
 17167                                  ; 16/12/2022
 17168                                  %if 0

 17354                                  ; DOSCODE:6065h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17355                                  
 17356                                  ;BREAK <$ChDir -- Change current directory on a drive>
 17357                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17358                                  ;
 17359                                  ; $ChDir - Top-level change directory system call.  This call is responsible
 17360                                  ; for setting up the CDS for the specified drive appropriately.  There are
 17361                                  ; several cases to consider:
 17362                                  ;
 17363                                  ;   o	Local, simple CDS.  In this case, we take the input path and convert
 17364                                  ;	it into a WFP.	We verify the existance of this directory and then
 17365                                  ;	copy the WFP into the CDS and set up the ID field to point to the
 17366                                  ;	directory cluster.
 17367                                  ;   o	Net CDS.  We form the path from the root (including network prefix)
 17368                                  ;	and verify its existance (via DOS_Chdir).  If successful, we copy the
 17369                                  ;	WFP back into the CDS.
 17370                                  ;   o	SUBST'ed CDS.  This is no different than the local, simple CDS.
 17371                                  ;   o	JOIN'ed CDS.  This is trouble as there are two CDS's at work.  If we
 17372                                  ;	call TransPath, we will get the PHYSICAL CDS that the path refers to
 17373                                  ;	and the PHYSICAL WFP that the input path refers to.  This is perfectly
 17374                                  ;	good for the validation but not for currency.  We call TransPathNoSet
 17375                                  ;	to process the path but to return the logical CDS and the logical
 17376                                  ;	path.  We then copy the logical path into the logical CDS.
 17377                                  ;
 17378                                  ; Inputs:
 17379                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17380                                  ; Returns:
 17381                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17382                                  ;	AX = chdir_path_not_found if error
 17383                                  ;
 17384                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17385                                  	
 17386                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17387                                  	
 17388                                  _$CHDIR:
 17389                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17390                                  	;;;
 17391 0000278D 36C606[5411]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17392                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 17393                                  	;;;
 17394 00002793 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17395 00002796 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get source

 17397 0000279B 7304                    	JNC	short ChDirCrack	; no errors, try path
 17398                                  ChDirErrP:

 17453

 17649                                  ; IOCTL.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 17650                                  ;============================================================================
 17651                                  ; 07/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17652                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17653                                  
 17654                                  ;**	IOCTL system call.
 17655                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17656                                  ;	$IOCTL
 17657                                  ;
 17658                                  ;	  Revision history:
 17659                                  ;
 17660                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17661                                  ;
 17662                                  ;		GenericIOCTL added:		KGS	22 April 1985
 17663                                  ;
 17664                                  ;		A000	version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 17665                                  ;
 17666                                  ;		Used jump table to dispatch IOCTL functions. HKN 3/12/90
 17667                                  ;
 17668                                  
 17669                                  ;BREAK <IOCTL - munge on a handle to do device specific stuff>
 17670                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17671                                  ;
 17672                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17673                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 17674                                  ;	    MOV     DX, Data
 17675                                  ;
 17676                                  ;	(or LDS     DX,BUF
 17677                                  ;	    MOV     CX,COUNT)
 17678                                  ;
 17679                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Ioctl
 17680                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 17681                                  ;	    INT     21h
 17682                                  ;
 17683                                  ;   AH = 0  Return a combination of low byte of sf_flags and device driver
 17684                                  ;	    attribute word in DX, handle in BX:
 17685                                  ;	    DH = high word of device driver attributes
 17686                                  ;	    DL = low byte of sf_flags
 17687                                  ;	 1  Set the bits contained in DX to sf_flags.  DH MUST be 0.  Handle
 17688                                  ;	    in BX.
 17689                                  ;	 2  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for handle in BX
 17690                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17691                                  ;	 3  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for handle in BX from
 17692                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17693                                  ;	 4  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for drive in BX
 17694                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17695                                  ;	 5  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for drive in BX from
 17696                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17697                                  ;	 6  Return input status of handle in BX. If a read will go to the
 17698                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17699                                  ;	 7  Return output status of handle in BX. If a write will go to the
 17700                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17701                                  ;	 8  Given a drive in BX, return 1 if the device contains non-
 17702                                  ;	    removable media, 0 otherwise.
 17703                                  ;	 9  Return the contents of the device attribute word in DX for the
 17704                                  ;	    drive in BX.  0200h is the bit for shared.	1000h is the bit for
 17705                                  ;	    network. 8000h is the bit for local use.
 17706                                  ;	 A  Return 8000h if the handle in BX is for the network or not.
 17707                                  ;	 B  Change the retry delay and the retry count for the system. BX is
 17708                                  ;	    the count and CX is the delay.
 17709                                  ;
 17710                                  ;   Error returns:
 17711                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 17712                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 17713                                  ;	       = error_invalid_data
 17714                                  ;
 17715                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17716                                  ;
 17717                                  ;   This is the documentation copied from DOS 4.0 it is much better
 17718                                  ;   than the above
 17719                                  ;
 17720                                  ;	There are several basic forms of IOCTL calls:
 17721                                  ;
 17722                                  ;
 17723                                  ;	** Get/Set device information:	**
 17724                                  ;
 17725                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17726                                  ;		  0 - Get device information
 17727                                  ;		  1 - Set device information
 17728                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17729                                  ;		(DX) = info for "Set Device Information"
 17730                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17731                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17732                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17733                                  ;		  (DX) = info for "Get Device Information"
 17734                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17735                                  ;
 17736                                  ;
 17737                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Handle  **
 17738                                  ;
 17739                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17740                                  ;		  2 - Read device control info
 17741                                  ;		  3 - Write device control info
 17742                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17743                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17744                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17745                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17746                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17747                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17748                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17749                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17750                                  ;
 17751                                  ;
 17752                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Block Device  **
 17753                                  ;
 17754                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17755                                  ;		  4 - Read device control info
 17756                                  ;		  5 - Write device control info
 17757                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17758                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17759                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17760                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17761                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17762                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17763                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17764                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17765                                  ;
 17766                                  ;
 17767                                  ;	**  Get Input/Output Status  **
 17768                                  ;
 17769                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17770                                  ;		  6 - Get Input status
 17771                                  ;		  7 - Get Output Status
 17772                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17773                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17774                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17775                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17776                                  ;		  (AL) = 00 if not ready
 17777                                  ;		  (AL) = FF if ready
 17778                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17779                                  ;
 17780                                  ;
 17781                                  ;	**  Get Drive Information  **
 17782                                  ;
 17783                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17784                                  ;		  8 - Check for removable media
 17785                                  ;		  9 - Get device attributes
 17786                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17787                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17788                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17789                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17790                                  ;		  (AX) = 0/1 media is removable/fixed (func. 8)
 17791                                  ;		  (DX) = device attribute word (func. 9)
 17792                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17793                                  ;
 17794                                  ;
 17795                                  ;	**  Get Redirected bit	**
 17796                                  ;
 17797                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17798                                  ;		  0Ah - Network stuff
 17799                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17800                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17801                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17802                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17803                                  ;		  (DX) = SFT flags word, 8000h set if network file
 17804                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17805                                  ;
 17806                                  ;
 17807                                  ;	**  Change sharer retry parameters  **
 17808                                  ;
 17809                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17810                                  ;		  0Bh - Set retry parameters
 17811                                  ;		(CX) = retry loop count
 17812                                  ;		(DX) = number of retries
 17813                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17814                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17815                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17816                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17817                                  ;
 17818                                  ;
 17819                                  ;   =================================================================
 17820                                  ;
 17821                                  ;	**  New Standard Control  **
 17822                                  ;
 17823                                  ;	ALL NEW IOCTL FACILITIES SHOULD USE THIS FORM.	THE OTHER
 17824                                  ;	FORMS ARE OBSOLETE.
 17825                                  ;
 17826                                  ;   =================================================================
 17827                                  ;
 17828                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17829                                  ;		  0Ch - Control Function subcode
 17830                                  ;		(BX) = File Handle
 17831                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17832                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17833                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17834                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17835                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17836                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17837                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17838                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17839                                  ;		  (SI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17840                                  ;		  (DI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17841                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17842                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17843                                  ;
 17844                                  ;    ============== Generic IOCTL Definitions for DOS 3.2 ============
 17845                                  ;     (See inc\ioctl.inc for more info)
 17846                                  ;
 17847                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17848                                  ;		  0Dh - Control Function subcode
 17849                                  ;		(BL) = Drive Number (0 = Default, 1= 'A')
 17850                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17851                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17852                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17853                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17854                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17855                                  ;
 17856                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17857                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17858                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17859                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17860                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17861                                  ;
 17862                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17863                                  	
 17864                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17865                                  	; DOSCODE:611Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17866                                  
 17867                                  	; 11/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17868                                  	; DOSCODE:610Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 17869                                  
 17870                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17871                                  	; DOSCODE:67F7h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 17872                                  
 17873                                  IOCTLJMPTABLE:	;label	word
 17874                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 17875 00002861 [9D28]                  	dw	ioctl_getset_data	; 0

 17931                                  ioctl_getset_data:
 17932                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17933 0000289D E83B4E                  	call	SFFromHandle		; ES:DI -> SFT
 17934 000028A0 7305                    	JNC	short ioctl_check_permissions ; have valid handle
 17935                                  ioctl_bad_handle:

 17943                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+5]
 17944 000028A9 268A4505                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]; Get low byte of flags
 17945 000028AD 7419                    	JZ	short ioctl_read	; read the byte
 17946

 17948 000028B1 7404                    	JZ	short ioctl_check_device ; can I set with this data?
 17949                                  	;mov	al,0Dh
 17950 000028B3 B00D                    	mov	al,error_invalid_data	; no DH <> 0
 17951                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 17952 000028B5 EBED                    	jmp	short ioctl_error
 17953                                  
 17954                                  ioctl_check_device:
 17955 000028B7 A880                    	test	AL,devid_device  ; 80h	; can I set this handle?
 17956 000028B9 74DF                    	jz	short ioctl_bad_funj2
 17957 000028BB 80CA80                  	OR	DL,devid_device 	; Make sure user doesn't turn off the
 17958                                  					;   device bit!! He can muck with the
 17959                                  					;   others at will.
 17960                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 17961                                  	; 29/01/2024

 17966                                  ioctl_ok:

 17968

 17974                                  	;;;

 18039 000028FF B401                    	MOV	AH,1

 18046 0000290B 58                      	POP	AX

 18066                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18067                                  ;
 18068                                  ; Generic IOCTL entry point. AL = C, D, 10h, 11h
 18069                                  ;
 18070                                  ;	here we invoke the Generic IOCTL using the IOCTL_Req structure.
 18071                                  ;	SI:DX -> Users Device Parameter Table
 18072                                  ;	IOCALL -> IOCTL_Req structure
 18073                                  ;
 18074                                  ; 	If on entry AL >= IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE the function is a
 18075                                  ;	QueryIOCtlSupport call ELSE it's a standard generic IOCtl
 18076                                  ;	call.
 18077                                  ;
 18078                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between GENERIOCTL: and 
 18079                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 18080                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 18081                                  ;
 18082                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18083                                  
 18084                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18085                                  
 18086                                  query_handle_support:	; Entry point for handles
 18087                                  GENERICIOCTLHANDLE:
 18088 0000291B E8BD4D                  	call	SFFromHandle		; Get SFT for device.
 18089 0000291E 727E                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_handlej
 18090                                  
 18091                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 18092                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet	; M031;
 18093                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 18094 00002920 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 18095 00002925 757A                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; Cannot do this over net.
 18096                                  
 18097                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 18098                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18099                                  	;;;
 18100 00002927 E8C1E9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_ser ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 18101                                  	;;;
 18102                                  
 18103                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 18104 0000292A 26C47D07                	les	di,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]	; Get pointer to device.
 18105                                  	;;;
 18106                                  	; 29/01/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 18107 0000292E C606[B103]FF            	mov	byte [IOCTL_drvnum],0FFh	; invalidate drive number
 18108                                  					; (for extended -lock/unlock- functions)
 18109                                  	;;;
 18110 00002933 EB16                    	jmp	short Do_GenIOCTL
 18111                                  
 18112                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18113                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:68DAh
 18114                                  	; (WINME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6612h)
 18115                                  
 18116                                  query_device_support:	; Entry point for devices:
 18117                                  GENERICIOCTL:
 18118                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 18119                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18120                                  	;;;
 18121 00002935 E8AEE9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 18122 00002938 80FD48                  	cmp	ch,48h			; category (extended, disk lock/unlock)
 18123 0000293B 7405                    	je      short GenIOCTL_chk_net	; extended (MSDOS/PCDOS 7)
 18124                                  	;;;
 18125                                  
 18126 0000293D 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8		; Only disk devices are allowed to use
 18127 00002940 755F                    	jne	short ioctl_bad_fun	; no handles with Generic IOCTL.
 18128                                  
 18129                                  	; 29/01/2024 
 18130                                  	;;;
 18131                                  GenIOCTL_chk_net:
 18132 00002942 881E[B103]              	mov	[IOCTL_drvnum],bl	; drive number
 18133                                  	;;;
 18134                                  
 18135 00002946 E8C301                  	CALL	Check_If_Net		; ES:DI := Get_hdr_block of device in BL
 18136 00002949 7556                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_fun	; There are no "net devices", and they
 18137                                  
 18138                                  Do_GenIOCTL:
 18139                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 18140                                  	;;;
 18141 0000294B 80FD48                  	cmp	ch,48h			; category code 48h for FAT32
 18142 0000294E 7456                    	je	short GenIOCTL_extended ; MSDOS/PCDOS 7 functions (lock/unlock)
 18143                                  	;cmp	ch,8
 18144 00002950 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8          	; disk control
 18145 00002953 7451                    	je	short GenIOCTL_extended
 18146                                  GenIOCTL_normal:			; MSDOS 5-6.22 functions
 18147                                  	;;;
 18148                                  
 18149                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 
 18150                                  					; Can device handle Generic IOCTL funcs
 18151                                  	; 09/09/2018

 18153 00002955 26F6450440              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 ; 0040h

 18176                                  					; Setup Generic IOCTL Request Block

 18179                                  	; 07/09/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 18180                                  	;;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],19
