 22443                                  ;============================================================================
 22444                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22445                                  ;============================================================================
 22446                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22447                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22448                                  
 22449                                  ;**
 22450                                  ;
 22451                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 22452                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 22453                                  ;
 22454                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 22455                                  ;
 22456                                  ;   Modification history:
 22457                                  ;
 22458                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 22459                                  ;
 22460                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 22461                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 22462                                  ;
 22463                                  
 22464                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 22465                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22466                                  ;
 22467                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 22468                                  ;
 22469                                  ; Inputs:
 22470                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 22471                                  ; Function:
 22472                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 22473                                  ; Returns:
 22474                                  ;       None
 22475                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 22476                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22477                                  
 22478                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22479                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7685h
 22480                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:74F4h) 
 22481                                  
 22482                                  DOS_ABORT:
 22483 000036AC 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 22484 000036B1 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 22485                                  reset_free_jfn:
 22486 000036B6 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 22487 000036B8 51                      	PUSH    CX
 22488 000036B9 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 22489                                  
 22490 000036BA E8B840                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 22491 000036BD 59                      	POP     CX
 22492 000036BE E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 22493                                  
 22494                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 22495                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 22496                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 22497                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 22498                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 22499                                  ;
 22500                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 22501                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 22502                                  ;
 22503                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 22504                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 22505                                  ; up after this process.
 22506                                  ;
 22507                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 22508                                  
 22509                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 22510 000036C0 16                      	push	ss
 22511 000036C1 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 22512                                  
 22513                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 22514 000036C2 B81D11                  	mov	ax,111Dh
 22515 000036C5 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 22516                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 22517                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 22518                                  ;if installed
 22519 000036C7 FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 22520                                  ;else
 22521                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 22522                                  ;endif
 22523                                  
 22524                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 22525                                  ; counts.
 22526                                  					; SS override
 22527 000036CB 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 22528                                  
 22529                                  	;;;
 22530                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22531                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22532                                  SFTFCB_check:
 22533 000036D0 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 22534 000036D2 09F9                    	or	cx,di
 22535 000036D4 E325                    	jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22536 000036D6 57                      	push	di
 22537                                  SFTFCB_OK:
 22538                                  	;;;
 22539                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 22540 000036D7 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 22541                                  	;jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22542                                  	; 27/06/2024
 22543                                  	;;;
 22544 000036DB E315                    	jcxz    SFTFCB_check2	
 22545                                  	;;;
 22546                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 22547 000036DD 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 22548 000036E0 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22549                                  FCBTest:
 22550                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22551 000036E4 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 22552 000036E8 7503                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 22553                                  
 22554                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22555                                  %if 0
 22556                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22557                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; yes, blast ref count
 22558                                  %else
 22559                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22560                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22561 000036EA E80514                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22562                                  %endif
 22563                                  
 22564                                  FCBNext:
 22565 000036ED 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 22566 000036F0 E2F2                    	loop    FCBTest
 22567                                  
 22568                                  	; 27/06/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22569                                  	;;;
 22570                                  SFTFCB_check2:
 22571 000036F2 5F                      	pop	di
 22572 000036F3 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di]
 22573 000036F6 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22574 000036F9 75D5                    	jne	short SFTFCB_check
 22575                                  	;;;
 22576                                  
 22577                                  FCBScanDone:
 22578                                  
 22579                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 22580                                  
 22581 000036FB 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 22582                                  Scan:
 22583 000036FD 53                      	push    bx
 22584 000036FE E8F03F                  	call	SFFromSFN
 22585 00003701 5B                      	pop     bx
 22586                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 22587                                  	;retn
 22588                                  
 22589                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22590                                  	;jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 22591                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22592 00003702 7232                    	jc	short RET2
 22593                                  
 22594                                  ;M038
 22595                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 22596                                  
 22597                                  Scan1:
 22598                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 22599                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 22600                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22601 00003704 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 22602                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 22603                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 22604 00003708 7517                    	jnz	short scan_next ; no
 22605                                  ;
 22606                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 22607                                  ;
 22608 0000370A 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22609                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22610 0000370E 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 22611 00003712 750D                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22612 00003714 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 22613                                  	;sub	ax,[es:di+2Fh] ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 03/02/2024
 22614                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 22615 00003718 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 22616 0000371C 7503                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22617                                  
 22618                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 22619                                  
 22620                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22621                                  %if 0
 22622                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22623                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 22624                                  %else
 22625                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22626                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22627 0000371E E8D113                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22628                                  %endif
 22629                                  
 22630                                  scan_next:
 22631 00003721 43                      	inc     bx
 22632 00003722 EBD9                    	jmp     short Scan
 22633                                  
 22634                                  ;============================================================================
 22635                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22636                                  ;============================================================================
 22637                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22638                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22639                                  
 22640                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 22641                                  ;
 22642                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 22643                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 22644                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 22645                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 22646                                  ;
 22647                                  ;	Revision history:
 22648                                  ;
 22649                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 22650                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 22651                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 22652                                  
 22653                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 22654                                  
 22655                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 22656                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22657                                  ;
 22658                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 22659                                  ;
 22660                                  ; Inputs:
 22661                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 22662                                  ; Function:
 22663                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 22664                                  ; Returns:
 22665                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 22666                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22667                                  ;	Carry set if error
 22668                                  ;	    AX has error code
 22669                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22670                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22671                                  
 22672                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 22673                                  
 22674                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22675                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22676                                  
 22677                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22678                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22679                                  
 22680                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 22681                                  
 22682                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22683                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:76FEh
 22684                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7579h) 
 22685                                  
 22686                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 22687 00003724 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22688                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 22689 00003728 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22690                                  
 22691                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 22692                                  
 22693                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 22694                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 22695                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22696                                  	;test	bh,80h
 22697 0000372C F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 22698 0000372F 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 22699                                  
 22700                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 22701 00003731 B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 22702 00003734 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 22703                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22704                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22705                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22706                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22707                                  RET2:		; 03/02/2024
 22708 00003736 C3                      	retn
 22709                                  
 22710                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 22711                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 22712                                  ;
 22713                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 22714                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 22715                                  
 22716                                  LocalClose:
 22717 00003737 E8A8E1                  	call	ECritDisk
 22718 0000373A E8C501                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 22719 0000373D E84801                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 22720                                  
 22721                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 22722                                  	;Context DS
 22723 00003740 16                      	push	ss
 22724 00003741 1F                      	pop	ds
 22725                                  
 22726 00003742 50                      	push	ax
 22727 00003743 53                      	push	bx
 22728 00003744 E84C4D                  	call	ShareEnd
 22729 00003747 5B                      	pop	bx
 22730 00003748 58                      	pop	ax
 22731                                  
 22732                                  ; Commit enters here. AX from commit MUST be <> 1, BX is flags word
 22733                                  
 22734                                  CloseEntry:
 22735 00003749 50                      	PUSH	AX
 22736                                  
 22737                                  ; File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 22738                                  
 22739                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 22740                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22741 0000374A F6C3C0                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22742                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22743 0000374D 7403                    	JZ	short rdir
 22744                                  	; 14/11/2022
 22745 0000374F E9FD00                  	JMP	FREE_SFT_OK		; either clean or device
 22746                                  	;jnz	short FREE_SFT_OK ; 24/07/2019	
 22747                                  
 22748                                  ; Retrieve the directory entry for the file
 22749                                  
 22750                                  rdir:
 22751 00003752 E84001                  	CALL	DirFromSFT
 22752                                  	;mov	al,5
 22753 00003755 B005                    	MOV	AL,error_access_denied
 22754                                  	
 22755                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22756                                  	;JNC	short clook
 22757                                  	;; 14/11/2022
 22758                                  	;JMP	CloseFinish		; pretend the close worked.
 22759                                  	;;jc	short CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 22760                                  	
 22761                                  	;;;
 22762                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22763                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22764 00003757 723D                    	jc	short jmp_to_CloseFinish ; pretend the close worked.
 22765                                  rdir2:
 22766                                  	;test	word [si+2],4
 22767 00003759 F6440204                	test	byte [si+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],4 ; devid_device_null
 22768                                  					; bit 2 - null device
 22769 0000375D 751C                    	jnz	short clook
 22770                                  
 22771 0000375F 1E                      	push	ds
 22772 00003760 53                      	push	bx

 22775 00003761 C55C07                  	lds	bx,[si+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr] ; pointer to DPB
 22776

 22791                                  	;;;

 23229                                  ;
 23230                                  ;**	DOS_Commit - UPdate Directory Entries
 23231                                  ;
 23232                                  ;	ENTRY	same as DOS_CLOSE (??? BUGBUG - update this jgl)
 23233                                  ;		(DS) = DOSGROUP
 23234                                  ;	EXIT	Same as DOS_CLOSE except ref_count field is not altered
 23235                                  ;	USES	all but DS
 23236                                  ;
 23237                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23238                                  
 23239                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23240                                  ; DOSCODE:6F72h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23241                                  
 23242                                  ; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23243                                  ; DOSCODE:78B8h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23244                                  
 23245                                  DOS_COMMIT:
 23246                                  	;hkn; called from srvcall. DS already set up.
 23247 000038D3 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 23248                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+5]
 23249 000038D7 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 23250                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 23251                                  	; 17/12/2022
 23252 000038DB F6C3C0                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device ;Clears carry
 23253                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device ;Clears carry
 23254 000038DE 75F2                    	jnz	short PopDone_retn
 23255                                  	;test	bx,8000h
 23256                                  	; 17/12/2022
 23257                                  	;test	bh,80h
 23258 000038E0 F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 23259                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet ; 8000h
 23260 000038E3 7406                    	JZ	short LOCAL_COMMIT
 23261                                  
 23262                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 23263                                  ;	transfer NET_COMMIT
 23264                                  ;ELSE
 23265                                  	;mov	ax,1107h
 23266 000038E5 B80711                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|7
 23267 000038E8 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - COMMIT REMOTE FILE
 23268                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 23269                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 23270                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 23271                                  			; CF clear if successful
 23272                                  localcommit_retn: ; 18/12/2022	
 23273 000038EA C3                      	retn
 23274                                  ;ENDIF
 23275                                  
 23276                                  ; Perform local commit operation by doing a close but not releaseing the SFT.
 23277                                  ; There are three ways we can do this. One is to enter a critical section to
 23278                                  ; protect a potential free. The second is to increment the ref count to mask
 23279                                  ; the close decrementing.
 23280                                  ;
 23281                                  ; The proper way is to let the caller's of close decide if a decrement should
 23282                                  ; be done. We do this by providing another entry into close after the
 23283                                  ; decrement and after the share information release.
 23284                                  
 23285                                  ; DOSCODE:6FA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23286                                  ; DOSCODE:6F8Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23287                                  
 23288                                  LOCAL_COMMIT:
 23289 000038EB E8F4DF                  	call	ECritDisk
 23290                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23291 000038EE E8F1DF                  	call	ECritDisk	;PTM.
 23292 000038F1 E80E00                  	call	SetSFTTimes
 23293 000038F4 B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 23294 000038F7 E84FFE                  	call	CloseEntry
 23295                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23296 000038FA 9C                      	PUSHF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 23297 000038FB E81E19                  	call	DEV_OPEN_SFT	;PTM.  increment device count	;AN000;
 23298 000038FE 9D                      	POPF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 23299                                  	;call	LCritDisk	;PTM.				;AN000;
 23300                                  	; 18/12/2022
 23301 000038FF E90DE0                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 23302                                  ;localcommit_retn:
 23303                                  ;	retn

 23305                                  ;Break	<SetSFTTimes - signal a change in the times for an SFT>
 23306                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23307                                  ;
 23308                                  ; Procedure Name : SetSFTTimes
 23309                                  ;
 23310                                  ;   SetSFTTimes - Examine the flags for a SFT and set the time appropriately.
 23311                                  ;   Reflect these times in other SFT's for the same file.
 23312                                  ;
 23313                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 23314                                  ;		BX = sf_flags set appropriately
 23315                                  ;   Outputs:	Set sft times to current time if File & dirty & !nodate
 23316                                  ;   Registers modified: All except ES:DI, BX, AX
 23317                                  ;
 23318                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23319                                  
 23320                                  	; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 23321                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM 
 23322                                  
 23323                                  SetSFTTimes:
 23324                                  
 23325                                  ; 04/02/2024
 23326                                  %if 0
 23327                                  ;	File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 23328                                  	
 23329                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 23330                                  	; 17/12/2022
 23331                                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 23332                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 23333                                  	;retnz				; clean or device => no timestamp
 23334                                  	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 23335                                  
 23336                                  ;	file and dirty. See if date is good
 23337                                  
 23338                                  	;test	bx,4000h
 23339                                  	; 17/12/2022
 23340                                  	;test	bh,40h
 23341                                  	test	bh,(sf_close_nodate>>8)
 23342                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_close_nodate
 23343                                  	;retnz				; nodate => no timestamp
 23344                                  	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 23345                                  %else
 23346                                  	; 04/02/2024
 23347                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23348                                  	;test	bx,40C0h
 23349 00003902 F7C3C040                	test	bx,sf_close_nodate+devid_file_clean+devid_device
 23350 00003906 75E2                    	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 23351                                  %endif
 23352                                  
 23353 00003908 50                      	push	ax
 23354 00003909 53                      	push	bx
 23355 0000390A E853D2                  	call	DATE16			; Date/Time to AX/DX
 23356                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax
 23357 0000390D 2689450F                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_date],AX
 23358                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Dh],dx
 23359 00003911 2689550D                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_time],DX
 23360 00003915 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 23361                                  ;if installed
 23362                                  	;call	JShare + 14 * 4
 23363 00003917 FF1E[C800]              	call	far [JShare+(14*4)]	; 14 = ShSU
 23364                                  ;else
 23365                                  ;	call	ShSU
 23366                                  ;endif
 23367 0000391B 5B                      	pop	bx
 23368 0000391C 58                      	pop	ax

 23393                                  ;BREAK <DOS_MkDir - Make a directory entry>
 23394                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23395                                  ;
 23396                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_MkDir
 23397                                  ;
 23398                                  ; Inputs:
 23399                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23400                                  ;		terminated)
 23401                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23402                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23403                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23404                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23405                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 23406                                  ; Function:
 23407                                  ;	Make a new directory
 23408                                  ; Returns:
 23409                                  ;	Carry Clear
 23410                                  ;		No error
 23411                                  ;	Carry Set
 23412                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23413                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23414                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 23415                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 23416                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 23417                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23418                                  ;			Already exists, device name
 23419                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23420                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23421                                  
 23422                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 23423                                  
 23424                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23425                                  ; DOSCODE:6FC6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23426

 23444                                  			; CF clear if successful

 23676                                  ;BREAK <DOS_ChDir -- Verify a directory>
 23677                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23678                                  ;
 23679                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ChDir
 23680                                  ;
 23681                                  ; Inputs:
 23682                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23683                                  ;		terminated)
 23684                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23685                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23686                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23687                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used May not be NUL
 23688                                  ; Function:
 23689                                  ;	Validate the path for potential new current directory
 23690                                  ; Returns:
 23691                                  ;	NOTE:
 23692                                  ;	    [SATTRIB] is modified by this call
 23693                                  ;	Carry Clear
 23694                                  ;	    CX is cluster number of the DIR, LOCAL CDS ONLY
 23695                                  ;		Caller must NOT set ID fields on a NET CDS.
 23696                                  ;	Carry Set
 23697                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23698                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23699                                  ;			Bad path
 23700                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23701                                  ;			device or file name
 23702                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23703                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23704                                  
 23705                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm and dir2.asm. DS already set up.
 23706                                  
 23707                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23708                                  ; DOSCODE:70DAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23709                                  
 23710                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23711                                  ; DOSCODE:70C6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23712                                  
 23713                                  ; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23714                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7A23h
 23715                                  
 23716                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7839h)
 23717                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:70DAh)
 23718                                  
 23719                                  DOS_CHDIR:

 23721 00003A36 7306                    	JNC	short LOCAL_CHDIR

 23728 00003A3B CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CHDIR
 23729                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 23730                                  			; SDA first filename pointer -> fully-qualified directory name
 23731                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory
 23732                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 23733                                  			; CF clear if successful
 23734 00003A3D C3                      	retn
 23735                                  ;ENDIF

 23788                                  ;BREAK <DOS_RmDir -- Remove a directory>
 23789                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23790                                  ;
 23791                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_RmDir
 23792                                  ;
 23793                                  ; Inputs:
 23794                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23795                                  ;		terminated)
 23796                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23797                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23798                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23799                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23800                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 23801                                  ; Function:
 23802                                  ;	Remove a directory
 23803                                  ;	NOTE: Attempt to remove current directory must be detected by caller
 23804                                  ; Returns:
 23805                                  ;	NOTE:
 23806                                  ;	    [SATTRIB] is modified by this call
 23807                                  ;	Carry Clear
 23808                                  ;		No error
 23809                                  ;	Carry Set
 23810                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23811                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23812                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 23813                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 23814                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 23815                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23816                                  ;			device or file name, root directory
 23817                                  ;			Bad directory ('.' '..' messed up)
 23818                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23819                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23820                                  
 23821                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 23822                                  
 23823                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23824                                  ; DOSCODE:711Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23825                                  
 23826                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23827                                  ; DOSCODE:710Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23828

 24044                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 24045                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 24046                                  
 24047                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 24048                                  ;
 24049                                  ;	SWAPCON
 24050                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 24051                                  ;	DOS_READ
 24052                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 24053                                  ;	get_io_sft

 24055                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24056                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 24057                                  ;	FATSecRd
 24058                                  ;	DREAD
 24059                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 24060                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK
 24061                                  ;
 24062                                  ;	Revision history:
 24063                                  ;
 24064                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 24065                                  ;
 24066                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24067                                  ;
 24068                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 24069                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 24070                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 24071                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 24072                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 24073                                  ;
 24074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24075                                  ;
 24076                                  
 24077                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 24078                                  
 24079                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 24080                                  
 24081                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 24082                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24083                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 24084                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 24085                                  ;
 24086                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 24087                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 24088                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 24089                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24090                                  
 24091                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 3CF8h
 24092                                  
 24093                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24094                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24095                                  
 24096                                  ; DOSCODE:71CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24097                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 24099                                  SWAPBACK:
 24100 00003B5E C606[5703]00            	MOV	BYTE [CONSWAP],0	; signal no conswaps
 24101 00003B63 C3                      	retn
 24102                                  
 24103                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24104                                  ;
 24105                                  ; Procedure Name : SWAPCON
 24106                                  ;
 24107                                  ;   Copy ThisSFT to CONSFT for use by the 1-12 primitives.
 24108                                  ;
 24109                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT as the sft of the desired file
 24110                                  ;		DS is DOSDATA
 24111                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set.  CONSFT = ThisSFT.
 24112                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 24113                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24114                                  
 24115                                  SWAPCON:
 24116                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 24117                                  	;push	es
 24118                                  	;push	di
 24119                                  	;mov	byte [CONSWAP],1
 24120                                  	;les	di,[THISSFT]
 24121                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT],di
 24122                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT+2],es
 24123                                  	;pop	di
 24124                                  	;pop	es
 24125                                  	;retn
 24126                                  
 24127                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24128 00003B64 C606[5703]01            	mov	byte [CONSWAP],1	; ConSwap = TRUE
 24129 00003B69 50                      	push	ax
 24130 00003B6A A1[9E05]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT]
 24131 00003B6D A3[E605]                	mov	[CONSFT],ax
 24132 00003B70 A1[A005]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT+2]
 24133 00003B73 A3[E805]                	mov	[CONSFT+2],ax
 24134 00003B76 58                      	pop	ax
 24135 00003B77 C3                      	retn
 24136                                  
 24137                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24138                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24139                                  
 24140                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 24141                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24142                                  ;
 24143                                  ; Inputs:
 24144                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24145                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24146                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 24147                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 24148                                  ; Function:
 24149                                  ;	Perform read operation
 24150                                  ; Outputs:
 24151                                  ;    Carry clear
 24152                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24153                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 24154                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24155                                  ;    Carry set
 24156                                  ;	AX is error code
 24157                                  ;	CX = 0
 24158                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24159                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24160                                  ;
 24161                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24162                                  
 24163                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is be set up.
 24164                                  
 24165                                  ; DOSCODE:71E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24166                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24167                                  
 24168                                  ; 07/02/2024
 24169                                  ; 06/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24170                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7B76h
 24171                                  
 24172                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7997h)
 24173                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:71FDh)
 24174                                  
 24175                                  DOS_READ:
 24176 00003B78 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24177                                  
 24178                                  ; Verify that the sft has been opened in a mode that allows reading.
 24179                                  
 24180                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+2]
 24181 00003B7C 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 24182                                  	;;and	al,0Fh	; (MSDOS 5.0 & 6.22)
 24183                                  	;AND	AL,access_mask
 24184                                  	; 06/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24185                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 & Win Me)
 24186 00003B80 2403                    	and	al,3	; open_mode_mask ?
 24187                                  
 24188                                  	;cmp	al,1
 24189 00003B82 3C01                    	CMP	AL,open_for_write
 24190 00003B84 7503                    	JNE	short READ_NO_MODE	; Is read or both
 24191 00003B86 E96406                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 24192                                  
 24193                                  READ_NO_MODE:
 24194 00003B89 E82405                  	call	SETUP
 24195 00003B8C E30B                    	JCXZ	NoIORet 		; no bytes to read - fast return
 24196 00003B8E E8B1DC                  	call	IsSFTNet
 24197 00003B91 7408                    	JZ	short LOCAL_READ
 24198                                  
 24199                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 24200                                  ;	transfer NET_READ
 24201                                  ;ELSE
 24202                                  	;mov	ax,1108h
 24203 00003B93 B80811                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|8
 24204 00003B96 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - READ FROM REMOTE FILE
 24205                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 24206                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 24207                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 24208                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes read
 24209 00003B98 C3                      	retn
 24210                                  ;ENDIF
 24211                                  
 24212                                  ; The user ended up requesting 0 bytes of input. We do nothing for this case
 24213                                  ; except return immediately.
 24214                                  
 24215                                  NoIORet:
 24216 00003B99 F8                      	CLC
 24217 00003B9A C3                      	retn
 24218                                  
 24219                                  LOCAL_READ:
 24220                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],80h
 24221                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device  ; Check for named device I/O
 24222 00003B9B 26F6450580              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device ; 02/06/2019
 24223 00003BA0 750E                    	JNZ	short READDEV
 24224                                  
 24225                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 24226 00003BA2 C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 24227 00003BA7 E838DD                  	call	ECritDisk
 24228 00003BAA E8F705                  	call	DISKREAD
 24229                                  
 24230                                  critexit:
 24231                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 24232                                  	;retn
 24233                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24234 00003BAD E95FDD                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 24235                                  
 24236                                  ; We are reading from a device. Examine the status of the device to see if we
 24237                                  ; can short-circuit the I/O. If the device in the EOF state or if it is the
 24238                                  ; null device, we can safely indicate no transfer.
 24239                                  
 24240                                  READDEV:
 24241                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],4
 24242 00003BB0 C606[2303]04            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev
 24243                                  	;mov	bl,[es:di+5]
 24244 00003BB5 268A5D05                	MOV	BL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 24245 00003BB9 C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 24246                                  	;test	bl,40h
 24247 00003BBD F6C340                  	test	BL,devid_device_EOF	; End of file?
 24248 00003BC0 7407                    	JZ	short ENDRDDEVJ3
 24249                                  	;test	bl,4
 24250 00003BC2 F6C304                  	test	BL,devid_device_null	; NUL device?
 24251 00003BC5 7405                    	JZ	short TESTRAW 		; NO
 24252 00003BC7 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; Indicate EOF by setting zero
 24253                                  ENDRDDEVJ3:
 24254                                  	; 17/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility!)
 24255                                  	;JMP	short ENDRDDEVJ2
 24256                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24257 00003BC9 E93F01                  	jmp	ENDRDDEV ; 04/05/2019
 24258                                  
 24259                                  ; We need to hit the device. Figure out if we do a raw read or we do the
 24260                                  ; bizarre std_con_string_input.
 24261                                  
 24262                                  TESTRAW:
 24263                                  	;test	bl,20h
 24264 00003BCC F6C320                  	test	BL,devid_device_raw	; Raw mode?

 24364                                  ; We are going to do a cooked read on some character device. There is a
 24365                                  ; problem here, what does the data look like? Is it a terminal device, line

 24367                                  ; a ^Z at the end which is data, or is the ^Z not data?  In any event we're
 24368                                  ; going to do this: Read in pieces up to CR (CRs included in data) or ^z (^z
 24369                                  ; included in data). this "simulates" the way con works in cooked mode

 24703                                  ; 24/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24704                                  
 24705                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 24706                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24707                                  ;
 24708                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 24709                                  ;
 24710                                  ; Inputs:
 24711                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24712                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24713                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 24714                                  ; Function:
 24715                                  ;	Perform write operation
 24716                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 24717                                  ;		to current sf_position
 24718                                  ; Outputs:
 24719                                  ;    Carry clear
 24720                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24721                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 24722                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24723                                  ;    Carry set
 24724                                  ;	AX is error code
 24725                                  ;	CX = 0
 24726                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24727                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24728                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24729                                  
 24730                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio2.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is set up at this 
 24731                                  ;hkn; point to DOSDATA.
 24732                                  
 24733                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24734                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24735                                  
 24736                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24737                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24738                                  
 24739                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24740                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7D8Fh
 24741                                  
 24742                                  DOS_WRITE:

 24759                                  ;	We ALLOW writes to Read Only files via handles to allow a CREATE
 24760                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 24761                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 24762                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 24763                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 24764                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 24765                                  ;	    to a read-only file.

 25037                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25038                                  ;
 25039                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 25040                                  ;
 25041                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 25042                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 25043                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 25044                                  ;
 25045                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25046                                  
 25047                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25048                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 25049                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25050                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 25051                                  
 25052                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 25053                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 25054 00003ECA 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 25055 00003ED0 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 25056                                  GetNormal:
 25057 00003ED2 16                      	push	ss
 25058 00003ED3 1F                      	pop	ds
 25059 00003ED4 06                      	PUSH	ES
 25060 00003ED5 57                      	PUSH	DI
 25061 00003ED6 E80238                  	call	SFFromHandle
 25062 00003ED9 7206                    	JC	short RET44P
 25063 00003EDB 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 25064 00003EDD 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 25065 00003EDF 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 25066                                  RET44P:
 25067 00003EE1 5F                      	POP	DI
 25068 00003EE2 07                      	POP	ES
 25069 00003EE3 C3                      	retn
 25070                                  GetRedir:
 25071 00003EE4 83FB01                  	CMP	BX,1
 25072 00003EE7 77E9                    	JA	short GetNormal
 25073 00003EE9 36C536[E605]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CONSFT]
 25074 00003EEE F8                      	CLC
 25075                                  get_io_sft_retn:
 25076 00003EEF C3                      	retn
 25077                                  
 25078                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 25079                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25080                                  ;
 25081                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 25082                                  ;
 25083                                  ; Inputs:
 25084                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 25085                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25086                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 25087                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 25088                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 25089                                  ; Function:
 25090                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 25091                                  ; Outputs:
 25092                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 25093                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 25094                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 25095                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 25096                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 25097                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 25098                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25099                                  
 25100                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 25101                                  
 25102                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 25103                                  
 25104                                  DIRREAD:
 25105                                  
 25106                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 25107                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 25108                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 25109                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 25110                                  
 25111 00003EF0 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 25112                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 25113 00003EF2 3916[DC0A]              	cmp	[DIRSTART_HW],dx
 25114 00003EF6 7509                    	jnz	short SubDir
 25115                                  	;CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 25116                                  	; 21/09/2023
 25117 00003EF8 3916[C205]              	cmp	[DIRSTART],dx ; 0
 25118 00003EFC 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 25119 00003EFE 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 25120 00003EFF EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 25121                                  
 25122                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 25123                                  
 25124                                  SubDir:
 25125 00003F01 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 25126                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 25127 00003F03 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 25128                                  
 25129                                  ;	(DX) = sector-in-cluster
 25130                                  
 25131                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 25132 00003F07 268A4E05                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 25133 00003F0B D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 25134                                  
 25135                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 25136                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 25137                                  
 25138                                  DoRead:
 25139 00003F0D 8816[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],DL
 25140 00003F11 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 25141 00003F13 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 25142                                  
 25143                                  ;	(CX) = number of clusters to skip.
 25144                                  ;	(AH) = remainder
 25145                                  
 25146                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25147                                  
 25148                                  ; 08/02/2024
 25149                                  %if 0
 25150                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25151                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC+2]	     	  ;>32mb
 25152                                  	;MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	  ;>32mb
 25153                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC]
 25154                                  	;ADD	DL,AH
 25155                                  	;ADC	DH,0
 25156                                  	;ADC	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	  ;>32mb
 25157                                  	; 21/09/2023
 25158                                  	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 25159                                  	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 25160                                  	add	dl,ah
 25161                                  	adc	dh,bl ; 0
 25162                                  	adc	bx,[DIRSEC+2]
 25163                                  	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],bx
 25164                                  
 25165                                  	MOV	BX,[CLUSNUM]
 25166                                  	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 25167                                  	JCXZ	FIRSTCLUSTER
 25168                                  %else
 25169                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 25170 00003F15 8B1E[DE0A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSNUM_HW]
 25171 00003F19 891E[E00A]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM_HW],bx
 25172 00003F1D 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 25173 00003F21 8B16[C005]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC+2]
 25174 00003F25 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx
 25175 00003F29 8B16[BE05]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 25176 00003F2D 00E2                    	add	dl,ah
 25177 00003F2F 80D600                  	adc	dh,0
 25178 00003F32 8316[0706]00            	adc	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0
 25179 00003F37 8B1E[BC05]              	mov	bx,[CLUSNUM]
 25180 00003F3B 891E[DC05]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM],bx
 25181 00003F3F E339                    	jcxz	FIRSTCLUSTER
 25182                                  %endif
 25183                                  
 25184                                  SKPCLLP:
 25185 00003F41 E8A723                  	call	UNPACK
 25186 00003F44 72A9                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 25187                                  	;;;
 25188                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 25189 00003F46 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 25190 00003F4A 8F06[F20A]              	pop	word [CLUSTERS_HW]
 25191 00003F4E FF36[EC0A]              	push	word [CCONTENT_HW]

 25193                                  	;;;

 25196 00003F5B 7302                    	JAE	short HAVESKIPPED
 25197 00003F5D E2E2                    	LOOP	SKPCLLP
 25198                                  HAVESKIPPED:

 25200                                  	;;;
 25201                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 25202 00003F63 8B1E[E80A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 25203 00003F67 891E[E00A]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM_HW],bx
 25204                                  	;
 25205 00003F6B 8B1E[F20A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTERS_HW]
 25206 00003F6F 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx

 25252                                  ; Function:

 25255                                  ;	Same as DREAD

 25343                                  ;Break	<DREAD -- DO A DISK READ>
 25344                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25345                                  ;
 25346                                  ; Procedure Name : DREAD
 25347                                  ;
 25348                                  ; Inputs:
 25349                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25350                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25351                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	      (LOW)
 25352                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25353                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25354                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case call to HARDERR needed
 25355                                  ; Function:
 25356                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk read. If BIOS reports
 25357                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25358                                  ; Outputs:
 25359                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILED to INT 24)
 25360                                  ; DS,ES:BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25361                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 25366 00003FF2 7497                    	jz	short dirread_retn	; Carry clear
 25367                                  ;hkn; SS override

 25369 00003FFA E89A00                  	call	HARDERRRW

 25371 00003FFF 74EE                    	JZ	short DREAD
 25372

 25396                                  ;
 25397                                  ; Inputs:
 25398                                  ;	output of SETUP
 25399                                  ;	ES:DI -> SFT
 25400                                  ; Function:
 25401                                  ;	check write lock
 25402                                  ; Outputs:

 25404                                  ;	Carry clear if ok

 25412                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25413                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],8
 25414 0000400F 26F6450408              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],attr_volume_id ;volume id
 25415                                  	;JZ	short write_cont			     ;no
 25416                                  	;;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25417                                  	;;retn
 25418                                  	;;jnz	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25419                                  	; 19/08/2018
 25420                                  	;jz	short write_cont
 25421                                  	;jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25422                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 25423 00004014 7403                    	JZ	short write_cont
 25424                                  	;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25425                                  	;retn
 25426                                  	; 16/12/2022
 25427 00004016 E9D201                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25428                                  
 25429                                  write_cont:				;
 25430 00004019 51                      	PUSH	CX			;save reg
 25431 0000401A 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;
 25432 0000401C 7501                    	JNZ	short Not_Truncate	;
 25433 0000401E 49                      	dec	cx			;(cx) = -1; check for lock on whole file
 25434                                  Not_Truncate:				;
 25435 0000401F B080                    	MOV	AL,80H			;check write access
 25436 00004021 E8C843                  	call	LOCK_CHECK		;check lock
 25437 00004024 59                      	POP	CX			;restore reg
 25438 00004025 7305                    	JNC	short WRITE_OK		;lock ok
 25439 00004027 E87301                  	call	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION	;issue I24
 25440 0000402A 73ED                    	JNC	short write_cont	;retry
 25441                                  WRITE_OK:				;
 25442 0000402C C3                      	retn				;
