 32110                                  
 32111                                  make_share:
 32112                                  	;XOR	AH,AH
 32113                                  	; 23/02/2024
 32114 000054D1 98                      	cbw
 32115 000054D2 50                      	PUSH	AX		; Save Disk or Device node
 32116 000054D3 51                      	PUSH	CX		; Save Device ID
 32117 000054D4 88EC                    	MOV	AH,CH		; Device ID to AH
 32118 000054D6 E83201                  	CALL	DOOPEN		; Fill in SFT for share check
 32119 000054D9 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 32120 000054DD 56                      	push	si
 32121 000054DE 53                      	push	bx		; Save CURBUF pointers
 32122 000054DF E8B62F                  	call	ShareEnter
 32123 000054E2 734E                    	jnc	short MakeEndShare
 32124                                  
 32125                                  ; User failed request.
 32126 000054E4 5B                      	pop	bx
 32127 000054E5 5E                      	pop	si
 32128 000054E6 59                      	pop	cx
 32129 000054E7 58                      	pop	ax
 32130                                  
 32131                                  Make_Share_ret:
 32132 000054E8 B006                    	MOV	AL,6
 32133 000054EA EB98                    	JMP	short make_err_ret
 32134                                  
 32135                                  make_err_ret_5P:
 32136 000054EC 59                      	POP	CX		; Get back device ID
 32137                                  make_err_ret_5:
 32138 000054ED B005                    	MOV     AL,5		; Attribute mismatch
 32139                                          ; 22/11/2022
 32140 000054EF EB93                    	JMP	short make_err_ret
 32141                                  
 32142                                  make_exists_dir:
 32143 000054F1 B001                    	MOV	AL,1		; exists as directory, always an error
 32144                                  	; 22/11/2022
 32145 000054F3 EB8F                    	JMP	short make_err_ret
 32146                                  
 32147                                  make_save:
 32148 000054F5 50                      	PUSH	AX		; Save whether Disk or File
 32149 000054F6 89C8                    	MOV	AX,CX		; Device ID to AH
 32150 000054F8 E86800                  	CALL	NEWENTRY
 32151 000054FB 58                      	POP	AX		; 0 if Disk, 3 if File
 32152 000054FC 73A0                    	jnc	short make_retn
 32153 000054FE B002                    	MOV	AL,2		; create failed case 2
 32154                                  make_save_retn:
 32155 00005500 C3                      	retn
 32156                                  
 32157                                  make_new:
 32158 00005501 E8F1FF                  	call	make_save
 32159 00005504 72FA                    	jc	short make_save_retn	; case 2 fail
 32160                                  	;test	byte [ATTRIB],10h
 32161 00005506 F606[6B05]10            	test	BYTE [ATTRIB],attr_directory
 32162 0000550B 75F3                    	jnz	short make_save_retn	; Don't "open" directories,
 32163                                  					; so don't tell the sharer about them
 32164 0000550D 50                      	push	ax
 32165 0000550E 53                      	push	bx
 32166 0000550F 56                      	push	si
 32167 00005510 E8852F                  	call	ShareEnter
 32168 00005513 5E                      	pop	si
 32169 00005514 5B                      	pop	bx
 32170 00005515 58                      	pop	ax
 32171 00005516 73E8                    	jnc	short make_save_retn
 32172                                  
 32173                                  ; We get here by having the user FAIL a share problem. Typically a failure of
 32174                                  ; this nature is an out-of-space or an internal error. We clean up as best as
 32175                                  ; possible: delete the newly created directory entry and return share_error.
 32176                                  
 32177 00005518 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32178 00005519 C43E[E205]              	LES	DI,[CURBUF]
 32179                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx],0E5h
 32180 0000551D 26C607E5                	MOV	BYTE [ES:BX],DIRFREE	; nuke newly created entry.
 32181                                  
 32182                                  ; 23/02/2024
 32183                                  %if 0	
 32184                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32185                                  	;test	byte [es:di+5],40h
 32186                                  	TEST	byte [ES:DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 32187                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 32188                                  	JNZ	short yesdirty8		;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 32189                                  	; 22/11/2022
 32190                                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 32191                                  	;or	byte [es:di+5],40h
 32192                                  	OR	byte [ES:DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ; flag buffer as dirty
 32193                                  yesdirty8:
 32194                                  %else
 32195                                  	; 23/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32196 00005521 E8A216                  	call    SET_BUF_DIRTY
 32197                                  %endif
 32198 00005524 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 32199                                  	; 15/12/2022
 32200 00005528 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 32201                                  	; 22/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32202                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 32203                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive for flush
 32204 0000552C E87115                  	call	FLUSHBUF		; write out buffer.
 32205 0000552F 58                      	POP	AX
 32206 00005530 EBB6                    	jmp	short Make_Share_ret
 32207                                  
 32208                                  ; We have found an existing file. We have also entered it into the share set.
 32209                                  ; At this point we need to call newentry to correctly address the problem of
 32210                                  ; getting rid of old data (create an existing file) or creating a new
 32211                                  ; directory entry (create a new file). Unfortunately, this operation may
 32212                                  ; result in an INT 24 that the user doesn't return from, thus locking the file
 32213                                  ; irretrievably into the share set. The correct solution is for us to LEAVE
 32214                                  ; the share set now, do the operation and then reassert the share access.
 32215                                  ;
 32216                                  ; We are allowed to do this! There is no window! After all, we are in
 32217                                  ; critDisk here and for someone else to get in, they must enter critDisk also.
 32218                                  
 32219                                  	; 22/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32220                                  	; DOSCODE:89C8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32221                                  
 32222                                  MakeEndShare:
 32223 00005532 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]		; grab SFT
 32224 00005536 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 32225 00005538 E8A7C3                  	call	ECritSFT
 32226 0000553B 268705                  	xchg	AX,[ES:DI]
 32227                                  	;XCHG	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 32228 0000553E 50                      	push	ax
 32229 0000553F 57                      	push	di
 32230 00005540 06                      	push	es
 32231 00005541 9C                      	PUSHF
 32232 00005542 E84E2F                  	call	ShareEnd		; remove sharing
 32233 00005545 9D                      	POPF
 32234 00005546 07                      	pop	es
 32235 00005547 5F                      	pop	di
 32236 00005548 268F05                  	pop	word [ES:DI]
 32237                                  	;pop	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 32238 0000554B E8C1C3                  	call	LCritSFT
 32239                                  	; 22/11/2022
 32240                                  	; DOSCODE:89E4h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32241 0000554E 5B                      	pop	bx
 32242 0000554F 5E                      	pop	si
 32243 00005550 59                      	pop	cx
 32244 00005551 58                      	pop	ax
 32245 00005552 E8A0FF                  	CALL	make_save
 32246                                  
 32247                                  ; If the user failed, we do not reenter into the sharing set.
 32248                                  
 32249 00005555 72A9                    	jc	short make_save_retn	; bye if error
 32250 00005557 50                      	push	ax
 32251 00005558 53                      	push	bx
 32252 00005559 56                      	push	si
 32253 0000555A 9C                      	PUSHF
 32254 0000555B E83A2F                  	call	ShareEnter
 32255 0000555E 9D                      	POPF
 32256 0000555F 5E                      	pop	si
 32257 00005560 5B                      	pop	bx
 32258 00005561 58                      	pop	ax
 32259                                  
 32260                                  ; If Share_check fails, then we have an internal ERROR!!!!!
 32261                                  
 32262                                  makeendshare_retn:
 32263 00005562 C3                      	retn
 32264                                  
 32265                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32266                                  ;
 32267                                  ; Procedure Name : NEWENTRY
 32268                                  ;
 32269                                  ; Inputs:
 32270                                  ;	  [THISSFT] set
 32271                                  ;	  [THISDPB] set
 32272                                  ;	  [LASTENT] current last valid entry number in directory if no free
 32273                                  ;		  entries
 32274                                  ;	  [VOLID] set if a volume ID was found during search
 32275                                  ;	Attrib Contains attributes for new file
 32276                                  ;	  [DIRSTART] Points to first cluster of dir (0 means root)
 32277                                  ;	  CARRY FLAG INDICATES STATUS OF SEARCH FOR FILE
 32278                                  ;		  NC means file existed (device)
 32279                                  ;		  C  means file did not exist
 32280                                  ;	  AH = Device ID byte
 32281                                  ;	  If FILE
 32282                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:BX points to start of directory entry
 32283                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:SI points to dir_first of directory entry
 32284                                  ;	  If device
 32285                                  ;	  DS:BX points to start of "fake" directory entry
 32286                                  ;	  DS:SI points to dir_first of "fake" directory entry
 32287                                  ;		  (has DWORD pointer to device header)
 32288                                  ; Function:
 32289                                  ;	  Make a new directory entry
 32290                                  ;	  If an old one existed it is truncated first
 32291                                  ; Outputs:
 32292                                  ;	  Carry set if error
 32293                                  ;		  Can't grow dir, atts didn't match, attempt to make 2nd
 32294                                  ;		  vol ID, user FAILed to I 24
 32295                                  ;	  else
 32296                                  ;		  outputs of DOOPEN
 32297                                  ; DS, BX, SI preserved (meaning on SI BX, not value), others destroyed
 32298                                  ;
 32299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32300                                  
 32301                                  	; 22/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32302                                  	; DOSCODE:89F9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32303                                  
 32304                                  	; 23/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32305                                  	; DOSCODE:961Ah (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 32306                                  
 32307                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8A34h)
 32308                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8B7Dh)
 32309

 32333

 32343                                  NOTVOLID:

 32358

 32451                                  
 32452                                  ; DOOPEN
 32453                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32454                                  ;
 32455                                  ; Inputs:
 32456                                  ;	  [THISDPB] points to DPB if file
 32457                                  ;	  [THISSFT] points to SFT being used
 32458                                  ;	  AH = Device ID byte
 32459                                  ;	  If FILE
 32460                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:BX points to start of directory entry
 32461                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:SI points to dir_first of directory entry
 32462                                  ;	  If device
 32463                                  ;	  DS:BX points to start of "fake" directory entry
 32464                                  ;	  DS:SI points to dir_first of "fake" directory entry
 32465                                  ;		  (has DWORD pointer to device header)
 32466                                  ; Function:
 32467                                  ;	  Fill in SFT from dir entry
 32468                                  ; Outputs:
 32469                                  ;	  CARRY CLEAR
 32470                                  ;	  sf_ref_count and sf_mode fields not altered
 32471                                  ;	  sf_flags high byte = 0
 32472                                  ;	  sf_flags low byte = AH except
 32473                                  ;	  sf_flags Bit 6 set (not dirty or not EOF)
 32474                                  ;	  sf_attr sf_date sf_time sf_name set from entry
 32475                                  ;	  sf_position = 0
 32476                                  ;	  If device
 32477                                  ;	  sf_devptr = dword at dir_first (pointer to device header)
 32478                                  ;	  sf_size = 0
 32479                                  ;	  If file
 32480                                  ;	  sf_firclus sf_size set from entry
 32481                                  ;	  sf_devptr = [THISDPB]
 32482                                  ;	  sf_cluspos = 0
 32483                                  ;	  sf_lstclus = sf_firclus
 32484                                  ;	  sf_dirsec sf_dirpos set
 32485                                  ; DS,SI,BX preserved, others destroyed
 32486                                  ;
 32487                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32488                                  
 32489                                  	; 23/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 32751                                  ; Procedure Name : FREEENT
 32752                                  ;
 32753                                  ; Inputs:

 32755                                  ;	  [CURBUF] Set
 32756                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:BX points to directory entry
 32757                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:SI points to above dir_first
 32758                                  ; Function:

 32764                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32766                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 32860                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32861                                  ;
 32862                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 32863                                  ;
 32864                                  ; CHECK_VIRT_OPEN checks to see if we had performed a "virtual open" (by
 32865                                  ; examining the flag [VIRTUAL_OPEN] to see if it is 1). If we did, then
 32866                                  ; it calls Dev_Close_SFT to decrement the ref. count. It also resets the
 32867                                  ; flag [VIRTUAL_OPEN].
 32868                                  ; No registers affected (including flags).
 32869                                  ; On input, [THISSFT] points to current SFT.
 32870                                  ;
 32871                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32872                                  
 32873                                  CHECK_VIRT_OPEN:
 32874                                  	PUSH	AX
 32875                                  	lahf			; preserve flags
 32876                                  	CMP	byte [VIRTUAL_OPEN],0
 32877                                  	JZ	short ALL_CLOSED
 32878                                  	mov	byte [VIRTUAL_OPEN],0 ; reset flag
 32879                                  	push	es
 32880                                  	push	di
 32881                                  	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 32882                                  	call	DEV_CLOSE_SFT
 32883                                  	pop	di
 32884                                  	pop	es
 32885                                  
 32886                                  ALL_CLOSED:
 32887                                  	sahf			; restore flags
 32888                                  	POP	AX
 32889                                  	retn
 32890                                  
 32891                                  %endif

 33145                                  ;Break  <BUFSEC -- BUFFER A SECTOR AND SET UP A TRANSFER>
 33146                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33147                                  ;
 33148                                  ; Procedure Name : BUFSEC
 33149                                  ;
 33150                                  ; Inputs:
 33151                                  ;       AH = priority of buffer
 33152                                  ;       AL = 0 if buffer must be read, 1 if no pre-read needed
 33153                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33154                                  ;       [CLUSNUM] = Physical cluster number
 33155                                  ;       [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector position of transfer within cluster
 33156                                  ;       [BYTCNT1] = Size of transfer
 33157                                  ; Function:
 33158                                  ;       Insure specified sector is in buffer, flushing buffer before
 33159                                  ;       read if necessary.
 33160                                  ; Outputs:
 33161                                  ;       ES:DI = Pointer to buffer
 33162                                  ;       SI = Pointer to transfer address
 33163                                  ;       CX = Number of bytes
 33164                                  ;       [NEXTADD] updated
 33165                                  ;       [TRANS] set to indicate a transfer will occur
 33166                                  ;       Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 33167                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33168                                  
 33169                                  	; 25/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33170                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:98C2h
 33171                                  
 33172                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8BF1h) - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 33173                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8C2Ch) - Retro DOS v4.2
 33174                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0BE33h)
 33175                                  
 33176                                  BUFSEC:
 33177                                  	; 25/02/2024
 33178                                  	;;;
 33179                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33180 000057EC 8B16[DE0A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSNUM_HW]
 33181                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx
 33182 000057F0 8716[E80A]              	xchg	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33183 000057F4 52                      	push	dx	; [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33184                                  	;;;
 33185 000057F5 8B16[BC05]                      MOV     DX,[CLUSNUM]
 33186 000057F9 8A1E[7305]                      MOV     BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 33187                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],38h
 33188 000057FD C606[4B03]38                    MOV     byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_IGNORE
 33189 00005802 E89A01                          CALL    FIGREC
 33190 00005805 E83311                  	call	GETBUFFR
 33191                                  	; 25/02/2024
 33192                                  	;;;
 33193 00005808 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33194                                  	;;;
 33195 0000580C 72DD                            jc	short fndclus_retn
 33196                                  
 33197 0000580E C606[7405]01                    MOV     BYTE [TRANS],1	; A transfer is taking place
 33198 00005813 8B36[B805]                      MOV     SI,[NEXTADD]
 33199 00005817 89F7                            MOV     DI,SI
 33200 00005819 8B0E[D205]                      MOV     CX,[BYTCNT1]
 33201 0000581D 01CF                            ADD     DI,CX
 33202 0000581F 893E[B805]                      MOV     [NEXTADD],DI
 33203 00005823 C43E[E205]                      LES     DI,[CURBUF]
 33204                                  	;or	byte [es:di+5],8
 33205 00005827 26804D0508                      OR      byte [ES:DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_isDATA
 33206                                  	;;;lea	di,[di+16] ; MSDOS 3.3 
 33207                                  	;;lea	di,[di+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 33208                                          ;lea	di,[di+24] ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 25/02/2024
 33209 0000582C 8D7D18                  	LEA     DI,[DI+BUFINSIZ]        ; Point to buffer
 33210 0000582F 033E[CC05]                      ADD     DI,[BYTSECPOS]
 33211 00005833 F8                              CLC	; (not necessary!?) ; 25/02/2024
 33212 00005834 C3                              retn
 33213

 33218                                  ; Procedure Name : BUFRD
 33219                                  ;
 33220                                  ; Do a partial sector read via one of the system buffers
 33221                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 33222                                  ; Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33223                                  ;

 33225                                  ;

 33227

 33255                                  ;       DS:SI-> Source within Buffer.

 33267                                  	;rep	movsb

 33285                                                                          ;  even though it is MRU.

 33288                                  ;M039					; chucking even though it is MRU.

 33294 0000586C 1F                      	pop	ds

 33490                                  ;Break	<OPTIMIZE -- DO A USER DISK REQUEST WELL>

 33493                                  ; Procedure Name : OPTIMIZE
 33494                                  ;
 33495                                  ; Inputs:

 33497                                  ;	  CX = No. of records

 33499                                  ;	  ES:BP = Base of drive parameters

 33501                                  ; Outputs:

 33647                                  ;Break	<FIGREC -- Figure sector in allocation unit>
 33648                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 33650                                  ; Procedure Name : FIGREC
 33651                                  ;
 33652                                  ; Inputs:

 33654                                  ;	  BL = Sector position within cluster
 33655                                  ;	  ES:BP = Base of drive parameters

 33658                                  ;	  [HIGH_SECTOR] Physical sector address (HIGH)

 33661                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33662                                  
 33663                                  	; 10/06/2019
 33664                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33665                                  	; DOSCODE:8D96h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33666                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33667                                  	; DOSCODE:8D5Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 33668                                  
 33669                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 33697                                  ;hkn; SS override HIGH_SECTOR
 33698                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33699                                  	MOV	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0		;F.C. >32mb
 33700                                  	; 24/09/2023
 33701                                  	xor	ch,ch				;F.C. >32mb
 33702                                  	OR	CL,CL				;F.C. >32mb
 33703                                  	JZ	short noshift			;F.C. >32mb
 33704                                  	; 27/02/2024
 33705                                  	;XOR	CH,CH				;F.C. >32mb
 33706                                  rotleft:					;F.C. >32mb
 33707                                  	CLC					;F.C. >32mb
 33708                                  	RCL	DX,1				;F.C. >32mb
 33709                                  	; 10/06/2019
 33710                                  	RCL	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],1		;F.C. >32mb
 33711                                  	LOOP	rotleft				;F.C. >32mb
 33712                                  %else
 33713                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33714                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33715                                  rotleft:
 33716 000059B2 F8                      	clc
 33717 000059B3 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 33718 000059B5 D1D0                    	rcl	ax,1
 33719 000059B7 E2F9                    	loop	rotleft
 33720                                  %endif
 33721

 33723                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 33761                                  
 33762                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33763                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33764                                  
 33765                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33766                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset
 33767                                  
 33768                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 33769                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33770                                  ;
 33771                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 33772                                  ;
 33773                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 33774                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 33775                                  ;
 33776                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 33777                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 33778                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 33779                                  ;
 33780                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 33781                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 33782                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 33783                                  ;
 33784                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 33785                                  ;
 33786                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 33787                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 33788                                  ;           ELSE
 33789                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 33790                                  ;
 33791                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 33792                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 33793                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 33794                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 33795                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 33796                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 33797                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 33798                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 33799                                  ;   allocated.
 33800                                  ;
 33801                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 33802                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 33803                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 33804                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 33805                                  ;
 33806                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33807                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33808                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33809                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 33810                                  ;   explanation:
 33811                                  ;
 33812                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 33813                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 33814                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 33815                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 33816                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 33817                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 33818                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 33819                                  ;   the
 33820                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 33821                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 33822                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 33823                                  ;
 33824                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 33825                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 33826                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 33827                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 33828                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 33829                                  ;
 33830                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33831                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33832                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33833                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 33834                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 33835                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33836                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 33837                                  ;
 33838                                  ;       EXIT   'C' set if insufficient space
 33839                                  ;                [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 33840                                  ;                CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 33841                                  ;              'C' clear if space allocated
 33842                                  ;                BX = First cluster allocated
 33843                                  ;                FAT is fully updated
 33844                                  ;                sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 33845                                  ;
 33846                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 33847                                  
 33848                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 33849                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 33850                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 33851                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 33852                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 33853                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 33854                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 33855                                  ;callmagic  endp
 33856                                  
 33857                                  ; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33858                                  ;PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9AC5h
 33859                                  
 33860                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC2h)
 33861                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C078h)
 33862                                  
 33863                                  ; 25/09/2023
 33864                                  %if 1	; 27/02/2024
 33865                                  callmagic:
 33866 000059D7 1E                      	push	ds
 33867 000059D8 36FF36[0906]            	push	word [ss:OffsetMagicPatch]
 33868 000059DD CB                      	retf	
 33869                                  %endif
 33870                                  
 33871                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33872                                  %if 1
 33873                                  ALLOCATE_X:
 33874 000059DE A3[F00A]                	mov	[CCOUNT_HW],ax
 33875                                  	;jmp	short ALLOCATE
 33876                                  %endif
 33877                                  
 33878                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33879                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9ACFh
 33880                                  
 33881                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC9h)
 33882                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C07Fh)
 33883

 33885                                  	; 10/09/2018

 33887                                  ;

 33889                                  ;

 33891                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 33892                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 33893                                  ;data would not.
 33894                                  ;        
 33895                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 33896                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 33897                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 33898                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 33899                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 33900                                  
 33901                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33902                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 33903                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 33904                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 33905                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 33906                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 33907                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 33908                                  
 33909                                  ; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33910                                  ; DOSCODE:9ACFh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 33911                                  
 33912                                  ; 25/09/2023
 33913                                  %if 1	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33914 000059E1 F8                      	clc		; COUNT_HW:CX = Number of clusters to allocate
 33915 000059E2 0E                      	push	cs

 33924                                  
 33925                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33926                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 33927                                  
 33928                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33929                                  	; DOSCODE:9AD6h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 33930                                  
 33931 000059EB 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 33932 000059EC 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 33933                                  
 33934                                  	; 27/02/2024
 33935                                  	;;;
 33936 000059EE FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33937 000059F2 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; cluster 0
 33938                                  	;;;
 33939                                  
 33940 000059F6 E8F208                  	call	UNPACK
 33941 000059F9 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 33942                                  
 33943                                  	; 27/02/2024
 33944                                  	;;;		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = content of FAT (for cluster 0)
 33945 000059FD 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33946 00005A01 891E[E40A]              	mov	[FATBYT_HW],bx
 33947 00005A05 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33948                                  	;;;
 33949                                  
 33950 00005A09 5B                              POP     BX
 33951 00005A0A 72CA                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error [INTERR?]
 33952                                  
 33953                                  ; 27/02/2024
 33954                                  %if 0
 33955                                          PUSH    CX
 33956                                          PUSH    BX
 33957                                  
 33958                                          MOV     DX,BX
 33959                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 33960                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 33961                                          mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 33962                                          cmp     bx,2
 33963                                          ja	short FINDFRE
 33964                                  
 33965                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 33966                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 33967                                  
 33968                                  ads1:
 33969                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 33970                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 33971                                          mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 33972                                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 33973                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 33974                                  %else
 33975                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33976                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33977                                  	;;;
 33978 00005A0C FF36[F00A]              	push	word [CCOUNT_HW]
 33979 00005A10 51                      	push	cx
 33980 00005A11 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33981 00005A15 53                      	push	bx
 33982                                  
 33983 00005A16 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 33984                                  
 33985 00005A18 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 33986                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],bx ; 0
 33987 00005A1A 26395E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],bx ; 0
 33988 00005A1E 871E[E80A]              	xchg	bx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33989 00005A22 891E[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],bx
 33990                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]
 33991 00005A26 268B5E1D                	mov	bx,[es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 33992 00005A2A 7510                    	jnz	short ads1		; not FAT32
 33993                                  
 33994                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+3Bh]
 33995 00005A2C 268B5E3B                	mov	bx,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2]
 33996 00005A30 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33997                                  	;cmp	bx,0
 33998 00005A34 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 33999                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+39h]
 34000 00005A36 268B5E39                	mov	bx,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE]
 34001 00005A3A 7526                    	jnz	short FINDFRE
 34002                                  ads1:
 34003 00005A3C 83FB02                  	cmp	bx,2
 34004 00005A3F 7721                    	ja	short FINDFRE
 34005                                  ads2:
 34006 00005A41 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 34007                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],bx
 34008 00005A43 26395E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],bx ; 0
 34009 00005A47 750A                    	jnz	short ads3		; not FAT32
 34010                                  
 34011                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+39h],2
 34012 00005A49 26C746390200            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE],2
 34013                                  	;mov	[es:bp+3Bh],bx
 34014 00005A4F 26895E3B                	mov	[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2],bx ; 0
 34015                                  ads3:
 34016 00005A53 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 34017                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2	
 34018 00005A57 26C7461D0200            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 34019 00005A5D 43                      	inc	bx ; 1
 34020                                  	;or	[es:bp+18h],bl
 34021 00005A5E 26085E18                	or	[es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],bl ; 1	
 34022                                  	;;;
 34023                                  %endif
 34024                                  
 34025                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 34026                                  ;
 34027                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 34028                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 34029                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 34030                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 34031                                  
 34032                                  FINDFRE:
 34033                                  %if 0
 34034                                          INC     BX
 34035                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 34036                                          CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 34037                                  	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 34038                                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 34039                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 34040                                          jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 34041                                  
 34042                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 34043                                  ;
 34044                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 34045                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 34046                                  
 34047                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 34048                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 34049                                          mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 34050                                          xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 34051                                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 34052                                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 34053                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 34054                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 34055                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 34056                                  	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 34057                                          JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 34058                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 34059                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 34060                                          DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 34061                                  NO_ALLOC:
 34062                                          xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 34063                                          XCHG    BX,DX
 34064                                          MOV     AX,DX
 34065                                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 34066                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 34067                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 34068                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 34069                                          xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 34070                                          mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 34071                                          LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 34072                                  %else
 34073                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34074                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34075                                  	;;;
 34076                                  	;add	bx,1
 34077                                  	;adc	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 34078 00005A62 43                      	inc	bx
 34079 00005A63 7504                    	jnz	short FINDFRE2
 34080 00005A65 FF06[E80A]              	inc	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34081                                  FINDFRE2:
 34082                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 34083 00005A69 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 34084 00005A6E 7512                    	jnz	short ads4 ; not FAT32
 34085                                  	; FAT32

 34087 00005A71 8B1E[E80A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]

 34092                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+2Dh]

 34094 00005A80 EB04                    	jmp	short ads5
 34095                                  ads4:
 34096                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 34097 00005A82 263B5E0D                	cmp	bx,[es:bp+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 34098                                  ads5:
 34099 00005A86 7603                    	jbe	short ads6 ; jna short ads6
 34100 00005A88 E9ED00                  	jmp	ads15
 34101                                  ads6:
 34102                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34103                                  	;push	cx
 34104                                  	;push	word [CCOUNT_HW]
 34105                                  	;push	bx
 34106                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34107                                  	;push	dx
 34108                                  	;push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 34109

 34111

 34113                                  	;pop	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 34114                                  	;pop	dx

 34432                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT

 34480                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 34481                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34482                                  ;
 34483                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 34484                                  ;
 34485                                  ; Inputs:
 34486                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 34487                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 34488                                  ; Function:
 34489                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 34490                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34491                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 34492                                  ;
 34493                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34494                                  
 34495                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34496                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D13h
 34497                                  
 34498                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E86h)
 34499                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C27Fh)
 34500                                  
 34501                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34502                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34503                                  RELEASE:
 34504 00005BD8 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 34505                                  	
 34506                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34507                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34508                                  	;;;
 34509 00005BDA 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx ; (dx = 0, release)
 34510                                  	;;;
 34511                                  
 34512                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D19h
 34513                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E88h)
 34514                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C285h)
 34515                                  
 34516                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 34517                                  RELBLKS:
 34518                                  
 34519                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 34520                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 34521                                  
 34522 00005BDE E80A07                  	call	UNPACK
 34523                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 34524                                  	;jz	short RELEASE_flush
 34525                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34526 00005BE1 7652                            jbe	short RET12 ; jna short RET12
 34527                                  				; CCONTENT_HW:DI= Content of FAT
 34528                                   				; for given cluster (next cluster)
 34529 00005BE3 89F8                    	MOV     AX,DI
 34530 00005BE5 52                              PUSH    DX
 34531                                  
 34532                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34533                                  	;push	ax
 34534                                  	;;;
 34535                                  
 34536 00005BE6 E8B007                  	call	PACK
 34537                                  
 34538                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34539                                  	;pop	ax
 34540 00005BE9 8B16[EC0A]              	mov	dx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 34541 00005BED 8916[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx ; next cluster (hw) to be released
 34542 00005BF1 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax		 ; next cluster (lw) to be released
 34543                                  	;;;
 34544                                          
 34545 00005BF3 5A                      	POP     DX
 34546                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 34547                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34548 00005BF4 723F                    	jc	short RET12
 34549                                          
 34550 00005BF6 09D2                    	OR      DX,DX
 34551 00005BF8 751F                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 34552                                  
 34553                                  ; 28/02/2024
 34554                                  %if 0
 34555                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 34556                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 34557                                  	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 34558                                          JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 34559                                          INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 34560                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 34561                                          MOV     BX,AX
 34562                                          dec     ax              	; check for "1"
 34563                                  	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 34564                                  %else
 34565                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34566                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34567                                  	;;;
 34568 00005BFA 3B16[EA0A]              	cmp	dx,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; > 0 ? (delete, release)
 34569 00005BFE 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC	; no, EOF (allocate, -1), (dx = 0)
 34570                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 34571 00005C00 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 34572                                  					; Free count valid?
 34573 00005C05 7412                    	jz	short NO_DEALLOC	; No (dx = 0)
 34574                                  relblks_ifc:
 34575                                  	;inc	word ptr es:[bp+1Fh]
 34576 00005C07 26FF461F                	inc	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 34577 00005C0B 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2
 34578                                  
 34579                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 34580 00005C0D 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx
 34581 00005C11 7513                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2	; not FAT32
 34582                                  
 34583                                  	;inc	word [es:bp+21h]
 34584 00005C13 26FF4621                	inc	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 34585 00005C17 EB0D                    	jmp	short NO_DEALLOC2
 34586                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 34587                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 34588 00005C19 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx	; dx is -1 or 0
 34589                                  					; (valid 16 bit fat size is another number)
 34590 00005C1D 7507                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2 ; FAT (FAT16 or FAT12)
 34591                                  					; dx = 0, FAT32
 34592                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 34593 00005C1F 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2],0FFFFh
 34594 00005C24 75E1                    	jnz	short relblks_ifc
 34595                                  NO_DEALLOC2:
 34596 00005C26 833E[E80A]00            	cmp	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 34597 00005C2B 7503                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC3
 34598 00005C2D 48                      	dec	ax			; check for "1"	
 34599 00005C2E 7405                    	jz	short RET12		; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 34600                                  NO_DEALLOC3:
 34601                                  	;;;
 34602                                  %endif
 34603                                  
 34604 00005C30 E88F06                  	call	IsEOF
 34605 00005C33 72A3                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 34606                                  
 34607                                  	; 16/12/2022
 34608                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34609                                  ; 28/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34610                                  %if 0
 34611                                  RELEASE_flush:
 34612                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34613                                  	mov	al,[es:bp]
 34614                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 34615                                  	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 34616                                  	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 34617                                  	push	es
 34618                                  	push	bp
 34619                                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 34620                                  	pop	bp
 34621                                  	pop	es
 34622                                  	pop	cx
 34623                                  	pop	si
 34624                                  %endif		; 28/02/2024
 34625                                  
 34626                                  RET12:
 34627 00005C35 C3                      	retn
 34628                                  
 34629                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 34630                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34631                                  ;
 34632                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 34633                                  ;
 34634                                  ; Inputs:
 34635                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 34636                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 34637                                  ;       DS = CS
 34638                                  ; Outputs:
 34639                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 34640                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34641                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 34642                                  ;
 34643                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34644                                  
 34645                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34646                                  %if 0
 34647                                  GETEOF:
 34648                                  	call	UNPACK
 34649                                          jc	short RET12
 34650                                          PUSH    BX
 34651                                          MOV     BX,DI
 34652                                  	call	IsEOF
 34653                                          POP     BX
 34654                                          JAE     short RET12
 34655                                          MOV     BX,DI
 34656                                          JMP     short GETEOF
 34657                                  %else
 34658                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34659                                  	;;;
 34660                                  GETEOF4:	; **
 34661 00005C36 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34662                                  GETEOF1:
 34663 00005C3A 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 34664 00005C3C 8916[F20A]              	mov	[CLUSTERS_HW],dx ; CLUSTERS_HW:DI = Cluster Count
 34665 00005C40 58                      	pop	ax
 34666 00005C41 5A                      	pop	dx
 34667 00005C42 C3                      	retn
 34668                                  
 34669                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D7Ch
 34670                                  GETEOF:
 34671 00005C43 52                      	push	dx
 34672 00005C44 50                      	push	ax
 34673 00005C45 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0	; cluster count = 0
 34674 00005C47 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 34675                                  GETEOF2:
 34676 00005C49 E89F06                  	call	UNPACK
 34677 00005C4C 72EC                    	jc	short GETEOF1
 34678                                  		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = next cluster (cluster content)
 34679 00005C4E 40                      	inc	ax
 34680 00005C4F 7501                    	jnz	short GETEOF3
 34681 00005C51 42                      	inc	dx
 34682                                  GETEOF3:
 34683 00005C52 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34684 00005C56 53                      	push    bx
 34685                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34686 00005C57 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 34687 00005C5B 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 34688 00005C5F 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 34689 00005C61 E85E06                  	call	IsEOF
 34690                                  	;pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34691 00005C64 5B                      	pop	bx
 34692                                  	;jae	short GETEOF1   ; EOF
 34693 00005C65 73CF                    	jae	short GETEOF4 ; ** ; 28/02/2024
 34694                                  	;mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW] ; not EOF
 34695                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 34696 00005C67 5B                      	pop	bx	; * ; 28/02/2024
 34697 00005C68 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 34698 00005C6A EBDD                    	jmp	short GETEOF2   ; get next cluster
 34699                                  	;;;
 34700                                  %endif
 34701

 34709                                  ;	TITLE	FCB - FCB parse calls for MSDOS
 34710                                  ;	NAME	FCB
 34711                                  
 34712                                  ;**	FCB.ASM - Low level routines for parsing names into FCBs and analyzing
 34713                                  ;		  filename characters
 34714                                  ;
 34715                                  ;	MakeFcb

 34717                                  ;	PATHCHRCMP

 34719                                  ;	UCase
 34720                                  ;	GetLet3

 34724                                  ;	DELIM
 34725                                  ;
 34726                                  ;	Revision history:
 34727                                  ;
 34728                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 34729                                  ;	
 34730                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 34731                                  
 34732                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 34733                                  
 34734                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 34735                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 34736                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 34737                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
