 34739                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34740                                  ;
 34741                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 34742                                  ;
 34743                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34744                                  
 34745                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34746                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34747                                  
 34748                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34749                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9DB0h
 34750                                  
 34751                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8ED3h)
 34752                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8D92h)
 34753                                  
 34754                                  ; Burada Kaldým - 28/06/2024
 34755                                  
 34756                                  MAKEFCB:
 34757                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34758                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 34759 00005C6C 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 34760                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34761 00005C6E 368816[4E03]            	mov	[ss:SpaceFlag],dl ; 0
 34762                                  	;test	al,2
 34763 00005C73 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 34764 00005C75 7503                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 34765                                  	;MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 34766                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34767 00005C77 268815                  	mov	[es:di],dl ; 0
 34768                                  DEFDRV:
 34769 00005C7A 47                      	INC	DI
 34770 00005C7B B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34771                                  	;test	al,4
 34772 00005C7E A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 34773 00005C80 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 34774 00005C81 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34775 00005C83 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 34776 00005C85 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34777 00005C87 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 34778                                  FILLB:
 34779 00005C89 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34780 00005C8B B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 34781 00005C8D F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 34782 00005C90 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 34783 00005C92 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34784 00005C94 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 34785                                  FILLB2:
 34786 00005C96 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34787 00005C98 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 34788 00005C99 AB                      	STOSW
 34789 00005C9A AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 34790 00005C9B 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 34791                                  	;test	bl,1
 34792 00005C9E F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 34793 00005CA1 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 34794 00005CA3 E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 34795 00005CA6 E81E01                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 34796 00005CA9 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 34797 00005CAB 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 34798                                  SKPSPC:
 34799 00005CAC E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 34800                                  NOSCAN:
 34801 00005CAF E8EC00                  	CALL	GETLET
 34802 00005CB2 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 34803 00005CB4 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 34804 00005CB7 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 34805 00005CB9 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 34806 00005CBA 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 34807 00005CBC 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 34808                                  
 34809 00005CBE 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34810 00005CBF E8BA1E                  	call	GetVisDrv
 34811 00005CC2 58                      	POP	AX
 34812 00005CC3 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 34813                                  
 34814                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34815                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34816                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34817 00005CC5 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 34818                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 34819 00005CCB 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 34820                                  BADDRV:
 34821 00005CCD B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 34822                                  HAVDRV:
 34823 00005CCF AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 34824 00005CD0 46                      	INC	SI
 34825 00005CD1 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 34826                                  NODRV:
 34827 00005CD2 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 34828 00005CD3 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 34829                                  
 34830                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 34831                                  NORMSCAN:
 34832 00005CD4 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34833 00005CD7 E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 34834 00005CDA 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 34835 00005CDD 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 34836 00005CDF 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 34837                                  
 34838                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34839                                  	;mov	cx,3
 34840 00005CE0 B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 34841                                  
 34842                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34843                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34844                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 34845                                  	; 10/06/2019
 34846 00005CE2 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 34847 00005CE8 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 34848 00005CEA A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 34849                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34850                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 34851 00005CEB 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 34852                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 34853                                  VOLOK:
 34854                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 34855                                  contvol:
 34856 00005CEC E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 34857                                  NODOT:
 34858 00005CEF 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 34859                                  
 34860                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34861                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 34862                                  	; 18/12/2022
 34863 00005CF1 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 34864                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 34865                                  
 34866 00005CF7 C3                      	retn
 34867                                  
 34868                                  NONAM:
 34869 00005CF8 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34870 00005CFA 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34871 00005CFB C3                      	retn
 34872                                  
 34873                                  GETWORD:
 34874 00005CFC E89F00                  	CALL	GETLET		
 34875 00005CFF 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 34876 00005D01 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34877                                  
 34878                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 34879                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 34880                                  
 34881                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 34882 00005D02 E89900                  	CALL	GETLET
 34883                                  
 34884                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 34885                                  
 34886                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 34887                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34888                                  ;ENDIF
 34889 00005D05 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 34890                                  
 34891                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34892 00005D07 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 34893 00005D0D 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 34894 00005D0F 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 34895 00005D11 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 34896                                  
 34897                                  MustCheckCX:
 34898 00005D13 E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 34899 00005D15 49                      	DEC	CX
 34900 00005D16 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 34901 00005D18 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 34902 00005D1A B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 34903 00005D1C F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34904                                  NOSTAR:
 34905 00005D1E AA                      	STOSB
 34906 00005D1F 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"
 34907 00005D21 75DF                    	JNZ	short MUSTGETWORD
 34908 00005D23 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 34909 00005D26 EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 34910                                  FILLNAM:
 34911 00005D28 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34912 00005D2A F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34913 00005D2C 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34914 00005D2D C3                      	retn
 34915                                  
 34916                                  SCANB:
 34917 00005D2E AC                      	LODSB
 34918 00005D2F E89D00                  	CALL	SPCHK
 34919 00005D32 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 34920 00005D34 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34921                                  scanb_retn:
 34922 00005D35 C3                      	retn
 34923                                  
 34924                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34925                                  ;
 34926                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 34927                                  ;
 34928                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 34929                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 34930                                  ;
 34931                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 34932                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 34933                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 34934                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 34935                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 34936                                  ;
 34937                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34938                                  
 34939                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34940                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34941                                  
 34942                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34943                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9E7Ch
 34944                                  
 34945                                  NameTrans:
 34946                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34947 00005D36 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 34948 00005D3C 16                      	push	ss
 34949 00005D3D 07                      	pop	es
 34950                                  
 34951                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 34952 00005D3E BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 34953 00005D41 57                      	PUSH	DI
 34954                                  
 34955                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34956                                  %if 0
 34957                                  	MOV	AX,'  '	; 2020h
 34958                                  	MOV	CX,5
 34959                                  	STOSB
 34960                                  	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34961                                  	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 34962                                  	MOV	DL,AL
 34963                                  %else
 34964                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34965                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34966                                  	;;;
 34967 00005D42 B020                    	mov     al, 20h ; ' '
 34968 00005D44 B90B00                  	mov     cx, 11
 34969 00005D47 F3AA                    	rep stosb               ; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34970 00005D49 91                      	xchg    ax, cx
 34971 00005D4A 99                      	cwd
 34972                                  	;;;
 34973                                  %endif
 34974                                  
 34975 00005D4B AA                      	STOSB
 34976 00005D4C 5F                      	POP	DI
 34977                                  
 34978 00005D4D E884FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 34979                                  
 34980                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 34981 00005D50 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 34982 00005D56 75DD                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 34983 00005D58 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 34984 00005D5E C3                      	retn
 34985                                  
 34986                                  ;Break	<GETLET, DELIM -- CHECK CHARACTERS AND CONVERT>
 34987                                  ;============================================================================
 34988                                  
 34989                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34990                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34991                                  
 34992                                  ;If TableLook
 34993                                  
 34994                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 34995                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 34996                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34997                                  
 34998                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 34999                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 35000                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 35001                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 35002                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 35003                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 35004                                  
 35005                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 35006                                  ;CharType:
 35007                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35008                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 35009                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35010                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 35011                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35012                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 35013                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35014                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 35015                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35016                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 35017                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35018                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 35019                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35020                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 35021                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35022                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 35023                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35024                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 35025                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35026                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 35027                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35028                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 35029                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35030                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 35031                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35032                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 35033                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35034                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35036                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 35037                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35038                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 35039                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 35040                                  ;	      ; # and "
 35041                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 35042                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 35043                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 35044                                  ;	      ; + and *
 35045                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 35046                                  ;	      ; - and '
 35047                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 35048                                  ;	      ; / and .
 35049                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35050                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 35051                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 35052                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 35053                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 35054                                  ;	      ; = and <
 35055                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 35056                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 35057                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 35058                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 35059                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 35060                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 35061                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 35062                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 35063                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35064                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 35065                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 35066                                  ;	      ; } and |
 35067                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 35068                                  
 35069                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 35070                                  ;					; character in the table
 35071                                  
 35072                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 35073                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 35074                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 35075                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB
 35076                                  
 35077                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35078                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35079                                  ; DOSCODE:8F76h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35080                                  
 35081                                  CharType: ; 63 bytes
 35082 00005D5F 6666666606666666                db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 06h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 0-7
 35083 00005D67 6666666666666666        	db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 8-15
 35084 00005D6F F8F6FFFFFF4FF46E        	db 0F8h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 4Fh,0F4h, 6Eh ; 16-23

 35133                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35134                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35135                                  
 35136                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35137                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35138                                  
 35139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35140                                  ;
 35141                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 35142                                  ;
 35143                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 35144                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 35145                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 35146                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 35147                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 35148                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 35149                                  ;
 35150                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 35151                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 35152                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 35153                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 35154                                  ;
 35155                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 35156                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 35157                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 35158                                  ;
 35159                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35160                                  
 35161                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 35162                                  
 35163                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 35164                                  GETLET:	
 35165 00005D9E AC                      	LODSB
 35166                                  
 35167                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 35168                                  
 35169                                  	;entry	UCase
 35170                                  UCase:	
 35171                                  	; 09/08/2018
 35172                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 35173                                  _UCase:
 35174 00005D9F 53                      	PUSH	BX
 35175 00005DA0 BB[7E0B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 35176                                  
 35177                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 35178                                  
 35179                                  gl_0:
 35180 00005DA3 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 35181 00005DA5 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 35182 00005DA7 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 35183 00005DA9 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 35184 00005DAB 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 35185                                  
 35186                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 35187                                  
 35188                                  gl_1:
 35189 00005DAD 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 35190 00005DAF 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 35191 00005DB1 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 35192                                  
 35193                                  	; M048 - Start 
 35194                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 35195                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 35196                                  	; preserve it.
 35197                                  
 35198                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35199                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35200                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 35201                                  	;CS	XLAT
 35202                                  
 35203                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35204                                  
 35205                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35206 00005DB3 1E                      	push	ds
 35207                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 35208 00005DB4 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35209 00005DB9 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 35210 00005DBA 1F                      	pop	ds
 35211                                  
 35212                                  	; M048 - End
 35213                                  
 35214                                  ; Now check the type
 35215                                  
 35216                                  ;If TableLook
 35217                                  gl_2:
 35218                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35219 00005DBB 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35220                                  
 35221                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35222                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 35223                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 35224                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 35225                                  	;cs	xlat	
 35226                                  	
 35227                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35228 00005DBC E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 35229                                  	
 35230                                  	;test	al,1	
 35231 00005DBF A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 35232 00005DC1 58                      	POP	AX
 35233                                  
 35234 00005DC2 5B                      	POP	BX
 35235 00005DC3 C3                      	RETN
 35236                                  
 35237                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 35238                                  
 35239                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35240                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 35241                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 35242 00005DC4 53                      	PUSH	BX
 35243 00005DC5 EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 35244                                  ;ELSE
 35245                                  ;
 35246                                  ;gl_2:
 35247                                  ;	POP	BX
 35248                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 35249                                  ;	retz
 35250                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 35251                                  ;	retz
 35252                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 35253                                  ;	retz
 35254                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 35255                                  ;	retz
 35256                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 35257                                  ;	retz
 35258                                  ;ENDIF
 35259                                  
 35260                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 35261                                  ;
 35262                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 35263                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 35264                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 35265                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 35266                                  ;
 35267                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 35268                                  
 35269                                  	;entry	DELIM
 35270                                  DELIM:
 35271                                  ;IF TableLook
 35272                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35273 00005DC7 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35274                                  
 35275                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35276                                  	;push	bx
 35277                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 35278                                  	;;09/08/2018
 35279                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 35280                                  	;cs	xlat
 35281                                  	;pop	bx
 35282                                  
 35283                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35284 00005DC8 E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 35285                                  	
 35286                                  	;test	al,2
 35287 00005DCB A802                    	TEST	AL,FDELIM
 35288 00005DCD 58                      	POP	AX
 35289 00005DCE C3                      	RETN
 35290                                  ;ELSE
 35291                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 35292                                  ;	retz
 35293                                  ;
 35294                                  ;	CMP	AL,"<"
 35295                                  ;	retz
 35296                                  ;	CMP	AL,"|"
 35297                                  ;	retz
 35298                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 35299                                  ;	retz
 35300                                  ;
 35301                                  ;	CMP	AL,"+"
 35302                                  ;	retz
 35303                                  ;	CMP	AL,"="
 35304                                  ;	retz
 35305                                  ;	CMP	AL,";"
 35306                                  ;	retz
 35307                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 35308                                  ;	retz
 35309                                  ;ENDIF
 35310

 35312                                  ;
 35313                                  ;  SPCHK - checks to see if a character is a space or equivalent
 35314                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to check

 35316                                  ;	Uses  : flags
 35317                                  ;

 35321                                  SPCHK:

 35324 00005DCF 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35325

 35336

 35339 00005DD5 58                      	POP	AX
 35340 00005DD6 C3                      	RETN
 35341                                  ;ELSE
 35342                                  ;	CMP	AL,9		; Filter out tabs too
 35343                                  ;	retz
 35344                                  ;; WARNING! " " MUST be the last compare
 35345                                  ;	CMP	AL," "
 35346                                  ;	return
 35347                                  ;ENDIF
 35348                                  
 35349                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35350                                  ;
 35351                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 35352                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 35353                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 35354                                  ;
 35355                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 35356                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 35357                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 35358                                  ;
 35359                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35360                                  
 35361                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35362                                  
 35363                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35364                                  
 35365                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35366                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35367                                  
 35368                                  GetCharType:
 35369                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 35370 00005DD7 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 35371 00005DD9 7314                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 35372                                  
 35373 00005DDB 53                      	push	bx
 35374 00005DDC BB[5F5D]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 35375 00005DDF D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 35376                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 35377 00005DE1 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 35378 00005DE3 5B                      	pop	bx
 35379                                  
 35380                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 35381                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 35382                                  
 35383 00005DE4 7306                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 35384                                  
 35385                                  ; 29/02/2024
 35386                                  %if 0
 35387                                  	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 35388                                  	shr	al,1
 35389                                  	shr	al,1
 35390                                  	shr	al,1
 35391                                  %else
 35392                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35393                                  	;;;
 35394 00005DE6 51                      	push	cx
 35395 00005DE7 B104                    	mov	cl,4			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 35396 00005DE9 D2E8                    	shr	al,cl
 35397 00005DEB 59                      	pop	cx
 35398                                  	;;;
 35399                                  %endif
 35400                                  
 35401                                  gct_80:
 35402 00005DEC 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 35403 00005DEE C3                      	retn
 35404                                  gct_90:
 35405 00005DEF B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 35406 00005DF1 C3                      	retn

 35416 00005DF4 7606                    	JBE	short PathRet
 35417 00005DF6 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 35418 00005DF8 C3                      	retn
 35419                                  GotFor:
 35420 00005DF9 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 35421 00005DFB C3                      	retn
 35422                                  PathRet:
 35423 00005DFC 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 35424 00005DFE C3                      	retn

 35435                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 35436                                  
 35437                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 35438                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 35439                                  
 35440                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 35441                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 35442                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 35443                                  ;
 35444                                  ;	FATAL
 35445                                  ;	FATAL1
 35446                                  ;	reset_environment
 35447                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 35448                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 35449                                  ;	STATCHK
 35450                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 35451                                  ;	DIVOV
 35452                                  ;	CHARHARD
 35453                                  ;	HardErr
 35454                                  ;
 35455                                  ;	Revision history:
 35456                                  ;
 35457                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 35458                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 35459                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 35460                                  ;
 35461                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 35462                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 35463                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 35464                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 35465                                  ;
 35466                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 35467                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 35468                                  ;	      charhard.

 35846                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35847                                  ;
 35848                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35849                                  ;
 35850                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35851                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35852                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35853                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35854                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35855                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35856                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35857                                  ; is simulated.
 35858                                  ;
 35859                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35860                                  
 35861                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35862                                  
 35863                                  CNTCHAND:
 35864                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35865                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35866                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35867                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35868                                  
 35869                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35870                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35871 00005F47 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35872 00005F4D 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35873                                  
 35874 00005F4F B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35875 00005F51 E871BD                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35876 00005F54 E806BC                          CALL	CRLF
 35877                                  around_deadlock:
 35878 00005F57 16                              PUSH    SS
 35879 00005F58 1F                              POP     DS
 35880 00005F59 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35881 00005F5E 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 35882 00005F60 E8FBDB                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 35883                                  NOSWAP:
 35884 00005F63 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 35885 00005F64 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 35886 00005F68 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 35887 00005F6C E8D2A4                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 35888                                  
 35889                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 35890                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 35891                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 35892                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 35893                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 35894                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 35895                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 35896                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35897                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35898                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35899                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35900                                  			; else
 35901                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35902                                  
 35903                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35904                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 35905                                  
 35906                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 35907                                  	
 35908 00005F6F 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 35909                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 35910 00005F70 1E                      	push	ds
 35911                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35912 00005F71 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35913 00005F76 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35914                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35915                                  	;;;
 35916 00005F7B C606[B812]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 35917                                  	;;;
 35918 00005F80 C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 35919 00005F85 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 35920                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 35921 00005F89 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 35922                                  
 35923 00005F8E 803E[660D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35924 00005F93 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 35925 00005F94 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35926 00005F96 F8                      	CLC				
 35927 00005F97 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35928 00005F99 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 35929                                  
 35930                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35931                                  do_low_int23:
 35932 00005F9B F8                      	clc
 35933 00005F9C 2EFF1E[FF5D]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]
 35934                                  
 35935                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 35936                                  
 35937                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 35938                                  
 35939                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35940                                  ;
 35941                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35942                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35943                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 35944                                  ;
 35945                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 35946                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 35947                                  
 35948                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 35949                                  
 35950 00005FA1 FA                      	CLI
 35951                                  
 35952                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 35953                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 35954                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35955                                  	;POP	AX
 35956                                  
 35957                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35958                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35959                                  
 35960                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 35961                                  
 35962 00005FA2 50                      	push	ax
 35963 00005FA3 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 35964                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35965 00005FA5 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35966 00005FAA A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 35967 00005FAD 58                      	pop	ax
 35968 00005FAE A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 35969 00005FB1 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35970 00005FB2 58                      	pop	ax
 35971                                  
 35972                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 35973                                  
 35974                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35975                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 35976                                  	;JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35977                                  
 35978                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35979 00005FB3 3B26[3203]              	CMP	SP,[ConC_Spsave]
 35980 00005FB7 750A                    	JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35981                                  
 35982                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 35983                                  
 35984                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 35985                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35986                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 35987                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35988                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35989 00005FB9 A1[3A03]                	mov	ax,[USER_IN_AX]
 35990 00005FBC 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds and original sp
 35991                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0 
 35992                                  	;transfer COMMAND
 35993                                  COMMANDJ:
 35994 00005FC0 E92EA3                  	JMP	COMMAND
 35995                                  
 35996                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 35997                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 35998                                  
 35999                                  ctrlc_try_new:
 36000                                  	; 29/02/2024
 36001                                  	;ADD	SP,2			; pop those flags
 36002                                  	;
 36003                                  	;;test	ax,1
 36004                                  	;TEST	AX,f_Carry		; did he return with carry?
 36005 00005FC3 A801                    	test	al,f_Carry ; test al,1
 36006                                  	;
 36007                                  	; 29/02/2024
 36008 00005FC5 58                      	pop	ax  ;  (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36009                                  	;
 36010 00005FC6 74F1                    	JZ	short ctrlc_repeat	; no carry set, just retry
 36011                                  
 36012                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36013 00005FC8 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds
 36014                                  
 36015                                  	; Well...  time to abort the user.  
 36016                                  	; Signal a ^C exit and use the EXIT system call..
 36017                                  
 36018                                  ctrlc_abort:
 36019                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36020                                          ;;MOV	AX,(EXIT SHL 8) + 0
 36021                                          ;MOV	AX,(EXIT*256) + 0  ; 4C00h
 36022                                  	;mov	byte [CS:DidCTRLC],0FFh ; 14/03/2018
 36023                                          ;transfer COMMAND	    ; give up by faking $EXIT
 36024                                  	;;JMP	SHORT COMMANDJ
 36025                                  	;JMP	COMMAND
 36026                                  
 36027                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36028                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 36030 00005FCF 1E                      	push	ds
 36031                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 36032 00005FD0 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]

 36034 00005FDA 1F                      	pop	ds

 36036 00005FDB EBE3                    	JMP	SHORT COMMANDJ

 36213                                  ;
 36214                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 36215                                  ;
 36216                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 36217                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 36218                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 36219                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 36220                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 36221                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 36222                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36223                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 36224                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 36225                                  ; Output:
 36226                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 36227                                  ;
 36228                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36229                                  
 36230                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36231                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36232                                  HARDERR:
 36233                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36234                                  	; 30/07/2018
 36235                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36236 0000605C 97                      	XCHG	AX,DI		  	; Error code in DI, count in AX
 36237                                  	;and	di,0FFh

 36239                                  	;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?
 36240                                  	;cmp	di,0
 36241 00006061 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?
 36242 00006064 750A                    	JNZ	short NOSETWRPERR
 36243 00006066 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36244                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36245                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 36246                                  	;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]

 36249                                  		; 15/03/2018

 36251 0000606F 58                      	POP	AX
 36252                                  NOSETWRPERR:
 36253 00006070 29C8                    	SUB	AX,CX		  ; Number of sectors successfully transferred
 36254 00006072 01C2                    	ADD	DX,AX		  ; First sector number to retry

 36256                                  	;;;

 36263 0000607F 5A                      	POP	DX
 36264 00006080 01C3                    	ADD	BX,AX		  	; First address for retry
 36265                                  	;XOR	AH,AH ; *	  	; Flag disk section in error
 36266                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36267                                  	;;;

 36269                                  	;cmp	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],0

 36271 00006089 7506                    	jnz	short TESTDIR
 36272                                  	;;;
 36273                                  	;CMP	DX,[ES:BP+6] 		; In reserved area?
 36274 0000608B 263B5606                	CMP	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 36275 0000608F 7246                    	JB	SHORT ERRINT
 36276                                  
 36277                                  TESTDIR:	; 29/02/2024	
 36278 00006091 FEC4                    	INC	AH			; Flag for FAT
 36279                                  
 36280                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36281                                  	;;;

 36284 00006098 7525                    	jnz	short TESTDIR3 ; not FAT32
 36285 0000609A 52                      	push	dx
 36286 0000609B 368B16[0706]            	mov	dx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 36287                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 36288 000060A0 263B562B                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 36289 000060A4 5A                      	pop	dx
 36290 000060A5 7504                    	jnz	short TESTDIR1	; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 36291                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+29h]
 36292 000060A7 263B5629                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR]
 36293                                  TESTDIR1:
 36294 000060AB 730E                    	jnb	short TESTDIR2
 36295                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh ; -1
 36296 000060AD 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh

 36300                                  TESTDIR2:

 36302                                  	;inc	ah
 36303                                  	;jmp	short ERRINT

 36307                                  	;;;
 36308

 36325 000060CF 263B560B                	CMP	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]

 36329                                  ERRINT:

 36338                                  FATAL:

 36346                                  FATAL1:

 36348 000060E7 368C06[8205]            	MOV	[SS:EXITHOLD+2],ES

 36352 000060F1 26C47613                	LES	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR]
 36353 000060F5 8CC5                    	MOV	BP,ES			; BP:SI points to the device involved
 36354                                  
 36355                                  	; DI has the INT-24-style extended error. We now map the error code
 36356                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the
 36357                                  	; ErrMap24 table as a translate table. Note that we translate ONLY
 36358                                  	; the device returned codes and leave all others beyond the look up
 36359                                  	; table alone.
 36360                                  
 36361                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36362                                  FATALC:
 36363 000060F7 E8A101                  	call	SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 36364                                  	;cmp	di,0Ch
 36365 000060FA 83FF0C                  	CMP	DI,error_I24_gen_failure
 36366 000060FD 7603                    	JBE	short GOT_RIGHT_CODE	; Error codes above gen_failure get
 36367 000060FF BF0C00                  	MOV	DI,error_I24_gen_failure; mapped to gen_failure. Real codes
 36368                                  					;  Only come via GetExtendedError
 36369                                  
 36370                                  ;** ----------------------------------------------------------------
 36371                                  ;
 36372                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 36373                                  ;
 36374                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 36375                                  ;
 36376                                  ; ALL I 24 regs set up. ALL Extended error info SET. ALLOWED Set.
 36377                                  ;	EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.
 36378                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------
 36379                                  	;entry	NET_I24_ENTRY
 36380                                  NET_I24_ENTRY:
 36381                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:
 36382 00006102 36803E[2003]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; No INT 24s if already INT 24
 36383 00006108 7404                    	JZ	SHORT NoSetFail
 36384 0000610A B003                    	MOV	AL,3
 36385 0000610C EB76                    	JMP	short FailRet
 36386                                  NoSetFail:
 36387 0000610E 368926[8805]            	MOV	[SS:CONTSTK],SP		; SS override
 36388 00006113 16                      	PUSH	SS
 36389 00006114 07                      	POP	ES
 36390                                      
 36391                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 36392                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may
 36393                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then
 36394                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.
 36395                                  
 36396 00006115 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1 ; 0FFFFh
 36397 0000611B 740C                    	JZ	short _NoFree
 36398 0000611D 1E                      	push	ds
 36399 0000611E 56                      	push	si
 36400 0000611F 36C536[AE05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:PJFN]
 36401 00006124 C604FF                  	MOV	BYTE [SI],0FFH
 36402 00006127 5E                      	pop	si
 36403 00006128 1F                      	pop	ds
 36404                                  
 36405                                  _NoFree:
 36406 00006129 FA                      	CLI
 36407                                  					; Prepare to play with stack
 36408 0000612A 36FE06[2003]            	INC	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE]	; Flag INT 24 in progress
 36409 0000612F 36FE0E[2103]            	DEC	BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; INT 24 handler might not return
 36410                                  
 36411                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36412                                  	;;;
 36413 00006134 36FE0E[B812]            	dec	byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG]	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 36414                                  	;;;
 36415                                  
 36416                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSDOS 6.21)
 36417                                  
 36418                                  	;; Extended Open hooks
 36419                                  					; AN000;IFS.I24 error disabled
 36420                                  	;test	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],2
 36421 00006139 36F606[F605]02          	TEST	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],EXT_OPEN_I24_OFF
 36422 0000613F 7404                    	JZ	short i24yes		; AN000;IFS.no
 36423                                  faili24:				; AN000;
 36424 00006141 B003                    	MOV	AL,3			; AN000;IFS.fake fail
 36425 00006143 EB29                    	JMP	short passi24 		; AN000;IFS.exit
 36426                                  i24yes: 				; AN000;
 36427                                  	;; Extended Open hooks
 36428                                  
 36429 00006145 368E16[8605]            	MOV	SS,[SS:USER_SS]
 36430 0000614A 268B26[8405]            	MOV	SP,[ES:USER_SP]	; User stack pointer restored
 36431                                  
 36432                                  	;;int	24h	
 36433                                  	;IN	int_fatal_abort		; Fatal error interrupt vector,
 36434                                  					; must preserve ES
 36435                                  	; 05/05/2019
 36436 0000614F 26803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [es:DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 36437 00006155 7504                    	jne	short do_low_int24	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 36438 00006157 CD24                    	INT	int_fatal_abort 	; Fatal error interrupt vector,
 36439                                  					; must preserve ES
 36440 00006159 EB05                    	jmp	short criterr_ret_addr
 36441                                  
 36442                                  do_low_int24:
 36443                                  	; 05/05/2019
 36444                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36445 0000615B 2EFF1E[035E]            	call    far [cs:LowInt24Addr]
 36446                                  criterr_ret_addr:
 36447 00006160 268926[8405]            	MOV	[ES:USER_SP],SP	; restore our stack
 36448 00006165 268C16[8605]            	MOV	[ES:USER_SS],SS
 36449 0000616A 8CC5                    	MOV	BP,ES
 36450 0000616C 8ED5                    	MOV	SS,BP
 36451                                  passi24:
 36452 0000616E 368B26[8805]            	MOV	SP,[SS:CONTSTK]
 36453 00006173 36FE06[2103]            	INC	BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; Back in the DOS
 36454                                  
 36455                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36456                                  	;;;
 36457 00006178 36FE06[B812]            	inc	byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG]
 36458                                  	;;;
 36459                                  
 36460 0000617D 36C606[2003]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; Back from INT 24
 36461 00006183 FB                      	STI
 36462                                  FailRet:
 36463 00006184 36C42E[8005]            	LES	BP,[SS:EXITHOLD]
 36464                                  	
 36465                                  	; 08/07/2018
 36466                                  
 36467                                  	; Triage the user's reply.
 36468                                  
 36469 00006189 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1
 36470 0000618B 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore
 36471 0000618D 7445                    	JZ	short CheckRetry	; 1 => retry
 36472 0000618F 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3			; 3 => fail
 36473 00006191 7549                    	JNZ	short DoAbort 		; 2, invalid => abort
 36474                                  
 36475                                  	; The reply was fail. See if we are allowed to fail.
 36476                                  
 36477                                  					; SS override for ALLOWED, EXTOPEN_ON,
 36478                                  					; ALLOWED, FAILERR, WPERR, SFN, pJFN
 36479                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],8

 36481 00006199 7441                    	jz	short DoAbort		; No, do abort
 36482                                  DoFail:
 36483 0000619B B003                    	MOV	AL,3			; just in case...
 36484                                  					; AN000;EO. I24 error disabled
 36485                                  	; 05/05/2019
 36486                                  	;(MSDOS 6.0, MSCTRLC.ASM, 1991)
 36487 0000619D 36F606[F605]02          	test	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],EXT_OPEN_I24_OFF ; 2
 36488 000061A3 7505                    	jnz	short CleanUp 		; AN000;EO. no
 36489                                  	
 36490 000061A5 36FE06[4A03]            	inc	byte [SS:FAILERR]	; Tell everybody
 36491                                  CleanUp:
 36492 000061AA 36C606[2203]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:WPERR],-1
 36493 000061B0 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1
 36494                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36495                                  	;jnz	short CleanUp2
 36496                                  	;retn
 36497                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36498 000061B6 7411                    	jz	short Cleanup_retn ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36499                                  CleanUp2:
 36500 000061B8 1E                      	push	ds
 36501 000061B9 56                      	push	si
 36502 000061BA 50                      	push	ax

 36553                                  
 36554                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 36555                                  	; the PDB as necessary.

 36557 000061F6 E97010                  	jmp	exit_inner
 36558                                  
 36559                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36560                                  ;
 36561                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 36562                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 36563                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 36564                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 36565                                  ;
 36566                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 36567                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 36568                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 36569                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 36570                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 36571                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 36572                                  ;
 36573                                  ; output:   none.
 36574                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36575                                  
 36576                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 36577                                  	
 36578                                  reset_environment:
 36579                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36580                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 36581                                  
 36582                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 36583                                  
 36584 000061F9 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 36585                                  
 36586                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 36587                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 36588                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 36589                                  
 36590 000061FA B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 36591                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 36592                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 36593 000061FC CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 36594                                  
 36595                                  					; SS override
 36596 000061FE 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 36597                                  
 36598                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 36599                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 36600                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 36601                                  					; On process exit.
 36602 00006204 B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 36603 00006207 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 36604                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 36605                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 36606 00006209 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 36607 0000620B E85BAD                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 36608                                  
 36609 0000620E 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 36610 0000620F 06                      	push	es
 36611 00006210 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 36612                                  
 36613 00006211 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 36614 00006216 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 36615 00006218 A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 36616                                  
 36617                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 36618                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper
 36619                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 36620                                  	
 36621 0000621B 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 36622 0000621D 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 36623 0000621F 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 36624 00006221 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 36625 00006223 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 36626                                  
 36627                                  					; SS override
 36628                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 36629 00006224 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 36630 0000622A 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 36631                                  
 36632                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 36633                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 36634                                  
 36635                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 36636 0000622C E87910                  	call	arena_free_process
 36637                                  
 36638                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 36639                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 36640                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 36641                                  
 36642                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 36643 0000622F E87AD4                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 36644                                  
 36645                                  reset_to_parent:
 36646                                  					; SS override
 36647 00006232 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 36648                                  
 36649                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 36650                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 36651 00006237 16                      	push	ss
 36652 00006238 1F                      	pop	ds	
 36653                                  
 36654 00006239 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 36655                                  
 36656                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors,
 36657                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 36658

 36661                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 36662 0000623E E85F08                  	call	FLUSHBUF
