 36797                                  ;============================================================================
 36798                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36799                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36800                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36801                                  
 36802                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36803                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36804                                  
 36805                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36806                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36807                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36808                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36809                                  ;
 36810                                  ;	IsEof
 36811                                  ;	UNPACK
 36812                                  ;	PACK
 36813                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36814                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36815                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36816                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36817                                  ;
 36818                                  ;	Revision history:
 36819                                  ;
 36820                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36821                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36822                                  ;
 36823                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36824                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36825                                  
 36826                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36827                                  
 36828                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36829                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36830                                  
 36831                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36832                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36833                                  ;
 36834                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36835                                  ;
 36836                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36837                                  ;
 36838                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36839                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36840                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36841                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36842                                  ;
 36843                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36844                                  
 36845                                  IsEOF:
 36846                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36847                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36848                                  	;;;
 36849 000062C2 E89901                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36850 000062C5 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36851                                  
 36852                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36853 000062C7 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36854 000062CE 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36855 000062D0 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36856                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36857 000062D3 C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36858                                  
 36859                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36860                                  	;;;
 36861                                  
 36862                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36863 000062D4 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36864 000062DA 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36865                                  
 36866                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36867                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36868                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36869                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36870                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36871                                  
 36872 000062DC 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36873 000062E0 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36874                                  
 36875 000062E2 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36876                                  IsEOF_other:
 36877 000062E6 C3                      	retn
 36878                                  EOF16:
 36879 000062E7 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36880 000062EA C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36881                                  
 36882                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36883                                  
 36884                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36885                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36886                                  ;
 36887                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36888                                  ;
 36889                                  ; Inputs:
 36890                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36891                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36892                                  ; Outputs:
 36893                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36894                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36895                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36896                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36897                                  ;
 36898                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36899                                  ;
 36900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36901                                  
 36902                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36903                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36904                                  	;
 36905                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36906                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36907                                  
 36908                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36909                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36910                                  
 36911                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36912                                  UNPACK:
 36913                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36914 000062EB 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36915 000062ED 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36916                                  
 36917                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36918                                  %if 0
 36919                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36920                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 36921                                  	retn				; done
 36922                                  %else
 36923                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A435h
 36924                                  	;;;
 36925                                  up_1:
 36926 000062EF 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36927 000062F3 7513                    	jne	short up_cont
 36928 000062F5 8B3E[3B0F]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36929 000062F9 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36930 000062FB 893E[EC0A]              	mov	[CCONTENT_HW],di
 36931 000062FF 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]
 36932 00006303 7502                    	jnz	short unpack_retn
 36933 00006305 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36934                                  unpack_retn:
 36935 00006307 C3                      	retn	; [CCONTENT_HW]:DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36936                                  	;;;	
 36937                                  
 36938                                  %endif
 36939                                  
 36940                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 36941                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36942                                  	;;;
 36943                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 36944 00006308 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 36945 0000630D 7510                    	jnz	short up_fat		; not FAT32
 36946                                  	; FAT32
 36947                                  	;mov	si,[es:bp+2Fh]
 36948 0000630F 268B762F                	mov	si,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER+2]
 36949 00006313 3936[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],si
 36950 00006317 750A                    	jne	short up_2
 36951                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+2Dh]
 36952 00006319 263B5E2D                	cmp	bx,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER]
 36953 0000631D EB04                    	jmp	short up_2
 36954                                  up_fat:
 36955                                  	;;;
 36956                                  
 36957                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 36958                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 36959 0000631F 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[es:bp+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 36960                                  up_2:		; 02/03/2024
 36961 00006323 7748                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 36962 00006325 E84B01                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 36963 00006328 7240                    	jc	short _DoContext
 36964                                  
 36965                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36966                                  	;;;
 36967 0000632A FF7502                  	push	word [di+2]		; offset CLUSSAVE+2
 36968 0000632D 368F06[EC0A]            	pop	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW]	; high word of cluster number
 36969                                  	;;;
 36970                                  
 36971 00006332 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 36972 00006334 7521                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 36973                                  
 36974                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36975                                  	;;;
 36976 00006336 E82501                  	call	IsFAT32
 36977 00006339 7211                    	jc	short up_fat32		; FAT32 volume (drive)
 36978 0000633B 36C706[EC0A]0000        	mov	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW],0
 36979                                  	;;;
 36980                                  
 36981 00006342 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 36982 00006346 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10 ; 0FF6h
 36983 0000634A 721A                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 36984                                  
 36985                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36986                                  %if 0
 36987                                  	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 36988                                  	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 36989                                  High12:
 36990                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36991                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36992                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36993                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36994                                  %else
 36995                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36996                                  	;;;
 36997                                  up_fat32:
 36998 0000634C 09FF                    	or	di,di			; set zero condition code, clears carry
 36999                                  	;mov	si,ss
 37000                                  	;mov	ds,si
 37001 0000634E 16                      	push	ss
 37002 0000634F 1F                      	pop	ds
 37003 00006350 7504                    	jnz	short up_retn
 37004 00006352 093E[EC0A]              	or	[CCONTENT_HW],di	; [CCONTENT_HW]:DI = 0 -> zf = 1
 37005                                  up_retn:
 37006 00006356 C3                      	retn
 37007                                  
 37008                                  High12:
 37009 00006357 36C706[EC0A]0000        	mov	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW],0
 37010 0000635E D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 37011 00006360 D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 37012 00006362 D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 37013 00006364 D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 37014                                  	;;;
 37015                                  %endif
 37016                                  
 37017                                  Unpack12:
 37018 00006366 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 37019                                  _DoContext:
 37020 0000636A 16                      	PUSH	SS
 37021 0000636B 1F                      	POP	DS
 37022 0000636C C3                      	retn
 37023                                  
 37024                                  HURTFAT:
 37025                                  
 37026                                  ; 02/03/2024
 37027                                  %if 0
 37028                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh

 37035                                  	;;;
 37036                                  %endif

 37048                                  ;

 37050                                  	call	FATAL
 37051                                  %else

 37053                                  	;;;
 37054                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],8
 37055 00006373 36C606[4B03]08          	mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL
 37056                                  	;

 37058 00006379 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 37059 0000637B 4F                      	dec	di	; 0FFFFh
 37060 0000637C 57                      	push	di
 37061                                  	;

 37073                                  %endif
 37074                                  
 37075 00006391 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 37076 00006393 F8                      	CLC

 37078 00006396 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL

 37084                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37085                                  
 37086                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 37087                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37088                                  ;
 37089                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 37090                                  ;
 37091                                  ; Inputs:
 37092                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 37093                                  ;	DX = Data
 37094                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 37095                                  ; Outputs:
 37096                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 37097                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 37098                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 37099                                  ;	No other registers affected
 37100                                  ;
 37101                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 37102                                  ;
 37103                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37104                                  
 37105                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37106                                  
 37107                                  	; INPUT:
 37108                                  	;  [CLUSDATA_HW]:DX = cluster data/content
 37109                                  	;  [CLUSTNUM_HW]:BX = cluster number (to be updated)
 37110                                  	;  ES:BP = pointer to DPB
 37111                                  
 37112                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37113                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37114                                  PACK:
 37115                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 37116 00006399 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 37117 0000639B 7513                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 37118                                  
 37119                                  ; 02/03/2024
 37120                                  %if 0
 37121                                  	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 37122                                  	retn				; done
 37123                                  %else
 37124                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37125                                  	;;;
 37126 0000639D 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 37127 000063A1 750D                    	jnz	short p_cont
 37128                                  
 37129                                  	;push	ax
 37130                                  	;mov	ax,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; Cluster Data/Content (High Word)
 37131                                  	;mov	[CL0FATENTRY_HW],ax
 37132                                  	;pop	ax
 37133 000063A3 FF36[EA0A]              	push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 37134 000063A7 8F06[3B0F]              	pop	word [CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 37135                                  
 37136 000063AB 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx
 37137 000063AF C3                      	retn
 37138                                  	;;;
 37139                                  %endif
 37140                                  
 37141                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 37142                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 37143 000063B0 E8C000                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 37144 000063B3 72B5                    	JC	short _DoContext
 37145 000063B5 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 37146 000063B7 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 37147 000063B9 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 37148 000063BA B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 37149 000063BC D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 37150 000063BE 59                      	POP	CX
 37151 000063BF 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 37152 000063C2 EB2C                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 37153                                  
 37154                                  ALIGNED:
 37155                                  
 37156                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37157                                  	;;;
 37158 000063C4 E89700                  	call	IsFAT32
 37159 000063C7 7313                    	jnb	short p_fat
 37160                                  
 37161 000063C9 368B36[EA0A]            	mov	si,[ss:CLUSDATA_HW]
 37162 000063CE 337502                  	xor	si,[di+2]		; hw of cluster number
 37163                                  					; offset CLUSSAVE+2
 37164 000063D1 81E6FF0F                	and	si,0FFFh
 37165 000063D5 317502                  	xor	[di+2],si
 37166 000063D8 8915                    	mov	[di],dx
 37167 000063DA EB18                    	jmp	short PACKIN2
 37168                                  p_fat:
 37169                                  	;;;
 37170                                  
 37171                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 37172 000063DC 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 37173 000063E2 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 37174 000063E4 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 37175 000063E8 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 37176 000063EC EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 37177                                  Pack16:
 37178 000063EE 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 37179                                  PACKIN:
 37180 000063F0 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 37181 000063F2 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 37182                                  
 37183                                  PACKIN2:	; 02/03/2024
 37184                                  
 37185                                  ;hkn; SS override
 37186 000063F4 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 37187                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37188 000063F9 F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 37189                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;

 37191                                  	; 10/06/2019
 37192 000063FF E8D007                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 37193                                  	
 37194                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 37195 00006402 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 37196                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 37197                                  ;hkn; SS override
 37198 00006406 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018

 37203 00006410 50                      	PUSH	AX

 37247

 37250                                  yesdirty12:

 37280                                  IsFAT32:

 37288

 37290 0000646C 26837E2DF6              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER],0FFF6h
 37291                                  isfat32eof_1:
 37292 00006471 F5                      	cmc	; cf=1 -> FAT32
 37293                                  isfat32eof_2:
 37294 00006472 C3                      	retn
 37295                                  
 37296                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37297                                  
 37298                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37299                                  
 37300                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 37301                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37302                                  ;
 37303                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 37304                                  ;
 37305                                  ; Inputs:
 37306                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 37307                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 37308                                  ; Function:
 37309                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 37310                                  ; Outputs:
 37311                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 37312                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 37313                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 37314                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 37315                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 37316                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 37317                                  ;
 37318                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37319                                  
 37320                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37321                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37322                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37323                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37324                                  
 37325                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37326                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 37327                                  
 37328                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 37329                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 37330 00006473 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 37331                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 37332 00006478 50                      	push	ax
 37333 00006479 53                      	push	bx
 37334 0000647A 51                      	push	cx
 37335 0000647B 52                      	push	dx
 37336                                  	; 02/03/2024
 37337                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 37338                                  
 37339                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37340                                  	;;;
 37341                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 37342 0000647C 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 37343 0000647E 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 37344                                  	;
 37345 00006482 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37346                                  	;
 37347 00006483 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 37348 00006485 E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 37349 00006488 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 37350                                  	; FAT32
 37351 0000648A D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 37352 0000648C D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 37353 0000648E D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 37354 00006490 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 37355 00006492 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 37356 00006494 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 37357                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 37358 00006496 EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 37359                                  mapcl1:
 37360                                  	;;;
 37361                                  
 37362 00006498 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 37363                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37364                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 37365                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 37366                                  	;
 37367                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37368                                  	;;;
 37369 0000649E 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 37370                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 37371 000064A0 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 37372 000064A2 D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 37373                                  mapcl2:
 37374 000064A4 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 37375 000064A6 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 37376 000064AA 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 37377                                  	;;;
 37378                                  Map16:	
 37379                                  
 37380                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37381                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37382                                  %if 0
 37383                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 37384                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 37385                                  	
 37386                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37387                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 37388                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 37389                                  %endif
 37390                                  
 37391 000064AC 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 37392                                  
 37393                                  ;IF FastDiv
 37394                                  ;
 37395                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 37396                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 37397                                  ;
 37398                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 37399                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 37400                                  ;
 37401                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 37402                                  
 37403 000064B0 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 37404 000064B4 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 37405                                  
 37406                                  ; 02/04/2024
 37407                                  %if 0
 37408                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 37409                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 37410                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 37411                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 37412                                  	;shr	al,1	
 37413                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 37414                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 37415                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 37416                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37417                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 37418                                  %else
 37419                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37420                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37421                                  	;;;
 37422 000064B6 50                      	push	ax
 37423 000064B7 D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 37424 000064B9 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 37425 000064BB D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 37426 000064BD 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 37427 000064BF 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 37428 000064C1 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 37429 000064C3 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 37430 000064C5 D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 37431 000064C7 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 37432 000064C9 87D7                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 37433 000064CB 5A                      	pop	dx
 37434 000064CC 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 37435                                  	;;;
 37436                                  %endif
 37437 000064D0 EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 37438                                  
 37439                                  _DoDiv:
 37440                                  ;ENDIF
 37441                                  
 37442                                  ; 02/04/2024
 37443                                  %if 0
 37444                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37445                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 37446                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37447                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 37448                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 37449                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 37450                                  %else
 37451                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37452                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37453                                  	;;;
 37454 000064D2 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 37455 000064D3 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 37456 000064D4 F7F1                    	div	cx
 37457 000064D6 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 37458 000064D7 F7F1                    	div	cx
 37459                                  	;jmp	short DivDone
 37460                                  	;;;
 37461                                  %endif
 37462                                  
 37463                                  ;IF FastDiv
 37464                                  DivDone:
 37465                                  ;ENDIF
 37466                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 37467 000064D9 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 37468                                  	
 37469                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37470                                  	;;;
 37471 000064DD 83D700                  	adc	di,0
 37472                                  	;;;
 37473

 37551                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *

 37573 00006535 59                      	pop	cx

 37601 00006550 5A                      	pop	dx
 37602 00006551 59                      	pop	cx

 37608                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37609                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37610                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37611                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37612                                  
 37613                                  ; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 37616                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 37617                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37618                                  ;
 37619                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 37620                                  ;
 37621                                  ; Inputs:
 37622                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 37623                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 37624                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 37625                                  ; Function:
 37626                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 37627                                  ;	if disk changed.
 37628                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 37629                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 37630                                  ; Outputs:
 37631                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 37632                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 37633                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 37634                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 37635                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 37636                                  ;
 37637                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37638                                  
 37639                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 37640 00006555 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 37641                                  
 37642                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37643                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37644                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 37645                                  	; 15/12/2022
 37646 00006559 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 37647 0000655D A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 37648 00006560 E802A1                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 37649                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37650                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37651 00006563 E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37652                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 37653                                  	;retn
 37654                                  
 37655                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37656                                  ;
 37657                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 37658                                  ;
 37659                                  ; Inputs:
 37660                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 37661                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 37662                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 37663                                  ; Function:
 37664                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 37665                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 37666                                  ; Outputs:
 37667                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 37668                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 37669                                  ;	THISDRV set
 37670                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 37671                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 37672                                  ;
 37673                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37674                                  
 37675                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37676                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37677                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37678                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37679                                  
 37680                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37681                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 37682                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 37683                                  
 37684                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 37685 00006566 06                      	PUSH	ES
 37686 00006567 57                      	PUSH	DI
 37687                                  
 37688                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 37689 00006568 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37690                                  
 37691                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37692                                  %if 0
 37693                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37694                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 37695                                  	; 15/12/2022
 37696                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 37697                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 37698                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 37699                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37700                                  %else
 37701                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37702                                  	;;;
 37703 0000656C E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 37704                                  	;;;
 37705                                  %endif
 37706 0000656F 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 37707 00006570 07                      	POP	ES
 37708 00006571 72E1                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 37709 00006573 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 37710                                  
 37711                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 37712                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 37713                                  
 37714                                  MED_CHANGE:
 37715                                  	;XOR	AX,AX
 37716                                  	;DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 37717                                  	; 03/03/2024
 37718 00006575 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 37719                                  	
 37720 00006578 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 37721 00006579 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 37722 0000657D 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 37723                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 37724 0000657F 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 37725                                  
 37726                                  ;hkn; SS override
 37727                                  
 37728                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 37729                                  ;
 37730                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 37731                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 37732                                  
 37733 00006583 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 37734                                  frcd20: 
 37735                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 37736                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 37737 00006588 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 37738 0000658D 7522                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 37739                                  
 37740                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37741                                  	;push	es
 37742                                  	;push	di
 37743                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 37744                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37745                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 37746                                  	;pop	di
 37747                                  	;pop	es
 37748                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 37749                                  
 37750                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37751 0000658F 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37752 00006593 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 37753 00006595 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 37754 00006597 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 37755 0000659B 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 37756                                  
 37757                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37758                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A70Fh
 37759 0000659D 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 37760                                  	;JZ	short frcd25 ; = 0	; If root (0), leave root
 37761                                  		; !!! test es:[di+49h],ax
 37762                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25	
 37763                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM bug (!?) ; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 37764                                  		; test dword ptr es:[di+49h],-1 ; Win ME - BIOSCODE:0C694h
 37765                                  		; jz short frcd25
 37766                                  		;
 37767                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37768 000065A1 7506                    	jnz	short frcd24
 37769                                  
 37770                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37771                                  	;;;
 37772                                  	;test	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37773 000065A3 2685454B                	test	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],AX
 37774 000065A7 7408                    	jz	short frcd25 ; = 0
 37775                                  frcd24:		; 03/03/2024
 37776                                  	;;;
 37777                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 37778 000065A9 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 37779                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37780                                  	;;;
 37781                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37782 000065AD 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax ; -1
 37783                                  	;;;
 37784                                  frcd25:	
 37785                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 37786                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 37787 000065B1 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 37788 000065B4 E2D2                    	LOOP	frcd20
 37789 000065B6 1F                      	POP	DS
 37790                                  NO_CHANGE:
 37791 000065B7 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37792 000065BB F8                      	CLC
 37793 000065BC C3                      	retn
 37794                                  
 37795                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 37796                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 37797                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 37798                                  ;;;
 37799                                  chk_set_first_access:
 37800                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 37801 000065BD 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 37802 000065C2 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 37803                                  	; FAT32
 37804                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 37805 000065C4 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37806                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 37807 000065C9 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37808 000065CF 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 37809                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 37810                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 37811 000065D1 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37812                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 37813                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 37814 000065D6 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37815 000065DC 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 37816                                  	;or	byte [es:bp+18h],1
 37817 000065DE 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37818                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37819 000065E3 C3                      	retn
 37820                                  ;;;
 37821                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37822                                  
 37823                                  
 37824                                  ;Break	<Fat_Operation - miscellaneous fat stuff>
 37825                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37826                                  ;
 37827                                  ; Procedure Name : FAT_operation
 37828                                  ;
 37829                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37830                                  
 37831                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37832                                  
 37833                                  	; 04/03/2024
 37834                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37835                                  
 37836                                  FAT_operation:
 37837                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37838                                  FATERR:
 37839                                  
 37840                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37841                                  %if 0
 37842                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 37843                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 37844                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 37845                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 37846                                  %else
 37847                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37848                                  	;;;
 37849 000065E4 E8D6FF                  	call    chk_set_first_access
 37850                                  	;;;
 37851                                  %endif
 37852                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 37853 000065E7 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 37854                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 37855 000065EB C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 37856                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 37857 000065F0 B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 37858 000065F2 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 37859 000065F5 E8EFFA                  	call	FATAL1
 37860 000065F8 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37861 000065FC 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 37862 000065FE 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 37863                                  
 37864                                  FATERR_fail:	; 03/03/2024
 37865 00006600 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 37866 00006601 C3                      	retn
 37867                                  
 37868                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 37869                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37870 00006602 16                      	push	ss
 37871 00006603 1F                      	pop	ds
 37872                                  
 37873                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37874                                  	;;;
 37875 00006604 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 37876 00006606 09E8                    	or	ax,bp
 37877 00006608 74F6                    	jz	short FATERR_fail
 37878                                  	;;;
 37879                                  
 37880                                  	;;mov	al,0Fh
 37881                                  	;MOV	AL,DMEDHL
 37882                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37883                                  	;;;
 37884 0000660A B013                    	mov	al,19
 37885                                  	;;;
 37886                                  
 37887                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]
 37888 0000660C 268A6601                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 37889 00006610 A3[5A03]                	MOV	[DEVCALL_REQLEN],AX ; 09/09/2018 
 37890 00006613 C606[5C03]01            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVMDCH
 37891 00006618 C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0
 37892                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 37893                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37894 0000661E 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 37895 00006622 A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 37896 00006625 06                      	PUSH	ES
 37897 00006626 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 37898                                  
 37899                                  ;hkn; DEVCALL is in DOSDATA
 37900 00006627 BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 37901                                  	;;lds	si,[es:bp+12h]
 37902                                  	;lds	si,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37903 0000662A 26C57613                	LDS	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; DS:SI Points to device header
 37904 0000662E 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 37905 0000662F E86BEC                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 37906                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37907 00006632 16                      	push	ss
 37908 00006633 1F                      	pop	ds
 37909 00006634 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 37910 00006635 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 37911                                  	;test	di,8000h
 37912                                  	;jnz	short FATERR
 37913 00006639 09FF                    	or	di,di
 37914 0000663B 78A7                    	js	short FATERR		; have error
 37915                                  
 37916                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37917                                  %if 0
 37918                                  	XOR	AH,AH
 37919                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37920                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37921                                  	XCHG	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS] ; Reset dpb_first_access
 37922                                  %else
 37923                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37924                                  	;;;
 37925                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+18h]
 37926 0000663D 268A6618                	mov	ah,[es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS]

 38381 0000683C 53                      	push	bx
 38382 0000683D 51                      	push	cx

 38393

 38395 00006850 7502                    	jne	short gotgetbuf7	; if yes, it is invalid value (must be 0FFFFFFFFh)
 38396 00006852 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx
 38397                                  gotgetbuf7:
 38398 00006854 7308                    	jnb	short gotgetbuf8	; yes, invalid value (must be 0FFFFFFFFh)
 38399

 38404

 38530                                  ;SETVISIT:
 38531                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38532                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 38533                                  ;; Inputs:
 38534                                  ;;      None
 38535                                  ;; Function:
 38536                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 38537                                  ;; Outputs:
 38538                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 38539                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 38540                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 38541                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 38542                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 38543                                  ;; No other registers altered
 38544                                  ;
 38545                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 38546                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 38547                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 38548                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 38549                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 38550                                  ;SETLOOP:
 38551                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 38552                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 38553                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 38554                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 38555                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 38556                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 38557                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 38558                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 38559                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 38560                                  ;       RETN
 38561                                  ;
 38562                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 38563                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38564                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 38565                                  ;
 38566                                  ;; Inputs:
 38567                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 38568                                  ;; Function:
 38569                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 38570                                  ;; Outputs:
 38571                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 38572                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 38573                                  ;; No other registers altered
 38574                                  ;
 38575                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 38576                                  ;       ;retz
 38577                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 38578                                  ;
 38579                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 38580                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 38581                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 38582                                  ;
 38583                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 38584                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 38585                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 38586                                  ;	
 38587                                  ;	push	ax
 38588                                  ;	or	al,1
 38589                                  ;	pop	ax
 38590                                  ;	retn	
 38591                                  ;
 38592                                  ;SKIPLOOP:

 38626                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 38627                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38628                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 38629                                  ; Inputs:
 38630                                  ;	 No Inputs
 38631                                  ; Function:
 38632                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 38633                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 38634                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 38635                                  ; Outputs:
 38636                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 38637                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 38638                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 38639                                  ; No other registers altered
 38640                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38641                                  
 38642                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38643                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38644                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38645                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38646                                  
 38647                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 38648                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 38649                                  
 38650                                  GETCURHEAD:
 38651 000068C4 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 38652 000068C9 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 38653 000068D0 36893E[7E11]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 38654 000068D5 C3                      	retn
 38655                                  
 38656                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 38657                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38658                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 38659                                  ; Inputs:
 38660                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 38661                                  ; Function:
 38662                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 38663                                  ; Outputs:
 38664                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 38665                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 38666                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38667                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 38668                                  
 38669                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 38670                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38671                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 38672                                  ;	push	es
 38673                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 38674                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 38675                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 38676                                  ;	push	es
 38677                                  ;	pop	ds
 38678                                  ;	mov	di,si
 38679                                  ;	pop	es
 38680                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 38681                                  ;	retn	
 38682                                  	
 38683                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38684                                  SCANPLACE:
 38685 000068D6 FF35                    	push	word [di]
 38686                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 38687 000068D8 E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 38688 000068DB 5F                      	pop	di
 38689 000068DC C3                      	retn

 38691                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38692                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 38693                                  ; Input:
 38694                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 38695                                  ; Function:

 38697                                  ; NO registers altered

 38708 000068DD 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;

 38718 000068E8 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;

 38720 000068EC 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 38721 000068EE 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override

 38723                                  not_first:

 38728 000068F8 8904                    	mov	[si],ax
 38729                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],AX	; ax has di->buf_next	;AN000;
 38730 000068FA 96                      	xchg	si,ax

 38732 000068FB 894402                  	mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],AX	;			;AN000;
 38733

 38739 00006909 891D                    	mov	[di],bx

 38743                                  nret:	
 38744                                  	; 23/09/2023							;AN000;
 38745                                  	;pop	SI							;AN000;
 38746 0000690C 5B                      	pop	BX							;AN000;
 38747 0000690D 58                      	pop	AX							;AN000;
 38748                                  									;AN000;
 38749                                  	;cmp	byte [di+4],0FFh
 38750 0000690E 807D04FF                	cmp	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],-1	; Buffer FREE?		;AN000;
 38751 00006912 7505                            jne	short pbx			; M039: -no, jump.
 38752 00006914 36893E[6D00]            	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],di		; M039: -yes, make it LRU.
 38753                                  pbx:

 38820                                  ; places buffer at head

 38882                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38883                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38884                                  ;
 38885                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38886                                  ; Inputs:
 38887                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38888                                  ; Function:
 38889                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38890                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38891                                  ;	   same segment
 38892                                  ;
 38893                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38894                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38895                                  ; No Registers altered
 38896                                  ;
 38897                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38898                                  
 38899                                  POINTCOMP:
 38900                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38901                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 38902 0000691A 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 38903 0000691C 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 38904                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 38905 0000691E 51                      	PUSH	CX
 38906 0000691F 52                      	PUSH	DX
 38907 00006920 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 38908 00006922 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 38909 00006924 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 38910 00006926 5A                      	POP	DX
 38911 00006927 59                      	POP	CX
 38912                                  _ret_label:
 38913 00006928 C3                      	retn
 38914                                  
 38915                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38916                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38917                                  
 38918                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38919                                  
 38920                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38921                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38922                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38923                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38924                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38925                                  ; 
 38926                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38927                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38928                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38929                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38930                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38931                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38932                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38933                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38934                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38935                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38936                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38937                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38938                                  
 38939                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38940                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38941                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38942                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38943                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38944                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38945                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38946                                  ; 
 38947                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38948                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38949                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38950                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38951                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38952                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38953                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38954                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38955                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38956                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38957                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38958                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38959                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38960                                  
 38961                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 39573                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH

 39575                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 39576                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 39577                                  ;
 39578                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 39579                                  ;
 39580                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 39587                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 39934                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39935                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 39937                                  
 39938                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39939                                  
 39940                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39941                                  
 39942                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39943                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39944                                  
 39945                                  ; =========================================================================
 39946                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39947                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39948                                  ;
 39949                                  ;	$WAIT
 39950                                  ;	$EXEC
 39951                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39952                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39953                                  ;	$EXIT
 39954                                  ;	$ABORT
 39955                                  ;	abort_inner
 39956                                  ;
 39957                                  ;	Modification history:
 39958                                  ;
 39959                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39960                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39961                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39962                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39963                                  ;
 39964                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39965                                  ;
 39966                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39967                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39968                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39969                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39970                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39971                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39972                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39973                                  ;
 39974                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39975                                  ;
 39976                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39977                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39978                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39979                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39980                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39981                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39982                                  ;
 39983                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39984                                  ;
 39985                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39986                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39987                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39988                                  ;
 39989                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39990                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39991                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39992                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39993                                  ;
 39994                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39995                                  ;
 39996                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39997                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39998                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39999                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 40000                                  ;
 40001                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 40002                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 40003                                  ;		       UMBs.
 40004                                  ;
 40005                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 40006                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 40007                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 40008                                  ;
 40009                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 40010                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 40011                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 40012                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 40013                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 40014                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 40015                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 40016                                  ;
 40017                                  ; =========================================================================
 40018
