 40020                                  
 40021                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 40022                                  ; =========================================================================
 40023                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 40024                                  ;
 40025                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 40026                                  ;
 40027                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 40028                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 40029                                  ;
 40030                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 40031                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 40032                                  ;	USES	all

 40035                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40036                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 40037

 40039                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 40040                                  
 40041                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 40042                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 40043                                  
 40044                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 40045                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 40046                                  
 40047                                  _$WAIT:
 40048                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40049                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 40050                                  
 40051 00006BE6 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 40052 00006BE8 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 40053 00006BED E97E9A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 40054                                  
 40055                                  ; =========================================================================
 40056                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 40057                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 40058                                  ;
 40059                                  ;
 40060                                  ; Assembler usage:
 40061                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 40062                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 40063                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 40064                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 40065                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 40066                                  ;
 40067                                  ;	AL  Function
 40068                                  ;	--  --------
 40069                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 40070                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 40071                                  ;	    begin execution.
 40072                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 40073                                  ;
 40074                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 40075                                  ;
 40076                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40077                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 40078                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 40079                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40080                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 40081                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 40082                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40083                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 40084                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 40085                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40086                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 40087                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 40088                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40089                                  ;
 40090                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 40091                                  ;
 40092                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40093                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 40094                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 40095                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40096                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 40097                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 40098                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40099                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 40100                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 40101                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40102                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 40103                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 40104                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40105                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 40106                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 40107                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40108                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 40109                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 40110                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40111                                  ;
 40112                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 40113                                  ;
 40114                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40115                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 40116                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 40117                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40118                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 40119                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 40120                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40121                                  ;
 40122                                  ; Returns:
 40123                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 40124                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 40125                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 40126                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 40127                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 40128                                  ; =========================================================================
 40129                                  ;
 40130                                  ;   Revision history:
 40131                                  ;
 40132                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 40133                                  ;
 40134                                  ; =========================================================================
 40135                                  
 40136                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 40137                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 40138

 40146                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128

 40148                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 40149                                  ;ENDIF

 40170                                  _$EXEC:
 40171                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40172                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 40173                                  
 40174                                  EXEC001S:
 40175                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 40176                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 40177                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 40178                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 40179                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 40180                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 40181                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 40182                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 40183                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 40184                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 40185                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 40186                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 40187                                  	;
 40188                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 40189                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 40190                                  
 40191                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 40192                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 40193                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 40194                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 40195                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 40196                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 40197                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 40198                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 40199                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 40200                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 40201                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 40202                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 40203                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 40204                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 40205                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 40206                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 40207                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 40208                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 40209                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 40210                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40211                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 40212                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 40213                                  	
 40214                                  	; ==================================================================
 40215                                  	; validate function
 40216                                  	; ==================================================================
 40217                                  		      	
 40218                                  	; M068 - Start
 40219                                  	;
 40220                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 40221                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 40222                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 40223                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 40224                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 40225                                  
 40226                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40227 00006BF0 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 40228                                  
 40229                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 40230                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 40231                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 40232                                  
 40233 00006BF6 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 40234                                  	;jne	short @f
 40235 00006BF8 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 40236                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 40237 00006BFA 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 40238 00006BFB B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 40239 00006BFE 51                      	push	cx
 40240                                  ;@@:
 40241                                  Exec_@f:
 40242                                  	; M068 - End
 40243                                  	
 40244                                  	;Enter
 40245                                  
 40246 00006BFF 55                      	push	bp
 40247 00006C00 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 40248                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 40249                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 40250                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 6.22 & PCDOS 7.1 ; 07/03/2024

 41253                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 41254                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 41255                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 41256                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie

 41258                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 41259                                  ;call is issued.

 41811                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41812                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41813                                  ;
 41814                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41815                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41816                                  ;
 41817                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41818                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41819                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41820                                  ;
 41821                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41822                                  
 41823                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41824                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41825

 41827                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41828                                  
 41829                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41830                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41831                                  
 41832                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41833 0000721A 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41834                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41835 0000721B 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41836 00007221 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41837 00007226 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41838 00007229 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41839                                  
 41840 0000722B BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41841                                  
 41842                                  Keep_Shrink:
 41843 0000722E 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 41844 00007230 53                      	push	BX
 41845 00007231 06                      	push	ES
 41846 00007232 E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41847 00007235 1F                      	pop	DS
 41848 00007236 5B                      	pop	BX
 41849 00007237 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41850                                  
 41851 00007239 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41852 0000723B 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41853                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41854 0000723D A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41855                                  
 41856                                  Keep_Done:
 41857 00007240 58                      	pop	AX
 41858 00007241 EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 41859

 41914                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41915                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41916                                  ; Inputs:
 41917                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41918                                  ; Function:
 41919                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41920                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41921                                  ; Returns:
 41922                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41923                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41924                                  
 41925                                  _$ABORT:
 41926 00007276 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41927                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41928                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 41929 00007278 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41930                                  
 41931                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41932                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41933                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41934

 42150                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 42151                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42152                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 42153                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42154                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 42155                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 42156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42157                                  
 42158                                  arena_next:
 42159 000072DA 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 42160 000072DC 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 42161 000072E0 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 42162                                  
 42163                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 42164                                  ;
 42165                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 42166                                  ;       RETN
 42167                                  
 42168                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 42169                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42170                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 42171                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42172                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 42173                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 42174                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 42175                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 42176                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42177                                  
 42178                                  check_signature:        
 42179                                  
 42180 000072E1 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 42181                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 42182 000072E3 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 42183                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 42184 000072E7 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 42185                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'

 42187                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 42188 000072ED 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 42189 000072EF F9                              STC                             ; set error
 42190                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 42191                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 42192                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 42193                                  check_signature_ok:
 42194                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 42195 000072F0 C3                      	RETN
 42196                                  
 42197                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 42198                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42199                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 42200                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 42201                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 42202                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 42203                                  ;
 42204                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 42205                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42206                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42207                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 42208                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 42209                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 42210                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 42211                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42212                                          
 42213                                  Coalesce:
 42214                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 42215 000072F1 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 42216                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 42217                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 42218 000072F4 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 42219 000072F6 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 42220                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 42221 000072F9 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 42222                                  
 42223                                  coalesce_check:
 42224                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 42225 000072FB 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 42226                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 42227 00007300 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 42228                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 42229 00007302 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 42230 00007307 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 42231                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 42232 00007308 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 42233 0000730C 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 42234 0000730F 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 42235 00007311 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again

 42237                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42238                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 42239                                  
 42240                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 42241                                  
 42242                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42243                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42244                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 42245                                  ;
 42246                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 42247                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 42248                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 42249                                  ;
 42250                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 42251                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 42252                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 42253                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 42254                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 42255                                  ;
 42256                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 42257                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 42258                                  ;
 42259                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42260                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 42261                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 42262                                  ;           INT     21h
 42263                                  ;
 42264                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 42265                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 42266                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 42267                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 42268                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 42269                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 42270                                  ;
 42271                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 42272                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 42273                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 42274                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 42275                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 42276                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 42277                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 42278                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 42279                                  ;	USES	All
 42280                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42281                                  
 42282                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42283                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42284                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 42285                                  ;
 42286                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42287                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 42288                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 42289                                  ;           INT     21h
 42290                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 42291                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 42292                                  ;
 42293                                  ;   Description:
 42294                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 42295                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 42296                                  ;
 42297                                  ;   Error return:
 42298                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 42299                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 42300                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42301                                  
 42302                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42303                                  
 42304                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42305                                  ; DOSCODE:A22Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 42595                                  	;ja	short alloc_do_split_high
 42596

 42598                                          ;;CMP	BYTE [SS:AllocMethod], 1
 42599                                  	; 04/08/2018
 42600                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SS:AllocMethod],BEST_FIT
 42601                                          ;JA	SHORT alloc_do_split_high
 42602

 42605 00007425 368E1E[4203]            	MOV     DS,[SS:BestArena]

 42607                                  alloc_get_size:
 42608 0000742A 8B0E0300                        MOV     CX,[ARENA.SIZE]
 42609 0000742E 29D9                            SUB     CX,BX                   ; get room left over
 42610 00007430 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS
 42611 00007432 89C2                            MOV     DX,AX                   ; save for owner setting
 42612 00007434 741B                            JE      SHORT alloc_set_owner	; IF BX = size THEN (don't split)
 42613 00007436 01D8                            ADD     AX,BX
 42614 00007438 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember the header

 42616 0000743B 49                              DEC     CX                      ; CX <- size of split block

 42624 0000744C 26893E0100                      MOV     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 42625

 42641                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 42642                                  
 42643                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42644                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42645                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 42646                                  ;
 42647                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 42648                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 42649                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 42650                                  ;
 42651                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 42652                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 42653                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 42654                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 42655                                  ;
 42656                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 42657                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 42658                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 42659                                  ;		code.
 42660                                  ;
 42661                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 42662                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 42663                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 42664                                  ;
 42665                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42666                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42667                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 42668                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 42669                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 42670                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 42671                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 42672                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 42673                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42674                                  
 42675                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42676                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42677                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 42678                                  ;
 42679                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42680                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 42681                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 42682                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 42683                                  ;           INT     21h
 42684                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 42685                                  ;         size possible
 42686                                  ;   Error return:
 42687                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 42688                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 42689                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 42690                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 42691                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42692                                  
 42693                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 42694                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42695                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 42696 00007464 E87BA4                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 42697                                  
 42698 00007467 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 42699 0000746A 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 42700 0000746C 48                              DEC     AX
 42701 0000746D E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 42702 00007470 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 42703                                  
 42704                                  setblock_bad:
 42705 00007472 E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 42706                                  
 42707                                  setblock_grab:
 42708 00007475 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 42709 00007477 E877FE                          CALL    Coalesce
 42710 0000747A 72F6                            JC      SHORT setblock_bad
 42711 0000747C 8B0E0300                        MOV     CX,[ARENA.SIZE]
 42712 00007480 51                              PUSH    CX
 42713 00007481 39CB                            CMP     BX,CX
 42714 00007483 76A5                            JBE     SHORT alloc_get_size
 42715 00007485 E91EFF                          JMP     alloc_fail

 42729

 42733                                  ;

 42788                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42789                                  
 42790                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42791                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42792                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42793                                  ;
 42794                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42795                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42796                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42797                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42798                                  ;           INT     21h
 42799                                  ;
 42800                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42801                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42802                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42803                                  ;
 42804                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42805                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42806                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42807                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42808                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42809                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42810                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42811                                  ;
 42812                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42813                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42814                                  ;
 42815                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42816                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42817                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42818                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42819                                  ;
 42820                                  ;
 42821                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42822                                  ;
 42823                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42824                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42825                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42826                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42827                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42828                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42829                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42830                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42831                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42832                                  ;
 42833                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42834                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42835                                  ;
 42836                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42837                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42838                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42839                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42840                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42841                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42842                                  
 42843                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42844                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42845                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42846                                  ;
 42847                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42848                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42849                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42850                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42851                                  ;           INT     21h
 42852                                  ;
 42853                                  ;   Error return:
 42854                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42855                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42856                                  
 42857                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42858                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42859                                  _$ALLOCOPER:

 43076                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 43077                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43078                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 43079                                  ;
 43080                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 43081                                  ;
 43082                                  ;
 43083                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 43084                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 43085                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 43086                                  ;		   else
 43087                                  ;			DS = last arena
 43088                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 43089                                  ;
 43090                                  ;		   CY if error
 43091                                  ;
 43092                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 43093                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43094                                  
 43095                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43096                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43097

 43099                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 43260                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43261                                  ;
 43262                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 43263                                  ;
 43264                                  ; Inputs:
 43265                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 43266                                  ; Function:
 43267                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 43268                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 43269                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 43270                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 43271                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 43272                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 43273                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 43274                                  ;			CX User Index
 43275                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 43276                                  ;			BX = UID
 43277                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 43278                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 43279                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 43280                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 43281                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 43282                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 43283                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 43284                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 43285                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 43286                                  ;
 43287                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43288                                  
 43289                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 43559                                  ;
 43560                                  ; $SetExtendedError takes extended error information and loads it up for the
 43561                                  ; next extended error call. This is used by interrupt-level proccessors to
 43562                                  ; mask their actions.

 43565                                  ;   Outputs: none

 43583 000076AE 8B4402                  	MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.BX]
 43584 000076B1 36A3[2603]              	MOV	[SS:EXTERR_ACTION],AX
 43585                                  	;mov	ax,[si+4]
 43586 000076B5 8B4404                  	MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.CX]
 43587 000076B8 368826[2303]            	MOV	[SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],AH
 43588 000076BD C3                      	retn

 43610                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 43611                                  
 43612                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 43613                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43614                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 43615                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 43616                                  ;
 43617                                  ;	NOTE:
 43618                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 43619                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43620                                  ;
 43621                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43622                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 43623                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 43624                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43625                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 43626                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 43627                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43628                                  
 43629                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43630                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43631                                  
 43632                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 43633                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43634                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 43635 000076BE 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43636                                  	
 43637                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 43638 000076C3 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 43639                                  
 43640                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 43641 000076C8 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 43642 000076CD 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 43643                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43644                                  	;mov	al,6
 43645 000076CF B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43646                                  ReturnCarry:
 43647 000076D1 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 43648 000076D2 C3                      	retn				; go back
 43649                                  pjfn10: 
 43650                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 43651 000076D3 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 43652 000076D8 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 43653                                  	;clc
 43654                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 43655 000076DA C3                      	retn
 43656                                  
 43657                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 43658                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43659                                  ;
 43660                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 43661                                  ;
 43662                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 43663                                  ;
 43664                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 43665                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 43666                                  ;                   AX has error code
 43667                                  ;               Carry Reset
 43668                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 43669                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 43670                                  ; NOTE:
 43671                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 43672                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43673                                  ;
 43674                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43675                                  
 43676                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43677                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43678                                  
 43679                                  SFFromHandle:
 43680 000076DB E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 43681                                  	;retc				; return if error
 43682 000076DE 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 43683 000076E0 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 43684                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 43685                                  	;;mov	al,6
 43686                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43687                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 43688                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43689                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43690 000076E4 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 43691                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 43692                                  	;;mov	al,6
 43693                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43694                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 43695                                  GetSF:
 43696 000076E6 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 43697 000076E7 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 43698 000076EA 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 43699 000076EC E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 43700 000076EF 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 43701 000076F0 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 43702                                  
 43703                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 43704                                  
 43705                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 43706                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43707                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 43708                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 43709                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 43710                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 43711                                  ;
 43712                                  ;   NOTE:
 43713                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 43714                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43715                                  ;
 43716                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 43717                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43718                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 43719                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 43720                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 43721                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43722                                  
 43723                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43724                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43725                                  
 43726                                  SFFromSFN:
 43727                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43728                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 43729 000076F1 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43730                                  
 43731                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 43732 000076F6 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 43733                                  sfsfn5:	
 43734                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 43735 000076FB 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 43736 000076FF 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 43737                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 43738 00007701 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 43739 00007705 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 43740                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 43741 00007708 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 43742 0000770B 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 43743 0000770D F9                      	STC
 43744 0000770E C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 43745                                  sfsfn7:
 43746 0000770F 50                      	push	ax
 43747                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 43748                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 43749                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 43750                                  	
 43751                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43752 00007710 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 43753                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43754                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 43755                                  	
 43756 00007712 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 43757 00007714 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43758 00007716 58                      	pop	ax
 43759                                  	;add	di,6
 43760 00007717 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43761 0000771A C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43762                                  
 43763                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43764                                  
 43765                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43766                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43767                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43768                                  ;
 43769                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43770                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43771                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43772                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43773                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43774                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43775                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43776                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43777                                  
 43778                                  JFNFree:
 43779 0000771B 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43780                                  jfnf1:	
 43781 0000771D E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43782 00007720 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43783 00007722 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43784 00007726 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43785 00007728 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43786 00007729 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43787                                  
 43788                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43789                                  jfnf5:	
 43790                                  	;mov	al,4
 43791 0000772B B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43792                                  jfnfx:	
 43793 0000772D C3                      	retn				; bye
 43794                                  
 43795                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43796                                  
 43797                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43798                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43799                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43800                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43801                                  ;
 43802                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43803                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43804                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43805                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43806                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43807                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43808                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43809                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43810                                  ;
 43811                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43812                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43813                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43814                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43815                                  ;
 43816                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43817                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43818                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43819                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43820                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43821                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43822                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43823                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43824                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43825                                  
 43826                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43827                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43828                                  
 43829                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43830                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43831                                  
 43832                                  SFNFree:
 43833                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43834                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43835                                  	;
 43836                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43837 0000772E 50                      	push	ax
 43838 0000772F 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43839                                  sfnf5:	
 43840 00007731 53                      	push	bx
 43841 00007732 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43842 00007735 5B                      	pop	bx
 43843 00007736 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43844 00007738 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43845                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43846 0000773C 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43847                                  	
 43848                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43849 0000773E 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43850                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43851 00007742 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43852                                  sfnf7:	
 43853 00007744 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43854 00007745 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43855                                  
 43856                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43857                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43858                                  ;
 43859                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43860                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43861                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43862                                  
 43863                                  sfnf10:	
 43864 00007747 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43865                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43866 0000774B 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43867 0000774F 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43868 00007751 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43869                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43870 00007755 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43871 00007759 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43872                                  
 43873                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43874                                  ;
 43875                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43876                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43877                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43878                                  
 43879                                  sfnf20:
 43880                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43881                                  
 43882                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43883 0000775B 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43884                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43885                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43886                                  
 43887 00007760 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43888                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43889 00007764 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43890 00007768 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43891                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43892 0000776C 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43893                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43894                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43895                                  	;pop	ax
 43896                                  	;;clc
 43897                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43898                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43899 00007770 58                      	pop	ax
 43900                                  	;clc
 43901 00007771 C3                      	retn
 43902                                  
 43903                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43904                                  ;
 43905                                  ;	'C' set
 43906                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43907                                  
 43908                                  sfnf95: 
 43909 00007772 58                      	pop	ax
 43910                                  
 43911                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43912                                  %if 0
 43913                                  	;mov	al,4
 43914                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43915                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43916                                  %else
 43917                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43918                                  	;;;
 43919 00007773 EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43920                                  	;;;
 43921                                  %endif

 43923                                  ;============================================================================
 43924                                  ; HANDLE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 43925                                  ;============================================================================
 43926                                  ; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43927                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43928                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 43929                                  
 43930                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43931                                  
 43932                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43933                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43934                                  ;
 43935                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43936                                  ;
 43937                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43938                                  ;		path
 43939                                  ;
 43940                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43941                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43942                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43943                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43944                                  ;
 43945                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43946                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43947                                  ;	USES	all
 43948                                  ;
 43949                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43950                                  
 43951                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43952                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43953                                  
 43954                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43955                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B926h
 43956                                  
 43957                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A145h)
 43958                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A72Bh)
 43959                                  
 43960                                  _$CLOSE:
 43961                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43962                                  
 43963 00007775 E8F702                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43964 00007778 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 43965 0000777A 16                      	push	ss
 43966 0000777B 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 43967 0000777C 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43968 00007780 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43969                                  
 43970                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43971                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43972                                  ;
 43973                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43974                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43975                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 43976                                  
 43977                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 43978 00007784 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 43979 00007788 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 43980                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 43981 0000778A 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 43982                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 43983 0000778E 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 43984                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 43985 00007790 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 43986 00007792 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 43987                                  
 43988                                  ; The JFN must be freed. Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 43989                                  ; -1.
 43990                                  
 43991                                  FreeJFN:
 43992 00007794 E827FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; d = pJFN (handle);
 43993 00007797 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 43994                                  PostFree:
 43995                                  
 43996                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 43997                                  
 43998 0000779B E886BF                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 43999                                  
 44000                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 44001                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 44002                                  
 44003 0000779E 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 44004                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 44005 000077A0 B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 44006                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44007                                  CloseOk:
 44008 000077A2 E9C98E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 44009                                  CloseError:
 44010                                  CommitError:	; 11/03/2024
 44011 000077A5 E9D08E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 44012                                  
 44013                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 44014                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44015                                  ;
 44016                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 44017                                  ;
 44018                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 44019                                  ;	flushed out. BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 44020                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check
 44021                                  ;	and fix this!! jgl
 44022                                  ;
 44023                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 44024                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 44025                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Commit
 44026                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 44027                                  ;
 44028                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 44029                                  ;	EXIT	none
 44030                                  ;	USES	all
 44031                                  ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44032                                  
 44033                                  _$COMMIT:
 44034                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 44035                                  
 44036 000077A8 E8C402                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 44037                                  	;JC	short CommitError	; error return
 44038                                  	; 11/03/2024
 44039 000077AB 72F8                    	jc	short CommitError
 44040                                  
 44041 000077AD 16                      	push	ss
 44042 000077AE 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_COMMIT
 44043 000077AF 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 44044 000077B3 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 44045                                  
 44046                                  ;	ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_COMMIT
 44047                                  ;
 44048                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 44049                                  
 44050 000077B7 E819C1                  	call	DOS_COMMIT
 44051 000077BA 72E9                    	JC	short CommitError
 44052                                  	; 07/12/2022
 44053                                  	;jc	short CloseError
