 44645                                  ;BREAK <$DUP - duplicate a jfn>
 44646                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44647                                  ;
 44648                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44649                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 44650                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup
 44651                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 44652                                  ;	  AX has the returned handle
 44653                                  ;   Errors:
 44654                                  ;	    AX = dup_invalid_handle
 44655                                  ;	       = dup_too_many_open_files
 44656                                  ;
 44657                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44658                                  
 44659                                  	; 12/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44660                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BBEBh
 44661                                  
 44662                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A95Bh)
 44663                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A3EFh)
 44664                                  
 44665                                  _$DUP:
 44666 00007943 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; save away old handle in AX
 44667 00007945 E8D3FD                  	call	JFNFree 		; free handle? into ES:DI, new in BX
 44668                                  DupErrorCheck:

 44670 0000794A 06                      	push	es
 44671 0000794B 57                      	push	di			; save away SFT
 44672 0000794C 5E                      	pop	si			; into convenient place DS:SI
 44673 0000794D 1F                      	pop	ds
 44674 0000794E 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX			; get back old handle
 44675 0000794F E81D01                  	call	CheckOwner		; get sft in ES:DI
 44676 00007952 72EC                    	JC	short DupErr		; errors go home
 44677 00007954 E863B7                  	call	DOS_Dup_Direct
 44678 00007957 E864FD                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 44679 0000795A 268A1D                  	MOV	BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFT number
 44680 0000795D 881C                    	MOV	[SI],BL			; stuff in new SFT

 44691                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 44692                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44693                                  ;
 44694                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44695                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 44696                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 44697                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 44698                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 44699                                  ;   Error returns:
 44700                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 44701                                  ;
 44702                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44703                                  
 44704                                  _$DUP2:

 44706 00007962 51                      	push	cx			; save source

 44714                                  ;BREAK <FileTimes - modify write times on a handle>
 44715                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44716                                  ;
 44717                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44718                                  ;	    MOV AH, FileTimes (57H)
 44719                                  ;	    MOV AL, func
 44720                                  ;	    MOV BX, handle
 44721                                  ;	; if AL = 1 then then next two are mandatory
 44722                                  ;	    MOV CX, time
 44723                                  ;	    MOV DX, date
 44724                                  ;	    INT 21h
 44725                                  ;	; if AL = 0 then CX/DX has the last write time/date
 44726                                  ;	; for the handle.
 44727                                  ;
 44728                                  ;	AL=02		 get extended attributes
 44729                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44730                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 44731                                  ;	   DS:SI query list (si=-1, selects all EA)
 44732                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold EA list
 44733                                  ;
 44734                                  ;	AL=03		 get EA name list
 44735                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44736                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 44737                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold name list
 44738                                  ;
 44739                                  ;	AL=04		 set extended attributes
 44740                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44741                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer of EA list

 44743                                  ;
 44744                                  ;   Error returns:

 45061                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 45062                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45063                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 45064                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 45065                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 45066                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 45067                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 45068                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 45069                                  ;
 45070                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 45071                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 45072                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 45073                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 45074                                  ;	USES	none
 45075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45076                                  
 45077                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45078                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45079                                  CheckOwner:
 45080                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45081                                  
 45082 00007A6F E869FC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 45083 00007A72 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 45084                                  
 45085 00007A74 50                      	push	ax
 45086

 45119                                  ;============================================================================
 45120                                  ; MACRO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 45121                                  ;============================================================================
 45122                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 45123                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45124                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45125                                  
 45126                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 45127                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 45128                                  
 45129                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 45130                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 45131                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 45132                                  
 45133                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 45134                                  ;
 45135                                  ;	$AssignOper
 45136                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 45137                                  ;	InitCDS
 45138                                  ;	$UserOper
 45139                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 45140                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 45141                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 45142                                  ;
 45143                                  ;   Revision history:
 45144                                  ;
 45145                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 45146                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 45147                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 45148                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 45149                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 45150                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 45151                                  ;				    aliasing.
 45152                                  ;
 45153                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 45154                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 45155                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 45156                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 45157                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 45158                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 45159                                  ;
 45160                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 45161                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 45162                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 45163                                  ;
 45164                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 45165                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 45166                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 45167                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 45168                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 45169                                  ;
 45170                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 45171                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 45172                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 45173                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 45174                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 45175                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 45176                                  ;
 45177                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 45178                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 45179                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 45180                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 45181                                  ;   number.
 45182                                  ;
 45183                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 45184                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 45185                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 45186                                  ;   TransPath.
 45187                                  ;
 45188                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 45189                                  
 45190                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 45191                                  
 45192                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 45193                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 45194                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 45195                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 45196                                  ;					; current drive)
 45197                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 45198                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 45199                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 45200                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 45201                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 45202                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 45203                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 45204                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 45205                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 45206                                  
 45207                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 45208                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45209                                  ; Inputs:
 45210                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 45211                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 45212                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 45213                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 45214                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 45215                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 45216                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 45217                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 45218                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 45219                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 45220                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 45221                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 45222                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 45223                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 45224                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 45225                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 45226                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 45227                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 45228                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 45229                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 45230                                  ; Function:
 45231                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 45232                                  ; Returns:
 45233                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 45234                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45235

 45338                                  ;**	InitCDS - Setup an Empty CDS
 45339                                  ;

 45343                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS

 45406                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 45407                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45408                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 45409                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 45410                                  ;
 45411                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 45412                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 45413                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 45414                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 45415                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 45416                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 45417                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 45418                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 45419                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 45420                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 45421                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 45422                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45423                                  
 45424                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45425                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 45716                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 45717                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45718                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 45719                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 45720                                  ;
 45721                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 45722                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 45723                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 45724                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 45725                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 45726                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 45727                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45728                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45729                                  
 45730                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45731                                  TransFCB:
 45732                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45733                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45734                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 45735                                  	;ENTER
 45736 00007C07 55                      	push	bp
 45737 00007C08 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 45738                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 45739 00007C0A 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 45740 00007C0D 16                      	push	ss
 45741 00007C0E 07                      	pop	es
 45742 00007C0F 06                      	push	es
 45743 00007C10 57                      	push	di
 45744                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45745                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 45746 00007C11 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 45747 00007C14 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 45748 00007C1A 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45749 00007C20 E827A6                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 45750                                  	; 06/12/2022
 45751 00007C23 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 45752 00007C25 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45753 00007C28 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45754 00007C2C 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45755                                  GetDrive:
 45756 00007C32 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 45757 00007C33 E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV

 45784 00007C4F 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45785 00007C50 07                      	pop	es

 45787 00007C52 1F                      	pop	ds

 45810                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45811                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45812                                  ;
 45813                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45814                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45815                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45816                                  ;       exactly.
 45817                                  ;
 45818                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45819                                  ;       matches splice.
 45820                                  ;
 45821                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45822                                  ;
 45823                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45824                                  ;
 45825                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45826                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45827                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45828                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45829                                  ;
 45830                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45831                                  ;
 45832                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45833                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45834                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45835                                  ;
 45836                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45837                                  ;
 45838                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45839                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45840                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45841                                  ;           splice
 45842                                  ;           fatRead
 45843                                  ;           return
 45844                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45845                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45846                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45847                                  ;           return
 45848                                  ;       if device then
 45849                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45850                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45851                                  ;           return
 45852                                  ;       if file then
 45853                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45854                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45855                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45856                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45857                                  ;           splice
 45858                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45859                                  ;           if local then
 45860                                  ;               fatread
 45861                                  ;           return
 45862                                  ;
 45863                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45864                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45865                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45866                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45867                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45868                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45869                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45870                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45871                                  ;
 45872                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45873                                  
 45874                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45875                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45876                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45877                                  
 45878                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45879                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45880

 46012                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46013                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 46014                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 46015                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 46016                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 46017                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 46018                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 46019                                  ;;;
 46020                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 46021                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 46022                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 46023                                  ;;;
 46024                                  ;;;More info:
 46025                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 46026                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.

 46030                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 46031                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 46032                                  
 46033                                  %endif

 46139

 46141 00007D66 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL

 46149 00007D6E 5E                      	pop	si
 46150 00007D6F 1F                      	pop	ds
 46151                                  
 46152                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 46153                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 46154                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 46156 00007D70 E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 46157 00007D73 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char

 46160                                  ;

 46162                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the

 46166                                  SkipPath:

 46172 00007D84 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 46173

 46175                                  ; for yucks.

 46179 00007D88 AA                      	STOSB

 46182                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 46183                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..

 46187                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.

 46245                                  ; 13/07/2018
 46246                                  
 46247                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 46248                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46249                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 46250                                  ;
 46251                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 46252                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 46253                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 46254                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 46255                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 46256                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 46257                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 46258                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 46259                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 46260                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 46261                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46262                                  
 46263                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46264                                  
 46265                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46266                                  
 46267                                  Canonicalize:
 46268                                  
 46269                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 46270                                  
 46271 00007DDE AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 46272 00007DDF E810E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 46273 00007DE2 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 46274 00007DE4 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 46275 00007DE6 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 46276 00007DE8 AA                      	STOSB
 46277 00007DE9 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 46278                                  CanonDec:
 46279 00007DEB 4E                      	DEC     SI
 46280                                  
 46281                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 46282                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 46283                                  ; buffer.
 46284                                  
 46285                                  CanonLoop:
 46286                                  
 46287                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 46288                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 46289                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 46290                                  
 46291 00007DEC 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 46292 00007DEE 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 46293 00007DF0 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 46294 00007DF2 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 46295 00007DF7 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 46296 00007DF9 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 46297 00007DFB AA                      	STOSB
 46298 00007DFC 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 46299                                  DoTerminate:
 46300 00007DFE AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 46301 00007DFF F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 46302 00007E00 C3                      	retn
 46303                                  
 46304                                  CanonBad:
 46305 00007E01 E8CB01                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 46306                                  	;mov	al,3
 46307 00007E04 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 46308 00007E06 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 46309                                  	;mov	al,2
 46310 00007E08 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 46311                                  PathEnc:
 46312 00007E0A F9                      	STC
 46313                                  CanonBad_retn:
 46314 00007E0B C3                      	retn
 46315                                  
 46316                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 46317                                  ; it to 8.3
 46318                                  
 46319                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 46320 00007E0C E85000                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 46321 00007E0F 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 46322                                  
 46323                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases. These will be backed up.
 46324                                  
 46325                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)

 46340

 46344                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path

 46360

 46373                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char

 46536                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 46537                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46538                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 46539                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 46540                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 46541                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 46542                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 46543                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 46544                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 46545                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 46546                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 46547                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 46548                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 46549                                  ;                   left alone
 46550                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB

 46552                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 46633                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 46634                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46635                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 46636                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 46637                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 46638                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 46639                                  ;
 46640                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 46641                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 46642                                  ;   Outputs:
 46643                                  ;       Carry Clear
 46644                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 46645                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 46646                                  ;       Carry Set
 46647                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 46648                                  ;   Registers modified: all

 46652 00007F73 1E                      	push	ds

 46657                                  	
 46658                                  	; MSDOS 6.0	
 46659                                  ; M027 - Start
 46660                                  ;
 46661                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 46662                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 46663                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 46664                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 46665                                  ; and restore CX.
 46666                                  
 46667                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 46668 00007F78 B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 46669 00007F7A E8E702                  	call	SetAttrib
 46670                                  
 46671                                  ; M027 - End
 46672                                  
 46673                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 46674 00007F7D BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 46675 00007F80 E8E6FC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 46676 00007F83 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 46677 00007F84 5F                      	pop     di
 46678 00007F85 07                      	pop	es
 46679 00007F86 5E                      	pop     si
 46680 00007F87 1F                      	pop     ds

 46721                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 46723                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 46724                                  ;

 46740                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 46741                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46742                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 46743                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 46744                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 46745                                  ;
 46746                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 46747                                  ;               ES:DI string
 46748                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 46749                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 46750                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 46751                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 46752                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46753                                  
 46754                                  PathPref:
 46755 00007FB6 E81E98                  	call	DStrLen                 ; get length
 46756 00007FB9 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 46757 00007FBA F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 46758 00007FBC 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 46759 00007FBE 50                      	push	ax			; save char register

 46763                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK

 46766                                  Prefix:

 46774                                  ;

 46803                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 46804                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 46805                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46806                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46807                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46808                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46809                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46810                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46811                                  ;
 46812                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46813                                  ;       ------          --------
 46814                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46815                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46816                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46817                                  ;
 46818                                  ;   Error returns:
 46819                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46820                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46821                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46822                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46823                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46824                                  
 46825                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46826                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46827                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46828                                  ;
 46829                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46830                                  ;
 46831                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46832                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46833                                  ;
 46834                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46835                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46836                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46837                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46838                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46839                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46840                                  ;	USES	all
 46841                                  ;
 46842                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46843                                  
 46844                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46845                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46846                                  
 46847                                  ; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46848                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C194h

 46850                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A9A7h)

 46864                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 46865                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 46866                                  ;
 46867                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 46868                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 46869                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 46870                                  ;

 46888 00007FF8 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override

 46898                                  	;JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 46899                                  
 46900                                  SaveJFN:

 46902 00008007 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 46903 0000800C 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 46904                                  
 46905                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 46906                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.

 46964                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 46967                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm

 47002                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already
 47003                                  ; opened one. Otherwise we use this new one. We compare uid/pid/mode/mft

 47006                                  ; sharer.

 47082                                  ;

 47084                                  ;	initial attributes contained in CX

 47106                                  ; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 3.3)
 47107                                  ;	BREAK <$CHMOD - change file attributes>
 47108                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47109                                  ;
 47110                                  ;**	$CHMOD - Change File Attributes
 47111                                  ;
 47112                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47113                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 47114                                  ;	    MOV     CX, attributes
 47115                                  ;	    MOV     AL,func (0=get, 1=set)
 47116                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47117                                  ;   Error returns:
 47118                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found
 47119                                  ;	    AX = error_access_denied
 47120                                  ;
 47121                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47122                                  
 47123                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47124                                  
 47125                                  	; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47126                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C27Ch
 47127                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AFF4h)
 47128                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0AAB2h)
 47129                                  
 47130                                  _$CHMOD:
 47131                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47132                                  	;;;
 47133 000080B6 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh		; MS-DOS 7.20 (Win98) - EXTENDED-LENGTH FILENAME OPERATIONS
 47134                                  				; AX = 43FFh
 47135                                  				; BP = 5053h ('PS')
 47136                                  				; CL = function
 47137                                  				; 39h "mkdir" create directory
 47138                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ pathname
 47139                                  				; 56h rename file
 47140                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ filename of existing file (no wildcards)
 47141                                  				; ES:DI -> ASCIZ new filename (no wildcards)
 47142                                  				;
 47143                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
 47144 000080B8 7520                    	jnz	short std_chmod
 47145 000080BA 81FD5350                	cmp	bp,5053h
 47146 000080BE 7515                    	jnz	short chmod_x_2
 47147 000080C0 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 47148                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],128
 47149 000080C2 36C606[5411]80          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],128 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 47150 000080C8 80F939                  	cmp	cl,39h
 47151 000080CB 7503                    	jne	short chmod_x_1
 47152 000080CD E953A7                  	jmp	mkdir_x
 47153                                  chmod_x_1:
 47154 000080D0 80F956                  	cmp	cl,56h
 47155 000080D3 7472                    	je	short rename_x
 47156                                  chmod_x_2:
 47157 000080D5 B001                    	mov	al,1
 47158                                  	;jmp	short NORERR
 47159                                  	; 15/03/2024
 47160                                  NORERR: 
 47161 000080D7 E99E85                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 47162                                  
 47163                                  std_chmod:
 47164                                  	;;;
 47165

 47238                                  	;jmp	short chmod_errj
 47239                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47240                                  	jmp	short NORERR
 47241                                  %endif
 47242                                  
 47243                                  ; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47244                                  ; DOSCODE:B039h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47245                                  
 47246                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47247                                  ; DOSCODE:AFD6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47248                                  
 47249                                  ;	BREAK <$UNLINK - delete a file entry>
 47250                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47251                                  ;
 47252                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 47253                                  ;
 47254                                  ;
 47255                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 47256                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 47257                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 47258                                  ;	     MOV     CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 47259                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 47260                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47261                                  ;
 47262                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 47263                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 47264                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 47265                                  ;		'C' set if error
 47266                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 47267                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 47268                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 47269                                  ;
 47270                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47271                                  
 47272                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47273                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h
 47274                                  
 47275                                  _$UNLINK:
 47276 0000811B 51                      	push	cx			; Save possible CX input parm
 47277 0000811C 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point at input string
 47278 0000811E BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 47279 00008121 E849FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path
 47280 00008124 59                      	pop	cx
 47281 00008125 7216                    	JC	short ChModErr		; badly formed path
 47282 00008127 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	; meta chars?	;smr;SS Override
 47283 0000812D 750E                    	JNZ	short NotFound
 47284 0000812F 16                      	push	ss
 47285 00008130 1F                      	pop	ds
 47286                                  	;mov	ch,6
 47287 00008131 B506                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system ; unlink appropriate files
 47288 00008133 E82E01                  	call	SetAttrib
 47289 00008136 E827AA                  	call	DOS_DELETE		; remove that file
 47290                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 47291                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47292 00008139 729C                    	jc	short NORERR
 47293                                  
 47294                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47295                                  UnlinkOk:
 47296                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; okey doksy
 47297 0000813B EBDB                    	jmp	short OpenOkj3
 47298                                  
 47299                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47300                                  ChModErr:	; 17/12/2022
 47301                                  NotFound:
 47302                                  	;mov	al,3
 47303 0000813D B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 47304                                  ChModE:		; 17/12/2022
 47305                                  UnlinkE:
 47306                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47307                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR		; bye
 47308                                  	;jmp	short ChModE
 47309                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47310 0000813F EB96                    	jmp	short NORERR

 47312                                  ;BREAK <$RENAME - move directory entries around>
 47313                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47314                                  ;
 47315                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47316                                  ;	    LDS     DX, source
 47317                                  ;	    LES     DI, dest
 47318                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 47319                                  ;	      MOV   CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 47320                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Rename
 47321                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47322                                  ;
 47323                                  ;   Error returns:
 47324                                  ;	    AX = error_file_not_found
 47325                                  ;	       = error_not_same_device
 47326                                  ;	       = error_access_denied
 47327                                  ;
 47328                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47329                                  
 47330                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47331                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47332                                  
 47333                                  _$RENAME:
 47334                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47335                                  	;;;
 47336                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67
 47337                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 47338 00008141 36C606[5411]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 47339                                  rename_x:
 47340                                  	;;;
 47341                                  
 47342                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 47343 00008147 51                      	push	cx
 47344 00008148 1E                      	push	ds
 47345 00008149 52                      	push	dx			; save source and possible CX arg
 47346 0000814A 06                      	PUSH	ES
 47347 0000814B 1F                      	POP	DS			; move dest to source
 47348 0000814C 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; save for offsets
 47349 0000814E BF[3E04]                	MOV	DI,RENBUF
 47350 00008151 E819FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; munge the paths
 47351 00008154 36FF36[B205]            	PUSH	word [ss:WFP_START]	; get pointer	;smr;SS Override
 47352 00008159 368F06[B405]            	POP	word [ss:REN_WFP]	; stash it	;smr;SS Override
 47353 0000815E 5E                      	pop	si
 47354 0000815F 1F                      	pop	ds
 47355 00008160 59                      	pop	cx			; get back source and possible CX arg
 47356                                  epjc2:	
 47357 00008161 72DA                    	JC	short ChModErr		; get old error
 47358 00008163 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1			;smr;SS Override
 47359 00008169 75D2                    	JNZ	short NotFound
 47360 0000816B 51                      	push	cx			; Save possible CX arg
 47361 0000816C BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 47362 0000816F E8FBFA                  	call	TransPathSet		; wham
 47363 00008172 59                      	pop	cx
 47364                                  	;JC	short epjc2
 47365                                  	; 15/03/2024
 47366 00008173 72C8                    	jc	short ChModErr
 47367                                  
 47368 00008175 16                      	push	ss
 47369 00008176 1F                      	pop	ds
 47370 00008177 803E[7A05]FF            	CMP	byte [CMETA],-1
 47371 0000817C 72BF                    	JB	short NotFound
 47372                                  
 47373                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 47374                                  	;PUSH	WORD [THISCDS]		   ;AN000;;MS.save thiscds
 47375                                  	;PUSH	WORD [THISCDS+2]	   ;AN000;;MS.
 47376                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47377                                  	;;;
 47378 0000817E C43E[A205]              	les	di,[THISCDS]
 47379 00008182 57                      	push	di
 47380 00008183 06                      	push	es
 47381                                  	;;;
 47382                                  
 47383 00008184 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		   ;AN000;;MS.
 47384 00008187 16                      	PUSH	SS			   ;AN000;;MS.
 47385 00008188 07                      	POP	ES			   ;AN000;;MS.es:di-> source
 47386 00008189 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			   ;AN000;;MS.scan all CDS
 47387                                  rnloop: 				   ;AN000;
 47388 0000818B E859FA                  	call	GetCDSFromDrv		   ;AN000;;MS.
 47389 0000818E 720F                    	JC	short dorn		   ;AN000;;MS.	end of CDS
 47390 00008190 E8FC95                  	call	StrCmp			   ;AN000;;MS.	current dir ?
 47391 00008193 7404                    	JZ	short rnerr		   ;AN000;;MS.	yes
 47392 00008195 FEC0                    	INC	AL			   ;AN000;;MS.	next
 47393 00008197 EBF2                    	JMP	short rnloop		   ;AN000;;MS.
 47394                                  rnerr:					   ;AN000;
 47395                                  	;ADD	SP,4			   ;AN000;;MS. pop thiscds
 47396                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47397 00008199 58                      	pop	ax
 47398 0000819A 58                      	pop	ax
 47399                                  
 47400                                  	;error	error_current_directory    ;AN000;;MS.
 47401 0000819B B010                    	mov	al,error_current_directory
 47402                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 47403                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47404 0000819D EBA0                    	jmp	short UnlinkE
 47405                                  dorn:
 47406                                  
 47407                                  ; 15/03/2024
 47408                                  %if 0					   ;AN000;
 47409                                  	POP	WORD [SS:THISCDS+2]	   ;AN000;;MS.;PBUGBUG;SS REQD??
 47410                                  	POP	WORD [SS:THISCDS]	   ;AN000;;MS.;PBUGBUG;SS REQD??
 47411                                  %endif
 47412 0000819F 16                      	push	ss
 47413 000081A0 1F                      	pop	ds
 47414

 47416                                  %if 1
 47417 000081A1 8F06[A405]              	pop	word [THISCDS+2]
 47418 000081A5 8F06[A205]              	pop	word [THISCDS]
 47419                                  %endif
 47420                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 47421                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 47422 000081A9 B516                    	mov	ch,attr_directory+attr_hidden+attr_system
 47423                                  					; rename appropriate files
 47424 000081AB E8B600                  	call	SetAttrib
 47425 000081AE E8C2AB                  	call	DOS_RENAME		; do the deed
 47426 000081B1 728C                    	JC	short UnlinkE 		; errors
 47427

 47429                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 47430 000081B3 EB86                    	jmp	short UnlinkOk

 47432                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
