 52559                                  ;============================================================================
 52560                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52561                                  ;============================================================================
 52562                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 52563                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 52564                                  
 52565                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 52566                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52567                                  
 52568                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 52569                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 52570                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 52571                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 52572                                  ;
 52573                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 52574                                  ; describing that data item.
 52575                                  
 52576                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 52577                                  
 52578                                  ;
 52579                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 52580                                  ;
 52581                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 52582                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 52583                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 52584                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 52585                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 52586                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 52587                                  ;
 52588                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 52589                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 52590                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 52591                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 52592                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 52593                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 52594                                  ;   as EOF).
 52595                                  
 52596                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 52597                                  
 52598                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 52599                                  
 52600                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 52601 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 52602 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 52603                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 52604 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 52605                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 52606 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 52607                                  
 52608                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 52609                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 52610                                  ; console.
 52611                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 52612 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 52613 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 52614                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 52615 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 52616 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 52617                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 52618 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 52619 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 52620 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 52621                                  switch_character:
 52622 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 52623 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 52624 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 52625 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 52626 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name

 52836                                  ;============================================================================
 52837                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52838                                  ;============================================================================
 52839                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 52840                                  
 52841                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 52842                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 52843                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 52844                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 52845                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 52846                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 52847                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 52848                                  ; **********************************************************
 52849                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 52850                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 52851                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 52852                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 52853                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 52854                                  ; **********************************************************	
 52855                                  
 52856                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 52857                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52858                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 52859                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 52860                                  
 52861                                  ; 	ORG     0
 52862                                  
 52863                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 52864                                  
 52865                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 52866                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 52867 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 52868 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 52869                                  
 52870                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 52871                                  
 52872                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 52873                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 52874 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 52875                                  RENBUF:	
 52876 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 52877                                  
 52878                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 52879                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 52880 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 52881                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 52882 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 52883                                  
 52884                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 52885                                   
 52886                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 52887                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 52888                                  
 52889                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 52890                                  
 52891                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 52892                                  
 52893                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 52894                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 52895                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 52896                                  
 52897                                  NAME1:	
 52898 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 52899                                  NAME2:
 52900 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 52901                                  DESTSTART:
 52902 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 52903                                          ;DB	((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 52904                                  	;times	5  db	0
 52905 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 52906                                  
 52907                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 52908                                  
 52909 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 52910                                  EXTFCB:	
 52911 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 52912                                  SATTRIB:
 52913 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes
 52914                                  OPEN_ACCESS:
 52915 0000056E 00                      	db	0		; access of open system call
 52916                                  FOUNDDEL:
 52917 0000056F 00                      	db	0		; true => file was deleted
 52918                                  FOUND_DEV:
 52919 00000570 00                      	db	0		; true => search found a device
 52920                                  FSPLICE:
 52921 00000571 00                      	db	0		; true => do a splice in transpath
 52922                                  FSHARING:
 52923 00000572 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => no redirection
 52924                                  SECCLUSPOS:
 52925 00000573 00                      	db	0		; Position of first sector within cluster
 52926 00000574 00                      TRANS:	db	0		;
 52927 00000575 00                      READOP:	db	0		;
 52928                                  THISDRV:
 52929 00000576 00                      	db	0		;
 52930                                  CLUSFAC:
 52931 00000577 00                      	db	0		;
 52932                                  CLUSSPLIT:
 52933 00000578 00                      	db	0		;
 52934                                  INSMODE:
 52935 00000579 00                      	db	0		; true => insert mode in buffered read
 52936 0000057A 00                      CMETA:	db	0		; count of meta'ed components found
 52937 0000057B 00                      VOLID:	db	0		;
 52938                                  EXIT_TYPE:
 52939 0000057C 00                      	db	0		; type of exit...
 52940                                  	; 24/03/2024	 
 52941 0000057D 00                      	db	0   ; PCDOS 7.1 - DOSDATA:057Dh
 52942                                  	;db	90h ; MSDOS 6.22 - DOSDATA:057Dh
 52943

 53449                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h
 53450                                  ; 24/03/2024
 53451                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 53452                                  
 53453                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53454                                  ;
 53455                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 53456                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 53457                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 53458                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 53459                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 53460                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53461                                  ; Example:
 53462                                  
 53463                                  MAP_CASE:
 53464                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 53465                                  
 53466 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 53467                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 53468                                  	;RETF
 53469                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53470                                  	;;;
 53471 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 53472                                  	;;;
 53473                                  Map1:
 53474 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 53475 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 53476 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 53477 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 53478                                  FINISH:
 53479 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 53480 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 53481 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 53482 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 53483 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 53484                                  L_RET:	
 53485 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 53486                                  
 53487                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 53488                                  
 53489                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53490

 53816                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 53817                                  ; 
 53818                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 53819                                  ;
 53820                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 53821                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 53822                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 53823                                  ;
 53824                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 53825                                  ;
 53826                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 53827                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 53828                                  ;
 53829                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 53830                                  ;
 53831                                  ;############################################################################
 53832                                  
 53833                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 53834                                  
 53835                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53836                                  ; 24/03/2024
 53837                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 53838                                  
 53839                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53840                                  ;
 53841                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 53842                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 53843                                  ;
 53844                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 53845                                  ;
 53846                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 53847                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 53848                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 53849                                  ;
 53850                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53851                                  
 53852                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 53853                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 53854                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 53855                                  ;ELSE
 53856                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 53857                                  ;ENDIF
 53858                                  ;ENDM
 53859

 54212                                  
 54213                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54214                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 54215                                  ;
 54216                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the
 54217                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data)
 54218                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 54219                                  ;
 54220                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 54221                                  ;
 54222                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 54223                                  ;
 54224                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54225                                  
 54226 00000F5D 36F6062003FF            	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 54227 00000F63 750C                    	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 54228 00000F65 36FF365803              	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 54229 00000F6A CD28                    	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 54230                                  
 54231                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54232                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 54233                                  ;
 54234                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 54235                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in
 54236                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 54237                                  ;
 54238                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54239                                  
 54240 00000F6C 803E200300              	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 54241 00000F71 7537                    	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 54242 00000F73 BCA00A                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack

 54311                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54312                                  ;
 54313                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 54314                                  ;
 54315                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 54316                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 54317                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 54318                                  ;
 54319                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 54320                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 54321                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 54322                                  ;	   4. else 
 54323                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 54324                                  ;	   6. endif
 54325                                  ;	7. else
 54326                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 54327                                  ;	9. endif
 54328                                  ;
 54329                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54330                                  
 54331                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 54332                                  
 54333                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 54334                                  
 54335                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54336                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 54337                                  
 54338                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54339                                  ;
 54340                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 54341                                  ;
 54342                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54343                                  
 54344                                  ldivov:
 54345                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54346                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54347                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54348                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54349                                  i0patch:
 54350 00000F9E EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 54351                                  
 54352 00000FA0 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54353                                  divov_cont:
 54354 00000FA3 2EFF2E[7A0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 54355                                  
 54356                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54357                                  ;
 54358                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 54359                                  ;
 54360                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 54361                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 54362                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 54363                                  ; will be restored then.
 54364                                  ;
 54365                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54366                                  
 54367                                  lquit:
 54368                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54369                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54370                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54371                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54372                                  i20patch:
 54373 00000FA8 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 54374                                  
 54375 00000FAA E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54376                                  quit_cont:
 54377 00000FAD 2EFF2E[7E0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 54378                                  
 54379                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54380                                  ;
 54381                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 54382                                  ;
 54383                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54384                                  
 54385                                  lcommand:
 54386                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54387                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54388                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54389                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54390                                  i21patch:
 54391 00000FB2 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 54392                                  
 54393 00000FB4 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54394                                  command_cont:
 54395 00000FB7 2EFF2E[820F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 54396                                  
 54397                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54398                                  ;
 54399                                  ; INT 25h
 54400                                  ;
 54401                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54402                                  
 54403                                  labsdrd:
 54404                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54405                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54406                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54407                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54408                                  i25patch:
 54409 00000FBC EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 54410                                  
 54411 00000FBE E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54412                                  absdrd_cont:
 54413 00000FC1 2EFF2E[860F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 54414                                  
 54415                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54416                                  ;
 54417                                  ; INT 26h
 54418                                  ;
 54419                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54420                                  
 54421                                  labsdwrt:
 54422                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54423                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54424                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54425                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54426                                  i26patch:
 54427 00000FC6 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 54428

 54430                                  absdwrt_cont:
 54431 00000FCB 2EFF2E[8A0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 54432

 54436                                  ;
 54437                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54438

 54441                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54442                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54443                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54444                                  i27patch:

 54448                                  sr_cont:
 54449 00000FD5 2EFF2E[8E0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 54450

 54453                                  ; INT 2Fh
 54454                                  ;
 54455                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54456                                  
 54457                                  lint2f:
 54458                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54459                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54460                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54461                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54462                                  i2fpatch:
 54463 00000FDA EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont

 54466                                  int2f_cont:

 54474

 54477                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is

 54480                                  cpmpatch:

 54482                                  
 54483 00000FE6 E89C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54484                                  callentry_cont:
 54485 00000FE9 2EFF2E[960F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 54486                                  
 54487                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54488                                  
 54489                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54490                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54491                                  %if 0
 54492                                  
 54493                                  lirett:
 54494                                  	iret
 54495                                  
 54496                                  %endif
 54497                                  
 54498                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54499                                  ;
 54500                                  ; LowIntXX:
 54501                                  ;
 54502                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 54503                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 54504                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 54505                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 54506                                  ;
 54507                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 54508                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 54509                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 54510                                  ;
 54511                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 54512                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 54513                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 54514                                  ;
 54515                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54516                                  
 54517                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54518                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 54519                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 54520                                  
 54521 00000FEE 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 54522 00000FF2 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 54523                                  
 54524                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54525                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54526                                  %if 0
 54527                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 54528                                  %endif
 54529                                  
 54530                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 54531                                  LowInt23:
 54532                                  					; save the return address that is on
 54533                                  					; the stack
 54534 00000FF6 2E8F06[EE0F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 54535 00000FFB 2E8F06[F00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 54536                                  
 54537 00001000 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 54538                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54539                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54540                                  
 54541 00001002 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54542                                  
 54543 00001005 2EFF2E[EE0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 54544                                  
 54545                                  
 54546                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 54547                                  LowInt24:
 54548                                  					; save the return address that is on
 54549                                  					; the stack
 54550 0000100A 2E8F06[F20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 54551 0000100F 2E8F06[F40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 54552                                  
 54553 00001014 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 54554                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54555                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54556                                  
 54557 00001016 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54558                                  
 54559 00001019 2EFF2E[F20F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 54560                                  
 54561                                  
 54562                                   
 54563                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 54564                                  LowInt28:
 54565 0000101E CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 54566                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54567                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54568                                  
 54569 00001020 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54570                                  
 54571 00001023 CB                      	retf
 54572                                  
 54573                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 54574                                  
 54575                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54576                                  ;
 54577                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 54578                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 54579                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 54580                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 54581                                  ;
 54582                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 54583                                  
 54584                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54585                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 54586                                  
 54587                                  disa20_xfer:
 54588 00001024 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 54589                                  
 54590                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 54591                                  
 54592                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 54593                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 54594                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 54595                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 54596                                  
 54597 00001027 FA                      	cli
 54598 00001028 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 54599                                  
 54600                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54601                                  	;;;
 54602 0000102E 36C606[B812]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 54603                                  	;;;
 54604                                  
 54605 00001034 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 54606 00001036 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 54607 00001038 FB                      	sti
 54608                                  
 54609 00001039 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 54610 0000103A 56                      	push	SI
 54611 0000103B 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 54612 0000103D 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 54613 0000103F 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 54614 00001041 CB                      	retf
 54615                                  
 54616                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54617                                  ;
 54618                                  ; M003:
 54619                                  ;
 54620                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 54621                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 54622                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 54623                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 54624                                  ; more info.
 54625                                  ;
 54626                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 54627                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 54628                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 54629                                  ;
 54630                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54631                                  
 54632                                  disa20_iret:
 54633 00001042 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 54634 00001045 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 54635                                  
 54636                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54637                                  	;;;
 54638 00001049 FE0E[B812]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 54639                                  	;;;
 54640                                  
 54641 0000104D 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 54642 00001051 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 54643 00001055 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 54644                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 54645 00001057 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 54646                                  	
 54647                                  ; 25/03/2024
 54648                                  %if 0
 54649                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 54650                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 54651                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 54652                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 54653                                  %else
 54654                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54655                                  	;;;
 54656                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 54657 0000105A C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 54658 0000105E 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 54659 00001062 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 54660                                  	;;;
 54661                                  %endif
 54662 00001065 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 54663 00001066 5B                      	pop	BX
 54664 00001067 59                      	pop	CX
 54665 00001068 5A                      	pop	DX
 54666 00001069 5E                      	pop	SI
 54667 0000106A 5F                      	pop	DI
 54668 0000106B 5D                      	pop	BP
 54669 0000106C 1F                      	pop	DS
 54670 0000106D 07                      	pop	ES
 54671                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54672 0000106E CF                      	iret
 54673                                  
 54674                                  ;**************************************************************************
 54675                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 54676                                  ;
 54677                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 54678                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 54679                                  ;
 54680                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 54681                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 54682                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 54683                                  ;
 54684                                  ;**************************************************************************
 54685                                  
 54686                                  XMMDisableA20:
 54687 0000106F 53                      	push	bx
 54688 00001070 50                      	push	ax
 54689                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 54690 00001071 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 54691 00001073 2EFF1E[7B10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 54692 00001078 58                      	pop	ax
 54693 00001079 5B                      	pop	bx
 54694 0000107A C3                      	retn
 54695                                  
 54696                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 54697                                  
 54698                                  XMMcontrol:
 54699 0000107B 00000000                	dd	0
 54700                                  
 54701                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54702                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 54705 0000107F 00000000                	dd	0
 54706                                  SC_STATUS:
 54707 00001083 0000                    	dw	0

 54709                                  
 54710                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54711                                  ;
 54712                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 54713                                  ;
 54714                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 54715                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 54716                                  ;
 54717                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 54718                                  ;
 54719                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 54720                                  ;		
 54721                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 54722                                  ;
 54723                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54724                                  
 54725                                  ; 19/09/2023
 54726                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 54727                                  ;	dw	00080h
 54728                                  ;	dw	00000h
 54729                                  ;
 54730                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 54731                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 54732                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 54733                                  
 54734                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54735                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 54736                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 54737                                  
 54738                                  EnsureA20ON:
 54739 00001085 9C                      	pushf
 54740 00001086 1E                      	push    ds
 54741 00001087 06                      	push	es
 54742 00001088 51                      	push	cx
 54743 00001089 56                      	push	si
 54744 0000108A 57                      	push	di
 54745                                  
 54746                                  	; 19/09/2023
 54747                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 54748                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 54749                                  
 54750                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 54751                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54752                                  	;;;
 54753 0000108B 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 54754 0000108D 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 54755 0000108F 4E                      	dec	si
 54756 00001090 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 54757 00001093 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 54758 00001095 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 54759                                  	;;;	
 54760                                  
 54761 00001098 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 54762 0000109B FC                      	cld
 54763 0000109C F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 54764                                  
 54765 0000109E 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 54766                                  EA20_RET:
 54767 000010A0 5F                      	pop	di
 54768 000010A1 5E                      	pop	si
 54769 000010A2 59                      	pop	cx
 54770 000010A3 07                      	pop	es
 54771 000010A4 1F                      	pop	ds
 54772 000010A5 9D                      	popf
 54773 000010A6 C3                      	retn
 54774                                  
 54775                                  EA20_OFF:
 54776                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 54777                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 54778                                  
 54779 000010A7 53                      	push	bx
 54780 000010A8 50                      	push	ax
 54781                                  
 54782                                  ; 25/03/2024
 54783                                  %if 0
 54784                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 54785                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 54786                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 54787                                  	mov	ax,cs
 54788                                  	mov	ss,ax
 54789                                  %else
 54790                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54791                                  	;;;
 54792 000010A9 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 54793 000010AB 2E8C16[9A0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 54794 000010B0 2E8926[9C0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 54795 000010B5 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 54796                                  	;;;
 54797                                  %endif
 54798 000010B7 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 54799                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 54800                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 54801 000010BA B405                    	mov	ah,5
 54802 000010BC 2EFF1E[7B10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 54803 000010C1 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 54804 000010C3 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 54805                                  
 54806                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 54807                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 54808                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54809                                  	;;;
 54810 000010C5 2E8E16[9A0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 54811                                  	;;;
 54812 000010CA 2E8B26[9C0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 54813                                  
 54814 000010CF 58                      	pop	ax
 54815 000010D0 5B                      	pop	bx
 54816                                  
 54817 000010D1 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 54818                                  
 54819                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 54820 000010D3 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 54821 000010D5 CD10                    	int	10h
 54822 000010D7 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 54823 000010D9 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 54824                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 54825                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 54826                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54827                                  	;;;
 54828 000010DB B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 54829                                  	;;;
 54830 000010DE CD10                    	int	10h
 54831                                  XMMcont:
 54832                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 54833                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 54834                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54835                                  	;;;
 54836 000010E0 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 54837                                  	;;;
 54838 000010E3 CD10                    	int	10h
 54839                                  	
 54840 000010E5 BE[1312]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 54841 000010E8 0E                      	push	cs
 54842 000010E9 1F                      	pop	ds
 54843 000010EA FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 54844                                  XMMprnt:
 54845 000010EB AC                      	lodsb
 54846 000010EC 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 54847 000010EE 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 54848 000010F0 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 54849 000010F2 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 54850 000010F5 CD10                    	int	10h
 54851 000010F7 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 54852                                  
 54853                                  XMMStall:
 54854 000010F9 FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 54855 000010FA EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End

 55141                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 55142                                  ;
 55143                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 55144                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 55145                                  ;
 55146                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 55147                                  ;
 55148                                  ;   DVRDRAW:

 55171                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry

 55177                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS

 55210                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.

 55223

 55225 00001205 3C24                    		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'

 55272                                  ;
 55273                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 55274                                  ;
 55275                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 55276                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 55277                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 55278                                  ;
 55279                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 55280                                  ;
 55281                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!

 55286                                  
 55287                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 55288                                  
 55289                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 55290                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55291                                  
 55292                                  ; 17/01/2024
 55293                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55294                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55295                                  ; 09/03/2024
 55296                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55297                                  
 55298                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 55299                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 55300                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 55301                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 55302                                  
 55303                                  ; country and code page information
 55304                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55305                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 55306 0000122A 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 55307 00001232 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 55307 0000123B 53595300           
 55308                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 55309 0000123F 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 55310                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55311                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 55312                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 55313                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 55314                                  ;  endif
 55315                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 55316                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 55317                                  ;  endif
 55318                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 55319                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 55320                                  ;  endif
 55321                                  ;else
 55322 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 55323                                  ;endif
 55324                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55325 00001274 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 55326                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 55327 00001276 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 55328 00001277 [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 55329 00001279 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55330 0000127B 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 55331 0000127C [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 55332 0000127E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55333 00001280 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 55334 00001281 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 55335 00001283 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55336 00001285 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 55337 00001286 [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 55338 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55339 0000128A 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 55340 0000128B [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 55341 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 55342 0000128F 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 55343 00001290 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 55344                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55345                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 55346                                  ;	......
 55347                                  ;else
 55348                                  	; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 55349                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1292h
 55350                                  _COUNTRY_ID:
 55351 00001292 0100                    	dw   1				; USA country id
 55352 00001294 B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 55353                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_108: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 108	
 55354 00001296 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 55355 00001298 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 55356 0000129D 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 55357 0000129F 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator
 55358 000012A1 2D00                    	db   '-',0			; date separator
 55359 000012A3 3A00                    	db   ':',0			; time separator
 55360 000012A5 00                      	db   0				; currency format flag
 55361 000012A6 02                      	db   2				; # of digits in currency
 55362 000012A7 00                      	db   0 				; time format
 55363 000012A8 [6B0D]                  	dw   MAP_CASE			; mono case routine entry point
 55364 000012AA 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point

 55678                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 55679                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 55680                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 55681                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 55682                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 55683                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 55684                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 55685                                  
 55686                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55687                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55688                                  
 55689                                  ; 06/12/2022
 55690                                  ;DOSDATASIZE	equ  $ - DOSDATASTART ; 4962 bytes (1362h)
 55691                                  
 55692                                  ; DOSDATA ends
 55693                                  
 55694                                  ; 05/01/2024
 55695                                  %endif	; 05/11/2022
 55696                                  
 55697                                  ;============================================================================
 55698                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 55699                                  ;============================================================================
 55700                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 55701                                  
 55702                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 55703                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 55704                                  ;
 55705                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 55706                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 55707                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 55708                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 55709                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 55710                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 55711                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 55712                                  ; to call out here.
 55713                                  ;
 55714                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 55715                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 55716                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 55717                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 55718                                  ;
 55719                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 55720                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 55721                                  ;
 55722                                  ;Exported Functions
 55723                                  ;==================
 55724                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 55725                                  
 55726                                  ; DosData Segment
 55727                                  
 55728                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 55729                                  
 55730                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55731                                  
 55732                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 55733                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 55734                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 55735                                  ; 'patch' related.
 55736                                  
 55737                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 55738 0000133E 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 55739                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55740                                  
 55741                                  ; 25/03/2024
 55742                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 55743                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 55744                                  
 55745                                  MagicPatch:
 55746                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 55747 00001340 CB                              retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 55748 00001341 90                              nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 55749 00001342 90                              nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 55750 00001343 90                              nop             ; call far ?:?     
 55751 00001344 90                              nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 55752 00001345 90                              nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 55753                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 55754                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 55755                                  
 55756                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55757                                  
 55758                                  ;DosData Ends
 55759                                  
 55760                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 55761                                  ;
 55762                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 55763                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 55764                                  
 55765                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 55766                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 55767                                  
 55768                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)
 55769                                  
 55770                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55771                                  
 55772                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 55773                                  
 55774                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 55775                                  
 55776                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55777                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 55778                                  
 55779                                  ;db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 55780                                  
 55781                                  ;align 16
 55782                                  
 55783                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 55784                                  
 55785                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55786                                  
 55787                                  ; 05/01/2024
 55788                                  ;%endif	; 05/11/2022
 55789                                  
 55790                                  ; 05/12/2022
 55791                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 55792                                  
 55793                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 55794                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55795                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 55796                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 55797                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 55798                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 55799                                  					; (= 4944 for Windows ME IO.SYS)
 55800                                  ;DOSDATALAST ENDS
